module.name: ComCtrls
module.short: Common controls used in Lazarus forms.

descr.p: comctrls.pp contains classes and types like those found in the Delphi comctrls unit.
The following components are added to the Lazarus IDE:
Common Controls Tab
The following components are added but not displayed on the component palette:
This file is part of the LCL package.

element.name: THitTest
element.short: Represents permissible results for a hit test.

descr.p: THitTest is an enumerated type with values that represent permissible results for a hit test (position of a mouse click etc relative to objects on a form). Values from THitTest are stored in the THitTests set type.

element.name: THitTest.htAbove
element.short: The action was above the coordinates for the control.

element.name: THitTest.htBelow
element.short: The action was below the coordinates for the control.

element.name: THitTest.htNowhere
element.short: The action was not near the control checking for the event.

element.name: THitTest.htOnItem
element.short: The action was on the control checking for the event.

element.name: THitTest.htOnButton
element.short: The action was on a button in the control.

element.name: THitTests
element.short: THitTests - set of THitTest.

element.name: TStatusPanelStyle
element.short: Represents the style used for a panel on a status bar.

descr.p: TStatusPanelStyle is an enumerated type representing the style used for a panel on a status bar. TStatusPanelStyle is the type used to implement the Style property in TStatusPanel, and used in widgetset classes which initialize or update a status bar panel.

element.name: TStatusPanelStyle.psText
element.short: The panel contains Text.

element.name: TStatusPanelStyle.psOwnerDraw
element.short: The panel uses an owner-drawn style (generally implemented in an event handler).

element.name: TStatusPanelBevel
element.short: Enumerated type with the bevel styles used on status bar panels.

descr.p: TStatusPanelBevel is an enumerated type with values which represent bevel styles used on status bar panels. TStatusPanelBevel is the type used to implement the Style property in TStatusPanel.

element.name: TStatusPanelBevel.pbNone
element.short: No bevel is drawn on a panel.

element.name: TStatusPanelBevel.pbLowered
element.short: Drawn using a lowered bevel style.

element.name: TStatusPanelBevel.pbRaised
element.short: Drawn using a raised bevel style.

element.name: TPanelPart
element.short: Lists the possible parts that make up a status panel.

descr.p: TPanelPart is an enumerated type listing the possible parts that make up a status panel.

element.name: TPanelPart.ppText
element.short: Panel part contains text with text alignment.

element.name: TPanelPart.ppBorder
element.short: Panel parts contains a bevel style.

element.name: TPanelPart.ppWidth
element.short: Panel part contains a width value.

element.name: TPanelParts
element.short: Set type used to store TPanelPart values.

descr.p: TPanelParts is a set type used to store TPanelPart values.

element.name: TStatusPanelClass
element.short: Class reference used to create new instances of TStatusPanel.

descr.p: TStatusPanelClass is the type returned by the GetPanelClass method in TStatusBar. The class reference is used in the CreatePanel method in TStatusBar to create a new panel for the control.

element.name: TStatusPanel
element.short: Implements a panel displayed in TStatusBar.

descr.p: TStatusPanel is a TCollectionItem descendant which implements panels used in TStatusBar. Instances of the class are created by and stored in a TStatusPanels collection in a TStatusBar control. Use the properties in the panel to control its appearance, size, and textual content.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetAlignment
element.short: Gets the value for the Alignment property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetAlignment.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetBevel
element.short: Sets the value for the Bevel property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetBevel.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the Style property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetStyle.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetText
element.short: Sets the value for the Text property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetText.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the Width property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetWidth.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusPanel.FIntfFlag
element.short: Field used by Widgetset classes. Do not use it in the LCL.
element.descr: Field used by Widgetset classes. Do not use it in the LCL.

element.name: TStatusPanel.GetDisplayName
element.short: Gets the value displayed as the name for the collection item.

descr.p: GetDisplayName is an overridden String function which returns the value displayed as the name of the collection item. The value in the Text property is used as the return value when it is not an empty string (''). Otherwise, the inherited GetDisplayName method is called to get the return value.

element.name: TStatusPanel.GetDisplayName.Result
element.short: Value displayed as the name for the collection item.

element.name: TStatusPanel.PanelChanged
element.short: PanelChanged - method for dealing with a status panel, one or more of whose parts has changed.

element.name: TStatusPanel.SetIndex
element.short: SetIndex saves the old index value, checks that the supplied value is different and then calls inherited method.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TStatusPanel: sets default width, alignment and bevel, calls inherited Create and loads into StatusBar.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Create.aCollection
element.short: Collection which owns the status panel.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TStatusPanel: calls inherited Destroy and removes itself from the StatusBar.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Assign
element.short: Assign copies text, width, alignment, bevel and style properties from Source if it is of correct type, otherwise calls inherited Assign (which will probably raise an exception).

element.name: TStatusPanel.Assign.Source
element.short: Class instance with the values stored in the status panel.

element.name: TStatusPanel.StatusBar
element.short: The StatusBar that contains this StatusPanel

element.name: TStatusPanel.StatusBar.Result
element.short: Status bar where the panel is displayed.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether left- or right-justified or centered.
element.descr: Only supported on Windows.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Bevel
element.short: The type of Bevel for the display.
element.descr: Only supported on Windows.

element.name: TStatusPanel.BiDiMode
element.short: Introduces BiDiMode support not present in the ancestor class.

element.name: TStatusPanel.ParentBiDiMode
element.short: Introduces BiDiMode support not present in the ancestor class.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Style
element.short: Style - whether text or something drawn by the owner.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Text
element.short: Text - the string for display in the StatusBar.

element.name: TStatusPanel.Width
element.short: The Width of this panel on the StatusBar.

element.name: TStatusPanels
element.short: TStatusPanels - the collection of Status Panels in this StatusBar.

element.name: TStatusPanels.GetItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: TStatusPanels.GetItem.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TStatusPanels.GetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested collection item.

element.name: TStatusPanels.SetItem
element.short: Sets the value in the indexed Items property.

element.name: TStatusPanels.SetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item stored in the method.

element.name: TStatusPanels.SetItem.Value
element.short: New value for the collection item.

element.name: TStatusPanels.GetOwner
element.short: GetOwner returns a Status Bar overriding the inherited method.

element.name: TStatusPanels.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Persistent object that owns the status panel.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Update
element.short: Ensures that observers are notified when he specified collection item has been changed.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Update.Item
element.short: Collection item for the notification.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.
element.descr: Create - constructor for TStatusPanels: calls inherited Create and attaches itself to StatusBar.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Create.TheStatusBar
element.short: The control where the status panel is displayed.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Add
element.short: Adds a new TStatusPanel instance to the collection.
element.p: Calls the inherited Add method and casts the result to TStatusPanel for use as the return value. Calls the UpdateHandleObject method in StatusBar to ensure that an update sequence is started when the handle for the status bar has been allocated.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Add.Result
element.short: Status panel added in the method.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to the TStatusPanel items in the collection.

element.name: TStatusPanels.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item.

element.name: TStatusPanels.StatusBar
element.short: The StatusBar to which this collection of Status Panels belongs.

element.name: TSBCreatePanelClassEvent
element.short: TSBCreatePanelClassEvent - generic event handling procedure for creating a Status Bar panel class.

element.name: TDrawPanelEvent
element.short: Specified an event handler used to draw a panel in a status bar.

descr.p: TDrawPanelEvent is the type used to implement the OnDrawPanel property in TStatusBar.

element.name: TDrawPanelEvent.StatusBar
element.short: Status bar for the event notification.

element.name: TDrawPanelEvent.Panel
element.short: Panel drawn by the event handler.

element.name: TDrawPanelEvent.Rect
element.short: Drawing area for the event notification.

element.name: TStatusBar
element.short: TStatusBar - a strip along the bottom of a form for displaying information on current status.

descr.p: TStatusBar - a strip along the bottom of a form for displaying information on current status. The bar may consist of a single SimplePanel in which case the displayed text is contained in SimpleText.
However if SimplePanel is false, then there can be multiple panels or sub-sections of the status bar whose properties are described in Panels.
The property SimpleText can be assigned in code to display the value of some variable, such as the position of the Splitter in the example.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetPanels
element.short: Sets the value for the Panels property.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetPanels.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetSimpleText
element.short: Sets the value for the SimpleText property.

descr.p: Notifies the widgetset class of the value change when a handle has been allocated and SimplePanel is set to True.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetSimpleText.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetSimplePanel
element.short: Sets the value for the SimplePanel property.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetSimplePanel.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetSizeGrip
element.short: Sets the value for the SizeGrip property.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetSizeGrip.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusBar.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd calls inherited method, then fixes handles if needed.

element.name: TStatusBar.DestroyWnd
element.short: DestroyWnd calls inherited method and frees handles.

element.name: TStatusBar.Loaded
element.short: Loaded calls inherited method and fixes handles if needed.

element.name: TStatusBar.UpdateHandleObject
element.short: UpdateHandleObject - updates all panel parts that have been changed.

element.name: TStatusBar.CalculatePreferredSize
element.short: CalculatePreferredSize calls inherited method then supplies its own values if any are missing.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetBiDiMode
element.short: Sets the value in the BiDiMode property.

descr.p: Ensures that all panels in the status bar update their alignment to match the new value for the property. Calls UpdateHandleObject to ensure that an update sequence is started for the control when its handle has been assigned.

element.name: TStatusBar.SetBiDiMode.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TStatusBar.CreatePanel
element.short: CreatePanel - returns a created Status Panel.

element.name: TStatusBar.CreatePanel.Result
element.short: Status panel creates in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.CreatePanels
element.short: CreatePanels - returns a set of created panels.

element.name: TStatusBar.CreatePanels.Result
element.short: Status panels created in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.GetPanelClass
element.short: GetPanelClass - returns a class of status panel.

element.name: TStatusBar.GetPanelClass.Result
element.short: Class type used for status panels.

element.name: TStatusBar.DoSetApplicationHint
element.short: DoSetApplicationHint - specifies a hint string and returns True if successful.

element.name: TStatusBar.DoHint
element.short: Displays the hint for the status bar.
element.descr: DoHint shows the hint text for the control and returns True when successful. Uses the OnHint event handler.

element.name: TStatusBar.DrawPanel
element.short: DrawPanel calls the OnDrawPanel event handler if assigned.

element.name: TStatusBar.DrawPanel.Panel
element.short: Panel to draw in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.DrawPanel.Rect
element.short: Display rectangle for the drawing operation.

element.name: TStatusBar.LMDrawItem
element.short: LMDrawItem - LCL message handler for drawing the item on the current canvas.

element.name: TStatusBar.LMDrawItem.Message
element.short: Message handled in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.DoAutoAdjustLayout
element.short: Performs actions needed to apply the layout policy in AMode.

descr.p: Calls BeginUpdate to reduce the number of refreshes needed when updating panels in the status bar. Adjusts the width of all items in the Panels collection using the factor in AXProportion. The value in AYProportion is ignored in the method. Calls EndUpdate prior to exit from the method.
descr.remark: No actions are performed in the method when AMode contains a TLayoutAdjustmentPolicy value other than lapAutoAdjustWithoutHorizontalScrolling or lapAutoAdjustForDPI.

element.name: TStatusBar.DoAutoAdjustLayout.Mode
element.short: Layout policy applied in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AXProportion
element.short: Horizontal sizing factor applied to panels in the status bar.

element.name: TStatusBar.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AYProportion
element.short: Vertical sizing factor applied to panels in the status bar.

element.name: TStatusBar.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TStatusBar. It calls the inherited Create method, and initializes a number of local variables, including:

element.name: TStatusBar.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TStatusBar.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TStatusBar: frees canvas and panels, then calls inherited Destroy.

element.name: TStatusBar.InvalidatePanel
element.short: Updates the panel at the specified position in the Panels for the status bar.

descr.p: InvalidatePanel renders the panel with specified index non-valid. Calls UpdateHandleObject to ensure that the widgetset class is notified of the change to the specified panel.
descr.remark: No actions are performed in the method when the PanelParts argument is an empty set ([]).

element.name: TStatusBar.InvalidatePanel.PanelIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the panel affected in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.InvalidatePanel.PanelParts
element.short: Panel parts affected in the method.

element.name: TStatusBar.BeginUpdate
element.short: BeginUpdate - starts the update process.

element.name: TStatusBar.EndUpdate
element.short: EndUpdate - finishes the update process.

element.name: TStatusBar.ExecuteAction
element.short: ExecuteAction: if required action is a Hint-related, sets the Hint in place, otherwise calls inherited method.

element.name: TStatusBar.GetPanelIndexAt
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the panel at the specified coordinates.

descr.p: GetPanelIndexAt gets the ordinal position for the panel at the specified coordinates. The return value is -1 when Panels have not been defined in the status bar. No actions are performed in the method when Panels is empty.

GetPanelIndexAt uses the display rectangle for the control to determine in the specified coordinates are within one of the Panels defined for the control. When True, each of the items in the Panels collection are examined to determine if the point is within a specific panel. The ordinal position for the panel is assigned as the return value.

element.name: TStatusBar.GetPanelIndexAt.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the status panel, or -1 when no panel is located at the specified coordinates.

element.name: TStatusBar.GetPanelIndexAt.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate to locate in the Panels for the status bar.

element.name: TStatusBar.GetPanelIndexAt.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate to locate in the Panels for the status bar.

element.name: TStatusBar.SizeGripEnabled
element.short: SizeGripEnabled - returns True if the size-grip (an area at the bottom of the statusbar where a mouse can grip to change the size) is enabled.

element.name: TStatusBar.UpdatingStatusBar
element.short: UpdatingStatusBar - returns True if the status bar is being updated.

element.name: TStatusBar.UpdatingStatusBar.Result
element.short: True if the status bar is being updated.

element.name: TStatusBar.Canvas
element.short: The Canvas where the Panels for the StatusBar are are Painted.

element.name: TStatusBar.AutoHint
element.short: AutoHint - if True, a hint is automatically shown when mouse hovers over status bar. Default is False.

element.name: TStatusBar.AutoSize
element.short: TStatusBar default is True.

element.name: TStatusBar.Panels
element.short: Collection with the TStatusPanel instances defined for the control.

descr.p: Panels is a collection used to store TStatusPanel class instances added to the status bar. Panels are significant when the SimplePanel property is set to False; when SimplePanel contains True, the status bar displays the value in SimpleText across the entire width for the status bar.
Use CreatePanel to create a new status panel displayed on the status bar. Or use the editor provided in the Lazarus IDE Object Inspector to maintain the items in the Panels collection at design-time.

element.name: TStatusBar.SimpleText
element.short: SimpleText - a character string containing the information to be displayed in the Status Bar.

descr.p: SimpleText - a character string containing the information to be displayed in the Status Bar. This is displayed if SimplePanel is true; otherwise the information in Panels is displayed.

element.name: TStatusBar.SimplePanel
element.short: Indicates if a single panel is displayed in the status bar with the text in SimpleText.

descr.p: SimplePanel is a Boolean property which indicates if a single panel is displayed in the status bar with the text in SimpleText
If True, the value of SimpleText is displayed; if False, the contents of the individual Panels is displayed.
Contents can be adjusted with a stringlist editor that pops up when the ellipsis (...) next to Panels is selected and allows insertion of an arbitrary number of sub-panels with their own strings.

element.name: TStatusBar.SizeGrip
element.short: Displays a sizing grip used to resize the parent form.

descr.p: SizeGrip is a Boolean property which indicates if a sizing grip (or grabber) is visible for the status bar. The sizing grip is a triangular shape displayed at the bottom-right of the status bar, and provides an alternate way to resize the parent form using the mouse. It presents a larger mouse target than a window border.
The default value for the property is True, and indicates that the sizing grip is visible.
Setting a new value for the property causes the widgetset class to be notified of the change if the handle has been allocated for the control.
Use SizeGripEnabled to determine if the sizing grip is enabled in the control.

element.name: TStatusBar.UseSystemFont
element.short: Indicates the System font is used for the control.
element.descr: This is used to provide VCL-compatibility in widgetset classes.

element.name: TStatusBar.OnCreatePanelClass
element.short: Event handler signalled to get the class used to create new panels in the status bar.

descr.p: OnCreatePanelClass is signalled (when assigned) in the CreatePanel method to get the class used to create new panels in the status bar. Assign an object procedure using the signature in TSBCreatePanelClassEvent to the property to override the value provided by the GetPanelClass method.

element.name: TStatusBar.OnDrawPanel
element.short: Event handler signalled to draw a panel in the status bar.

descr.p: OnDrawPanel is an event handler used to draw the specified panel on the status bar. OnDrawPanel is signalled (when assigned) from the DrawPanel method. Assign an object procedure using the signature in TDrawPanelEvent to render the specified panel to the desired rectangle in the status bar.

element.name: TStatusBar.OnHint
element.short: Event handler for showing a hint when required.

element.name: TPageFlag
element.short: Contains values which can be assigned to the Flags property in TCustomPage.
element.descr: Reflects the status or state for the handle used in a custom page control.

element.name: TPageFlag.pfAdded
element.short: Handle for the page has been added to the notebook.

element.name: TPageFlag.pfAdding
element.short: Handle for the page is being added to the notebook.

element.name: TPageFlag.pfRemoving
element.short: Removing the page handle from the notebook.

element.name: TPageFlag.pfInserting
element.short: Inserting the page handle into the notebook.

element.name: TPageFlags
element.short: Set type used to store TPageFlag enumeration values.

descr.p: TPageFlags is the type used to implement the Flags property in TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage
element.short: The base class for TTabSheet.

descr.p: TCustomPage is a TWinControl descendant which implements the base class for the tabbed pages found in notebooks. TCustomPage provides properties used to maintain the order and visibility of the page, and event handlers signalled when the page is hidden or displayed.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageIndex property.

descr.p: Notifies the widgetset class of changes to properties in the custom page.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetImageIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetTabVisible
element.short: Sets the value for the TabVisible property.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetTabVisible.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPage.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers the widgetset class used for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomPage.WMPaint
element.short: Handles the LM_PAINT message for the control.

descr.p: WMPaint is an overridden method in TCustomPage which handles the LM_PAINT message for the control. It calls the inherited method to render the control. No actions are performed in the method if the Parent is a TCustomTabControl descendant and the class instance is not the current page in the Parent control.

element.name: TCustomPage.WMPaint.Msg
element.short: Message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetParent
element.short: Sets the Parent control for the custom page.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetParent.AParent
element.short: New value for the Parent property.

element.name: TCustomPage.Flags
element.short: Contains flag values that represent the status or state for the handle in the custom page control.

descr.p: Values in Flags are normally added or removed when changes are performed in a control which uses the page control class instance. See TPageFlag for more information about enumeration values and their meanings.

element.name: TCustomPage.CMHitTest
element.short: Handles the CM_HITTEST control message.

descr.p: CMHitTest checks the type for the Parent control to determine whether the Message is ignored or forwarded to the inherited method. When Parent is a TCustomTabControl descendant, the class instance must be the active page in the parent control. When it is not, the Message result is set to 0 and the message is ignored. Otherwise, the inherited method is called to handle the Message.

element.name: TCustomPage.CMHitTest.Message
element.short: Control message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomPage.CMVisibleChanged
element.short: Handles the CM_VISIBLECHANGED message for the control.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method to handle a focus change and update the control state. If the control is Visible, the DoShow method is called to signal the OnShow event handler (when assigned). Otherwise, DoHide is called to signal the OnHide event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomPage.CMVisibleChanged.Message
element.short: Control message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomPage.GetPageIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the PageIndex property.

element.name: TCustomPage.GetPageIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetPageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the PageIndex property.

element.name: TCustomPage.SetPageIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPage.GetTabVisible
element.short: Gets the value for the TabVisible property.

element.name: TCustomPage.GetTabVisible.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomPage.DialogChar
element.short: Provides support for a TCustomTabControl parent when handling a dialog accelerator key.

descr.p: Calls the inherited DialogChar method when Parent is not derived from TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TCustomPage.DialogChar.Result
element.short: True if message contains an accelerator key handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomPage.DialogChar.Message
element.short: Message examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomPage.DoHide
element.short: Performs actions needed when Visible is changed to False.

descr.p: DoHide is a method used to perform actions needed when the Visible property is changed to False. DoHide signals the OnHide event handler (when assigned).
DoHide is called from the CMVisibleChanged message handler.

element.name: TCustomPage.DoShow
element.short: Performs actions needed when Visible is changed to True.

descr.p: DoShow is a method used to perform actions needed when Visible property is changed to True. DoShow signals the OnShow event handler (when assigned).
DoShow is called from the CMVisibleChanged message handler.

element.name: TCustomPage.DestroyHandle
element.short: Updates the Flags property when the Handle for the control is freed.

descr.p: DestroyHandle is an overridden method used to update the control when its Handle is freed in the widgetset class. DestroyHandle calls the inherited method on entry, and updates the Flags property to exclude the value pfAdded.

element.name: TCustomPage.RealSetText
element.short: Notifies the widgetset to change the text for the control.

descr.p: RealSetText is overridden in TCustomPage to notify the widgetset class of the value change when the Parent control is assigned and has a valid Handle. RealSetText calls the inherited method to apply the new value. AdjustSize is called if the widgetset class was notified.

element.name: TCustomPage.RealSetText.AValue
element.short: Value used for the Text (Caption) in the control.

element.name: TCustomPage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for TCustomPage, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create sets the default values for the style, visibility, alignment and caption in the class instance.

element.name: TCustomPage.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

descr.p: Returns False in TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage.CanTab.Result
element.short: Always returns False.

element.name: TCustomPage.IsControlVisible
element.short: Indicates whether the control is visible.

descr.p: IsControlVisible is an overridden method in TCustomPage which indicates whether the control is visible.

If AutoSizingAll is set to True, no actions are performed in the method and the return values is True. This allows inactive pages to be considered in the GetPreferredSize method in the parent control.

IsControlVisible calls the inherited method on entry to determine if the Visible property is set to True, and whether the control is visible at design-time. When the Parent control is TCustomTabControl, the value in the PageIndex property must match the value in the parent control.
The return value is True when all of the conditions are satisfied.

element.name: TCustomPage.IsControlVisible.Result
element.short: True when the control is visible.

element.name: TCustomPage.VisibleIndex
element.short: Gets the index number for a visible page within all of the visible pages.

descr.p: VisibleIndex is an Integer function used to get the ordinal position for the page instance within the list of visible pages for the Parent control.

When Parent is a TCustomTabControl descendant, its TCustomPage instances are examined to find the current class instance. At run-time, only pages with the TabVisible property set to True are considered in the method. At design-time, all pages are examined.

The return value is the relative position in the list of visible pages where the current class instance was found. The return value is -1 if the current page was not found in the Parent control, or when none of the pages in the Parent control are visible.
When Parent is not derived from TCustomTabControl, the return value is always -1.

element.name: TCustomPage.VisibleIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the visible page, or -1 when not found or not visible.

element.name: TCustomPage.CheckNewParent
element.short: Ensures that the specified control is derived from TCustomTabControl.

descr.p: Raises an EInvalidOperation exception when AParent is not derived from TCustomTabControl. Calls the inherited CheckNewParent method when AParent is unassigned or derived from TCustomTabControl.

element.errors: Raises an EInvalidOperation exception when AParent is not derived from TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TCustomPage.CheckNewParent.AParent
element.short: Parent control examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomPage.PageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the page in the parent control.

descr.p: PageIndex is an Integer property which contains the ordinal position for the page control in its Parent control. Setting a new value for the property causes the Parent control to call its MoveTab method to reorder the pages. This action is performed when the Parent control is descended from TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TCustomPage.TabVisible
element.short: Indicates if the tab in the Parent control is visible.

descr.p: TabVisible indicates if the Tab in the Parent control is visible.

Changing the value in the property cause the Parent control to be updated to reflect the new value. No actions are performed in the method at design-time, or when the property value is not different than the stored value.

When the Parent control has been assigned and has a handle allocated, the TCustomTabControl in Parent is updated to reflect the new value for the property. When True, the active page in the Parent control is changed to the current page instance if one has not already been assigned in the Parent. The page and its handle are removed from the Tab control when the property value is False.
Use IsControlVisible to determine if the page is currently the active page displayed in the Parent tab control.

element.name: TCustomPage.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the image associated with the page.

descr.p: ImageIndex contains the ordinal position in an image list for the image associated with the page instance. The default value for the property is -1 and indicates that an image has not been assigned for the page. The image list is a property available in the Parent control.
Changing the value for the property causes the widgetset class to be notified using its UpdateTabProperties method.
No actions are performed in the method during LCL component streaming, or when the Handle for the control has not been allocated.

element.name: TCustomPage.Left
element.descr: The value for the Left property is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism for TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage.Top
element.descr: The value for the Top property is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism for TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage.Width
element.descr: The value for the Width property is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism for TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage.Height
element.descr: The value for the Height property is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism for TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage.TabOrder
element.descr: The value for the TabOrder property is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism for TCustomPage.

descr.p: The value for the Visible property is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism for TCustomPage.

element.name: TCustomPage.OnHide
element.short: Event handler signalled when the page is hidden.

descr.p: OnHide is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the page is hidden. OnHide is signalled from the DoHide method, and occurs when the value in the Visible property is set to False.
Applications can implement and assign a handler routine to respond to the event notification. The Sender argument contains the TCustomPage instance for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomPage.OnShow
element.short: Event handler signalled when the page becomes visible.

descr.p: OnShow is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the page becomes visible. OnShow is signalled from the DoShow method, and occurs when the value in the Visible property is set to True.
Applications can implement and assign a handler routine to respond to the event notification. The Sender argument contains the TCustomPage instance for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomPageClass
element.short: Class reference used to create a new TCustomPage instance.

element.name: TNBBasePages
element.short: Ancestor for the TNBPages class.

descr.p: TNBBasePages specifies the ancestor for TNBPages, and provides virtual abstract methods used to maintain a list of TCustomPage objects associated with a TCustomTabControl (also called a "notebook"). Use the TNBPages descendant which provides concrete method implementations and additional properties and methods for the purpose.

element.name: TNBBasePages.IndexOfPage
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the specified page object.

element.name: TNBBasePages.IndexOfPage.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the specified page object, or -1 when not found.

element.name: TNBBasePages.IndexOfPage.AnObject
element.short: Page object to locate in the list.

element.name: TNBBasePages.InsertPage
element.short: Inserts the specified page at the given position in the list.

element.name: TNBBasePages.InsertPage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position where the page is inserted.

element.name: TNBBasePages.InsertPage.APage
element.short: Page object inserted in the method.

element.name: TNBBasePages.DeletePage
element.short: Deletes the page at the specified position in the list.

element.name: TNBBasePages.DeletePage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the page deleted in the method.

element.name: TNBBasePages.GetPage
element.short: Gets the page object stored at the specified position in the list.

element.name: TNBBasePages.GetPage.Result
element.short: Page object stored at the specified position in the list.

element.name: TNBBasePages.GetPage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the list for the requested page object.

element.name: TNBBasePages.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Calls the inherited constructor. Please note: The value in theNotebook is ignored in the method. Use the derived TNBPages class which stores the notebook where the page objects are used.

element.name: TNBBasePages.Create.theNotebook
element.short: Notebook (or custom tab control) for the page objects; Ignored in the method.

element.name: TNBBasePagesClass
element.short: Class reference used to create new instances of TNBBasePages.

element.name: TNBPages
element.short: Implements a list of pages used in TCustomTabControl.

descr.p: TNBPages is a TNBBasePages descendant which implements a list of pages used in TCustomTabControl.

TNBPages extends the ancestor class to include properties for the TCustomTabControl which owns the list of pages (Notebook), and the internal list used to store the TCustomPage instances (PageList). It implements the abstract virtual methods defined in the ancestor, and provides additional methods to maintain the pages in PageList.

element.name: TNBPages.PageListChange
element.short: Implements the OnChange event handler for the page list.

element.name: TNBPages.Get
element.short: Implements read access to values for the Strings property.

descr.p: Read access is redirected to the PageList property. The return value contains the Caption for the TCustomPage instance stored at the specified position in PageList.

element.name: TNBPages.Get.Result
element.short: Returns the Caption for the page.

element.name: TNBPages.Get.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested value.

descr.p: GetCount is an overridden method in TNBPages, and returns the number of items stored in PageList.

element.name: TNBPages.GetCount.Result
element.short: Gets the number of pages in the class instance.

descr.p: GetObject is an overridden method in TNBPages, and redirects indexed object access to the PageList property. The return value is a TObject instance, and must be cast to TCustomPage to access its properties and methods.
Use GetPage to get a page in PageList as a TCustomPage instance.

element.name: TNBPages.GetObject.Result
element.short: Object stored at the specified position.

element.name: TNBPages.GetObject.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the object requested in the method.

element.name: TNBPages.IndexOfPage
element.short: Gets the position in PageList for the specified page.

element.name: TNBPages.IndexOfPage.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the page instance, or -1 when not found.

element.name: TNBPages.IndexOfPage.AnObject
element.short: TCustomPage instance to locate in the list of pages.

element.name: TNBPages.InsertPage
element.short: Inserts a page instance at the specified position in the page list.

element.name: TNBPages.InsertPage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the page list for the inserted value.

element.name: TNBPages.InsertPage.APage
element.short: Page instance inserted into the page list.

element.name: TNBPages.DeletePage
element.short: Deletes the page stored at the specified position in the page list.

element.name: TNBPages.DeletePage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the page removed from the page list.

element.name: TNBPages.GetPage
element.short: Gets the page stored at the specified position in PageList.

descr.p: GetPage implements the abstract method defined in the ancestor, and is used to get a TCustomPage instance stored at the specified position in PageList. GetPage calls the GetObject method to retrieve the page, and casts it to the TCustomPage type used in the return value.

element.name: TNBPages.GetPage.Result
element.short: TCustomPage instance stored at the specified position.

element.name: TNBPages.GetPage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in PageList for the requested page.

element.name: TNBPages.PageList
element.short: List with the TCustomPage instances for the class instance.

descr.p: PageList is a read-only TListWithEvent property which contains the TCustomPage instances for the class instance.

PageList includes an OnChange event handler used to perform notifications when values are added, retrieved, or deleted in the list. The private PageListChange method implements the handler, and ensures that new items in the list are parented to the control in Notebook.
Most methods in TNBPages are redirected to PageList to get or set their values.

element.name: TNBPages.Notebook
element.short: Provides a reference to the control which owns the pages.

element.name: TNBPages.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TNBPages, and calls the inherited Create method. It sets up the list of pages for the notebook (tab control).

element.name: TNBPages.Create.theNotebook
element.short: Control which owns the class instance (and its pages).

element.name: TNBPages.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Frees and releases resources allocated to PageList.

element.name: TNBPages.Clear
element.short: Removes all pages stored in the class instance.

descr.p: Calls Delete until all TCustomPage instances in PageList have been removed.

element.name: TNBPages.Delete
element.short: Deletes the page stored at the specified position in the page list.

element.name: TNBPages.Delete.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the page removed from the list.

element.name: TNBPages.Insert
element.short: Inserts a new page with the given name at the specified position in PageList.

descr.p: Insert calls the GetPageClass method in NoteBook to get the class reference used to create the new page. The owner of the page instance is the NoteBook control (or its owner when assigned). The value in S is assigned as the Caption in the TCustomPage instance. The InsertPage method in NoteBook is called to store the TCustomPage instance at the position in Index.

element.name: TNBPages.Insert.Index
element.short: Ordinal position where the new page is stored.

element.name: TNBPages.Insert.S
element.short: Name (Caption) used for the new page instance.

descr.p: TNBNoPages is a TNBBasePages descendant which re-implements the page container for a TCustomTabControl. As the name implies, it does not actually use TCustomPages instances in the container. It removes the methods used to add and maintain the values in the class instance.

element.name: TTabChangingEvent
element.short: TTabChangingEvent - generic event handling method for a change in a notebook Tab.

element.name: TTabChangingEvent.Sender
element.short: Notebook for the event notification.

element.name: TTabChangingEvent.AllowChange
element.short: Indicates if the tab change can be performed.

element.name: TTabPosition
element.short: Represents the position for a tab relative to its page.

descr.p: TTabPosition is an enumerated type with values that represent the position for the tabs in TCustomTabControl relative to its page. TTabPosition is the type used to implement the TabPosition property in TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TTabPosition.tpTop
element.short: Displays tabs along the top edge of the page.

element.name: TTabPosition.tpBottom
element.short: Displays tabs along the bottom edge of the page.

element.name: TTabPosition.tpLeft
element.short: Displays tabs vertically along the left edge of the page.

element.name: TTabPosition.tpRight
element.short: Displays tabs vertically along the right edge of the page.

element.name: TTabStyle
element.short: TTabStyle - enumerated type for tab style: normal, buttons or flat buttons.

descr.p: TTabStyle is an enumerated type with values that define the drawing style used for tabs in TCustomTabControl. TTabStyle is the type used to implement the Style property in TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TTabStyle.tsTabs
element.short: Tabs are drawn using the tab style common to manilla file folders.

element.name: TTabStyle.tsButtons
element.short: Tabs are drawn as buttons.

element.name: TTabStyle.tsFlatButtons
element.short: Tabs are drawn as buttons using a flat (non-raised) appearance.

element.name: TTabGetImageEvent
element.short: TTabGetImageEvent - generic event handling method for getting an image for a Tab.

element.name: TTabGetImageEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCTabControlOption
element.short: TCTabControlOption - Show the close button on a tab, allow multi-line tabs.

element.name: TCTabControlOptions
element.short: TCTabControlOptions - set of TCTabControlOption.

element.name: TCTabControlCapability
element.short: TCTabControlCapability - enumerated type containing possible capabilities of a notebook or tabbed control.
element.descr: nbcShowCloseButtons, nbcMultiLine, nbcPageListPopup, nbcShowAddTabButton

element.name: TCTabControlCapabilities
element.short: TCTabControlCapabilities - set of TCTabControlCapability.

element.name: TDrawTabEvent
element.short: TDrawTabEvent - generic event handling procedure for drawing a tab with given index at the specified rectangle.

element.name: TCustomTabControl
element.short: Implements the base class for tabbed controls in the LCL.

descr.p: TCustomTabControl - base class for TTabControl, a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect
A tab control has a series of Tabs and it may or may not contain pages.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoSendPageIndex
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when PageIndex has been changed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoSendShowTabs
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when ShowTabs has been changed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoSendTabPosition
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when TabPosition has been changed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoSendTabSize
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when TabSize has been changed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoImageListChange
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when Images has been changed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetActivePage
element.short: Gets the value for the ActivePage property.

descr.p: Uses an internal index value to get the caption for the TCustomPage in the Page property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetActivePage.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetActivePageComponent
element.short: Gets the value for the ActivePageComponent property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetActivePageComponent.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetDisplayRect
element.short: Gets the value for the DisplayRect property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetDisplayRect.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetMultiLine
element.short: Gets the value for the MultiLine property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetMultiLine.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.FindVisiblePage
element.short: Locates a visible page in the tab control.

descr.p: FindVisiblePage is used to locate a Page in the tab control with its TabVisible property set to True.

Index specifies the ordinal position in Pages property that is the search locus. FindVisiblePage searches the Page collection in ascending order starting at the position in Index. If a visible page is not found, Page is searched in descending order starting at Index -1.
The return value contains the ordinal position in the indexed Page property where the visible tab was located, or -1 when there are no visible tabs in Page.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.FindVisiblePage.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the visible page tab, or -1 when a visible tab is not found.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.FindVisiblePage.Index
element.short: Ordinal position where the search is started.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IsStoredActivePage
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the ActivePage property.

descr.p: Always returns False in TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IsStoredActivePage.Result
element.short: Always returns False in TCustomTabControl.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MoveTab
element.short: Moves the specified page control to the position in NewIndex.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MoveTab.Sender
element.short: Page object moved in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MoveTab.NewIndex
element.short: New position in the list of pages.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetMultiLine
element.short: Sets the value for the MultiLine property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetMultiLine.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the Style property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetStyle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.WSMovePage
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when a page is moved in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.PageRemoved
element.short: Performs action needed when the current page object is removed from the tabbed control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.PageRemoved.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the page object removed from the tabbed control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetActivePage
element.short: Sets the value for the ActivePage property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetActivePage.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetActivePageComponent
element.short: Sets the value for the ActivePageComponent property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetActivePageComponent.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetImages
element.short: Sets the value for the Images property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetImages.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetImagesWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the ImagesWidth property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetImagesWidth.AImagesWidth
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetPageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the PageIndex property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetPageIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetPages
element.short: Sets the value for the Pages property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetPages.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetShowTabs
element.short: Sets the value for the ShowTabs property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetShowTabs.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetTabHeight
element.short: Sets the value for the TabHeight property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetTabHeight.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetTabPosition
element.short: Sets the value for the ShowTabs property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetTabPosition.tabPos
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetTabWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the TabWidth property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetTabWidth.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ShowCurrentPage
element.short: Ensures that the current page has its Visible property set to True.

descr.p: ShowCurrentPage checks the value in PageIndex to determine if a valid page index has been specified. No actions are performed in the method when PageIndex is less than 0 or greater than PageCount - 1.
ShowCurrentPage gets the TCustomPage instance in Page at the position in PageIndex, and sets its Visible property to True. If the Page is Enabled, it SetFocus method is called.
ShowCurrentPage sets the Visible property in the previously selected Page to False.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.UpdateAllDesignerFlags
element.short: Updates control style flags to hide or display pages in the control at design-time.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.UpdateDesignerFlags
element.short: Updates control style flags for the specified page to hide or display the control at design-time.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.UpdateDesignerFlags.APageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the Page updated in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoImageListDestroyResolutionHandle
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when the handle for the image resolution is freed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoImageListDestroyResolutionHandle.Sender
element.short: Image list for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoImageListDestroyResolutionHandle.AWidth
element.short: Not used in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoImageListDestroyResolutionHandle.AReferenceHandle
element.short: Not used in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetImageListAsync
element.short: Performs actions needed when an image list in the control is changed.

descr.p: Queued and executed asynchronously by the Application instance.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetImageListAsync.Data
element.short: Pointer to the Data for the asynchronous event.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoAutoAdjustLayout
element.short: Performs actions needed to apply the specified auto-adjust layout policy.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPageClass
element.short: Gets the class type used to create new page instances in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPageClass.Result
element.short: Class type used to create new page instances in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetListClass
element.short: Gets the class type used to access a list of pages in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetListClass.Result
element.short: Class type used to access a list of pages in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetOptions
element.short: Sets the value for the Options property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.SetOptions.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.AddRemovePageHandle
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class when a page handle is added or removed in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.AddRemovePageHandle.APage
element.short: Page instance with the handle added or removed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.CNNotify
element.short: Handles the CN_NOTIFY message for the control.

descr.p: Handles TCN_SELCHANGE and TCN_SELCHANGING notification codes in Message.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.CNNotify.Message
element.short: Control notification message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Loaded
element.short: Notifies the widgetset class of the active page when the control Handle is allocated.

descr.p: Notifies the widgetset class of the value in PageIndex when the control Handle has been allocated.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoChange
element.short: Performs actions needed when the active page for the control has been changed.

descr.p: Performs actions needed when the active page for the control has been changed. Signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned). Called when a new value is assigned to PageIndex.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Change
element.short: Performs actions to show or hide pages when the current page is changed.

descr.p: Change is a method used to performs actions needed to show or hide pages in the tabbed control.

Change calls ShowCurrentPage to display the page in PageIndex, and hide the previously visible page in the tabbed control. Change calls DoChange when the control is not being destroyed, or loaded in the LCL component streaming mechanism.
Change is called from the MoveTab method, and when selection change messages are handled for the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.KeyDown
element.short: Handles page navigation using the Tab key.

descr.p: KeyDown is overridden in TCustomTabControl to handle use of the Tab key (VK_TAB) to change the active page in the tabbed control.

The Options property must contain the value nboKeyboardTabSwitch to enable the tab switching feature. Pressing Ctrl+Tab switches to the next page by incrementing the PageIndex value. Pressing Ctrl+Shift+Tab switches to the previous page by decrementing the PageIndex value.
If Key is not the VK_TAB virtual key code, the inherited method is called to handle the values in Key and Shift.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.KeyDown.Key
element.short: Virtual key code examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.KeyDown.Shift
element.short: Key modifier(s) used in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DialogChar
element.short: Handles an accelerator key for the active page in the tabbed control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DialogChar.Result
element.short: True if the accelerator was handled in the active page.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DialogChar.Message
element.short: Message with the accelerator key examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.InternalSetPageIndex
element.short: Updates the internal page index without triggering an OnChange event.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.InternalSetPageIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the internal page index.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ShowControl
element.short: Makes the specified page object the active page in the tabbed control.

descr.p: ShowControl gets the position for the control specified by the APage argument in the Page property, and makes it the active page in the tabbed control. If the control is not found in Page, the inherited ShowControl method is called to display the control.
ShowControl is provided for Delphi compatibility.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ShowControl.APage
element.short: Page object to locate and display in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IndexOfTabAt
element.short: IndexOfTabAt returns the index value for the Tab located at the specified client coordinates.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IndexOfPageAt
element.short: Gets the index for the page at the specified client coordinates.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.UpdateTabProperties
element.short: UpdateTabProperties - apply all pending changes to the Tab.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize returns its own defaults, overriding inherited values.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Notification
element.short: Handles the notification when a component is added to or removed from the control.

descr.p: Notification is overridden in TCustomTabControl to ensure that resources allocated for the Images property are Nil'd when the component is removed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the notification.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Notification.Operation
element.short: Operation performed for the component.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ActivePageComponent
element.short: The active TCustomPage instance for the tabbed control.

descr.p: ActivePageComponent is a TCustomPage property which indicates the active page component for the tabbed control.
PageIndex is used to access the page instance in Page with the property value. The property value is Nil when PageIndex contains a value that is not in the range 0..PageCount-1.

Setting a new value for the property causes the IndexOf method to be called to locate the value in the list of pages. PageIndex is updated to reflect the position for the specified page, and may contain -1 if pages are not used in the tabbed control.
Use ActivePage to get or set the active page in the control using its Caption.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ActivePage
element.short: Caption for the active page in the tabbed control.

descr.p: ActivePage is a String property which holds the caption for the active page in the control.

The property value is retrieved using values in the PageIndex and Page properties, and contains the Caption property for the TCustomPage instance. The property value is an empty string ('') if PageIndex is not in the range 0..PageCount-1.

Setting a new value for the property causes the indexed Page property to be searched to locate the TCustomPage instance with a Caption matching Value. If a page is found with the specified caption, the SetPageIndex method is called to validate and store the PageIndex, and signal the OnChange event handler when configured in Options. No actions are performed if the new property Value is not used in Page.
A value assigned to ActivePage at design-time is not stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism.
Use ActivePageComponent to read or write the TCustomPage instance that is the active page in the control.
Use Tabs to access the internal page (or tab) list for the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPage
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Page property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPage.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPage.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the page object requested in the method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPageCount
element.short: Gets the value for the PageCount property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetPageCount.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.CanChange
element.short: Signals the OnChanging event handler prior to updates to PageIndex.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.CanChange.Result
element.short: Always returns True.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DisplayRect
element.short: Rectangular area used to display information for the tabbed control.

descr.p: DisplayRect is a read-only TRect property which contains the display rectangle for the tabbed control. The property value contains the TRect instance returned from the TWinControl.GetClientRect method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Tabs
element.short: Contains the list of pages accessible in the tabbed control.

descr.p: Tabs is a TStrings property which contains the list of pages for the tabbed control. It is created using the class reference from GetListClass in the constructor. By default, TNBPages is used as the class type for the page list. It is stored in an internal member, and used when TCustomPage class instances for the control are accessed and maintained.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabIndex
element.short: Contains the ordinal position for the active Tab in the control.

descr.p: TabIndex is an Integer property which contains the ordinal position for the active Tab in the tabbed control. It is the same as the PageIndex property; they read and write the same member value. The default value for the property is -1, and indicates that an active tab (page) has not been selected in the control.

Setting a new value for the property causes the OnChange event handler to be signalled when nboDoChangeOnSetIndex has been included in the Options for the control. The event handler is not signalled at design-time, during LCL component streaming, or when the control is freed.
No actions are performed in the method when the new property value is not in the range -1..PageCount-1, or when the new value is the same as the existing value.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when the active page (or tab) for the control is changed.

descr.p: OnChange is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the active page (or tab) for the control is changed. OnChange is enabled when the value nboDoChangeOnSetIndex has been included in the Options for the control.

Setting a new value in either PageIndex or TabIndex signals the assigned and enabled event handler. It is also called from the Change method when selection change messages are handled for the control, and when a tab is re-ordered using the MoveTab method.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomTabControl: calls inherited Create creates a page list, then sets initial bounds and default values for local variables and properties.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomTabControl: clears and frees pages and list, then calls inherited Destroy.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabRect
element.short: Gets the client rectangle for the control adjusted to the parent (when needed).

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the image displayed on the tab for the specified page.

descr.p: GetImageIndex is an Integer function used to get the ordinal position in Images for the image displayed on the specified tab. ThePageIndex contains the Page examined in the method to get its ImageIndex property. If Page does not have a TCustomPage instance at the position in ThePageIndex, -1 is used as the image index.
GetImageIndex signals the OnGetImageIndex event handler (when assigned) to allow a custom image index to be used in the return value.
GetImageIndex is called from methods in the widgetset class when the image displayed on a tab is needed.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetImageIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position in Images for the specified page index.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetImageIndex.ThePageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in Page with the image index for the tab.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.IndexOf
element.short: IndexOf - returns the index value of a specified page.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.CustomPage
element.short: CustomPage - returns the page specified by Index.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.CanChangePageIndex
element.short: CanChangePageIndex - determine whether it is permissible to change the index of the page.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetMinimumTabWidth
element.short: GetMinimumTabWidth - find the smallest permissible tab width.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetMinimumTabHeight
element.short: GetMinimumTabHeight - find the least permissible height for a tab.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.GetCapabilities
element.short: GetCapabilities - returns the set of capabilities.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabToPageIndex
element.short: Gets the real page index for the specified tab.

descr.p: TabToPageIndex is an Integer function used to get the page index for the tab at the specified position. The tab index value in AIndex does not include any non-visible tabs. TabToPageIndex adjusts the index value to include any TCustomPage instances in Page with its TabVisible property set to False.
The return value contains the value specified in AIndex after adding any non-visible pages proper to the requested position.
No actions are performed in the method at design-time; all pages are visible on the designer surface.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.DoCloseTabClicked
element.short: DoCloseTabClicked - perform the action associated with clicking the Close tab for this page (OnCloseTabClicked).

element.name: TCustomTabControl.HotTrack
element.short: HotTrack - the property whereby the item under the mouse pointer becomes emphasized.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Images
element.short: Images - the list of images associated with the pages of this notebook.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ImagesWidth
element.short: Width for the Images used in the control.

descr.p: ImagesWidth specifies the width used for the Images in the control. ImagesWidth determines the resolution (either selected or resized) for the current display density (PPI).

Changing the value in the property causes the DoImageListChange method to be called to select the image resolution, and to notify the widgetset class of the change. The UpdateTabProperties method is called to propagate the change to all tabs in the control.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MultiLine
element.short: MultiLine - whether the Tab's caption is allowed to have multiple lines.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.MultiSelect
element.short: MultiSelect - whether multiple Tabs are allowed to be selected at the same time (e.g. by pressing Shift or Ctrl while selecting).

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnChanging
element.short: OnChanging - event handler for changing a tab.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnCloseTabClicked
element.short: OnCloseTabClicked - event handler for clicking on the Close button to close a tab.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.OnGetImageIndex
element.short: OnGetImageIndex - event handler for getting an image index.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Options
element.short: The set of Options for the Notebook: Show close buttons on the tabs, multi-line tabs.

descr.p: The set of Options for the Notebook:
nboShowCloseButtons (display a little Close Button on the Tab next to the label to allow a user to close that tab),
nboMultiLine (allows multi-line captions on the Tabs)

element.short: OwnerDraw - is the calling routine (Owner) allowed to specify the drawing method?

element.short: PageCount - the number of Pages in the Notebook.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ScrollOpposite
element.short: ScrollOpposite - is scrolling to happen in the opposite direction to usual?

element.name: TCustomTabControl.ShowTabs
element.short: ShowTabs - if True (default condition), show the tabs for each page.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.Style
element.short: Style - Tabs, buttons or flat buttons?

element.short: TabHeight - height of the tabs.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabPosition
element.short: TabPosition - top, bottom, left or right.

element.name: TCustomTabControl.TabWidth
element.short: Width of the tabs displayed on the control.

descr.p: The default value for the property is True in TCustomTabControl.

descr.p: TTabSheet - individual page of a TPageControl. It is a more elaborate version of TPage, and adds the following features:

ul.li: Ability to make the Tab visible or hidden

element.name: TPageControl
element.short: TPageControl - provides a series of tabs along the edge of a multi-page component to allow selection of one of the pages (TTabSheet) of the component.

descr.p: TPageControl provides a series of tabs along an edge of a multi-page component to allow selection of one of the pages (TTabSheet) defined for the component.
To use TPageControl, select its icon from the Common Controls tab of the IDE Component Palette and place it at the desired location on the Form.

Use the Form Designer and Object Inspector to adjust its shape, size, alignment, anchoring, docking and other properties, then select the object and right click with the mouse to bring up a pop-up menu whose first item is 'AddPage'. After you have added as many pages as you need, the individual pages can be edited by selecting ActivePage in the Object Inspector choosing the page required and editing its properties.
While a given page is selected, it is also possible to drop other controls (such as buttons, memo boxes etc) on to the page from the Component Palette.
Inherits most of its properties from TCustomTabControl

element.name: TPageControl.Clear
element.short: Clears the list of tab names of the control, and causes the associated tab sheets or pages to be freed.

descr.p: By calling the Clear method of the protected Tabs property in the TCustomTabControl ancestor, this method removes all tab sheets from the PageControl. The TPageControl.PageCount is 0 afterwards.
Note, however, that the controls on the tab sheets are only destroyed when their Owner is one of the tabsheets. Otherwise they still exist on the form, but their Parent has been set to nil.

element.name: TTabControl
element.short: TTabControl - a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect.

descr.p: TTabControl - a series of Tabs along the edge of a display area; selection of a Tab governs the contents of the DisplayRect

Use TTabControl by selecting its icon from the Common Controls tab of the IDE Component Palette and placing it at the desired location on the Form. Use the Form Designer and Object Inspector to adjust its shape, size, alignment, anchoring and other properties. Tabs can be added or removed from the component by selecting it, then right-clicking with the mouse to get a pop-up menu whose first item is 'Add Tab'. Once created, the Tabs can be edited by selecting the Tabs entry in the Object Inspector and selecting the ellipsis (...) which will cause a pop-up String editor to appear. The tabs can be given new captions, moved up and down the list or removed altogether as required.
Each Tab has an Index (starting from 0) and this index can be used to specify an entry from Images for display in the DisplayRect.

Create calls GetControlClassDefaultSize and sets the initial bounds for the control using SetInitialBounds. Create allocates a TControlCanvas instance that is used in the Canvas property.
