descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that resources allocated in the class instance are freed, including:
Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TTabControl.GetImageIndex
element.short: Signals the OnGetImageIndex event handler to get an image for the specified tab index.

element.name: TTabControl.TabRect
element.short: Gets the rectangle where the tab at the specified position is drawn.

element.name: TTabControl.RowCount
element.short: Gets the number of rows needed to render the Tabs on the control.
element.descr: Always returns 1 in TTabControl.

element.name: TTabControl.ScrollTabs
element.short: Scrolls the tabs on the control horizontally by the value specified in Delta.

descr.p: DisplayRect is a read-only TRect property which contains the display area for the page in the tabbed control. It uses the client rectangle for the control as the value for the property. Use TabRect to get the display area for the tab in the tabbed control.

element.name: TCustomDrawTarget
element.short: TCustomDrawTarget - enumerated type controlling how a target object is drawn.

element.name: TCustomDrawTarget.dtControl
element.short: Draw the entire control.

element.name: TCustomDrawTarget.dtItem
element.short: Draw one item (or line in report mode).

element.name: TCustomDrawTarget.dtSubItem
element.short: Draw one subitem (except subitem 0 which is drawn by dtItem).

element.name: TCustomDrawStage
element.short: TCustomDrawStage a series of constants to define the drawing stages.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag
element.short: TCustomDrawStateFlag - series of flags to define the DrawState.

descr.p: TCustomDrawStateFlag is an enumerated type with values representing the drawing states available in custom-drawn controls. Values from the enumeration are stored in the TCustomDrawState set type passed as an argument to event handlers in list view and tree view controls, and stored internally in the controls.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsSelected
element.short: Control is drawn using the selected style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsGrayed
element.short: Control is drawn using the grayed or unselected style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsDisabled
element.short: Control is drawn using the disabled style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsChecked
element.short: Control is drawn using the checked style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsFocused
element.short: Control is drawn using the focused style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsDefault
element.short: Control is drawn using the default style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsHot
element.short: Control is drawn using the hot tracking style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsMarked
element.short: Control is drawn using the marked (multiselected) style.

element.name: TCustomDrawStateFlag.cdsIndeterminate
element.short: Control is drawn using the indeterminate state style.

module.element:
TCustomDrawState - set of TCustomDrawStateFlag. .
TCustomDrawState determines how a item will be drawn.

element.name: TCustomDrawResultFlag
element.short: TCustomDrawResultFlag - enumerated type, a series of flags to signify the result of a drawing process.

element.name: TSortType
element.short: Indicates the sort mechanism used for items in tree view and list view controls.

descr.p: TSortType is an enumerated type with values indicating the sort mechanism used for items in tree view or list view controls. TSortType is the type used to implement the SortType property in both TCustomTreeView and TCustomListView.

element.name: TSortType.stNone
element.short: Sorting is not used for list items.

element.name: TSortType.stData
element.short: List items are sorted by their data and not their display text.

element.name: TSortType.stText
element.short: List items are sorted by their display text and not their data.

element.name: TSortType.stBoth
element.short: List items are sorted using both display text and data.

element.name: TListItemState
element.short: Represents state values for items in a list view control.

descr.p: TListItemState is an enumerated type with values which represent the state for items in a list view control. The values reflect the current settings for properties in TListItem.
Values from TListItemState are stored in the TListItemStates set type.

element.name: TListItemState.lisCut
element.short: The list item has its Cut property set to True.

element.name: TListItemState.lisDropTarget
element.short: The list item has its DropTarget property set to True.

element.name: TListItemState.lisFocused
element.short: The list item has its Focused property set to True.

element.name: TListItemState.lisSelected
element.short: The list item has its Selected property set to True.

element.name: TListItemStates
element.short: Set type used to store value(s) from the TListItemState enumeration.

descr.p: TListItemStates is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TListItemState enumeration. TListItemStates is the type used to implement the States member in TListItem. Values are included in and excluded from the set when the corresponding properties in TListItem are changed.

element.name: TListItemFlag
element.short: TListItemFlag - enumerated type, a flag denoting a list item is being destroyed or created.

element.name: TListItemFlag.lifDestroying
element.short: List item has been marked for destruction by a notify message.

element.name: TListItemFlag.lifCreated
element.short: List item has been marked as created by a notify message.

element.name: TListItemFlags
element.short: Set type used to store TListItemFlag enumeration values.

descr.p: TListItemFlags is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TListItemFlag enumeration. It is the type used to implement the internal Flags member in TListItem.

element.name: TDisplayCode
element.short: TDisplayCode - enumerated type denoting how items are displayed.

descr.p: TDisplayCode is an enumerated type with values that denote how the item or subitem is displayed in a list view control. The values are passed as arguments to the DisplayRect and DisplayRectSubItem methods in TListItem, and allows the widgetset to layout and rendering the list items for the platform.

element.name: TDisplayCode.drBounds
element.short: List item is rendered using the Bounds for the item display rectangle.

element.name: TDisplayCode.drIcon
element.short: List item is rendered using the width and height for the associated image.

element.name: TDisplayCode.drLabel
element.short: List item is rendered using the text metrics for the caption in the item.

element.name: TDisplayCode.drSelectBounds
element.short: List item is rendered using the selection rectangle for the item.

element.name: TIconArrangement
element.short: Represents icon arrangement options in a list view control.

descr.p: TIconArrangement is an enumerated type with values representing the icon arrangement options for a list view control.

element.name: TIconArrangement.iaTop
element.short: Icons are arranged from the top to the bottom, then left to right in the control.

element.name: TIconArrangement.iaLeft
element.short: Icons are arranged from left to right, then top to bottom in the control.

element.name: TIconOptions
element.short: Contains text wrapping and icon layout settings for a list view control.

descr.p: TIconOptions is a TPersistent descendant which represents the text wrapping and icon layout settings in the IconOptions property in TCustomListView.

element.name: TIconOptions.GetAutoArrange
element.short: Gets the value for the AutoArrange property.

element.name: TIconOptions.GetAutoArrange.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TIconOptions.GetWrapText
element.short: Gets the value for the WrapText property.

element.name: TIconOptions.GetWrapText.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TIconOptions.SetArrangement
element.short: Sets the value for the Arrangement property.

element.name: TIconOptions.SetArrangement.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TIconOptions.SetAutoArrange
element.short: Sets the value for the AutoArrange property.

element.name: TIconOptions.SetAutoArrange.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TIconOptions.SetWrapText
element.short: Sets the value for the WrapText property.

element.name: TIconOptions.SetWrapText.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TIconOptions.AssignTo
element.short: Assign values from the class instance to the specified persistent object.

descr.p: AssignTo is an overridden method which implements support for the TIconOptions type in the RTL object persistence mechanism. AssignTo allows property values from the current class instance to the stored to the persistent object in Dest.
When Dest is a TIconOptions instance, AssignTo copies the values from the current class instance:
If ADest is not derived from TIconOptions, the inherited method is called.

element.name: TIconOptions.AssignTo.Dest
element.short: Persistent object where property values are stored.

element.name: TIconOptions.GetOwner
element.short: Gets the owner of the class instance.

descr.p: GetOwner is an overridden method in TIconOptions used to get the owner of the class instance. It returns the TCustomListView instance passed as an argument to the Create constructor.

element.name: TIconOptions.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TIconOptions.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create stores the value in AOwner to an internal member used in the class instance, and sets the default value for the Arrangement property to iaTop.

element.name: TIconOptions.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TIconOptions.Arrangement
element.short: Indicates the icon position relative to the caption in a list item.

descr.p: Arrangement is a TIconArrangement property which indicates the layout for the icon or image in a list item relative to its caption text. The default value for the property is iaTop, and causes the icon to be displayed above the caption for the list item.
See TIconArrangement for other values in the enumeration and their usage.

element.name: TIconOptions.AutoArrange
element.short: Indicates whether icons in a list view can be automatically arranged.

descr.p: AutoArrange is a Boolean property which indicates if icons in a list view control can be automatically arranged when items are added to the control. The default value for the property is False.
AutoArrange is used when the list view uses the vsIcon or vsSmallIcon view styles.

element.name: TIconOptions.WrapText
element.short: Indicates if the caption for a list item can wrap into multiple lines.

descr.p: WrapText is a Boolean property which indicates if the Caption for a list view item can be wrapped into multiple lines. The default value for the property is True.
The Caption for the item is wrapped when its length exceeds the width for the icon in the list item.

element.name: TListItem
element.short: Represents the items created in TCustomListView and descendants.

descr.p: TListItem is the base class for the Items created in TCustomListView and TListView.

TListItem provides properties which identify the content for the list item, like: Caption, SubItems, Data, Index, ImageIndeex, and StateIndex. Other properties indicate the disposition of the item in the control, like: Checked, Cut, DropTarget, Focused, and Selected.
Methods are provided that allow the list item to interact with the control and the widgetset class.
TListItem is the type used in the TListItems container.

element.name: TListItem.GetCaption
element.short: Gets the value for the Caption property.

element.name: TListItem.GetCaption.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetChecked
element.short: Gets the value for the Check property.

element.name: TListItem.GetChecked.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetLeft
element.short: Gets the value for the Left property.

element.name: TListItem.GetLeft.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetListView
element.short: Gets the value for the ListView property.

element.name: TListItem.GetListView.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetPosition
element.short: Gets the value for the Position property.

element.name: TListItem.GetPosition.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetState
element.short: Gets the value for a state property in the list item.

element.name: TListItem.GetState.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetState.AState
element.short: TListItemState enumeration value which identifies the property value returned from the method.

element.name: TListItem.GetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageIndex property.

element.name: TListItem.GetImageIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the Index property.

element.name: TListItem.GetIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetStateIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the StateIndex property.

element.name: TListItem.GetStateIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetSubItemImages
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed SubItemImages property.

element.name: TListItem.GetSubItemImages.Result
element.short: Value for the indexed property.

element.name: TListItem.GetSubItemImages.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the sub-item image in the property value.

element.name: TListItem.GetSubItems
element.short: Gets the value for the SubItems property.

element.name: TListItem.GetSubItems.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.GetTop
element.short: Gets the value for the Top property.

element.name: TListItem.GetTop.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetChecked
element.short: Sets the value for the Checked property.

element.name: TListItem.SetChecked.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetState
element.short: Sets the value for the property identified by the AState argument.

element.name: TListItem.SetState.AState
element.short: TListItemState value which identifies the property updated.

element.name: TListItem.SetState.AIsSet
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetData
element.short: Sets the value for the Data property.

element.name: TListItem.SetData.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageIndex property.

element.name: TListItem.SetImageIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetLeft
element.short: Sets the value for the Left property.

element.name: TListItem.SetLeft.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetCaption
element.short: Sets the value for the Caption property.

element.name: TListItem.SetCaption.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetPosition
element.short: Sets the value for the Position property.

element.name: TListItem.SetPosition.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetStateIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the StateIndex property.

element.name: TListItem.SetStateIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetSubItemImages
element.short: Sets the value for the indexed SubItemImages property.

element.name: TListItem.SetSubItemImages.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the new value.

element.name: TListItem.SetSubItemImages.AValue
element.short: New value for the indexed property.

element.name: TListItem.SetSubItems
element.short: Sets the value for the SubItems property.

element.name: TListItem.SetSubItems.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.SetTop
element.short: Sets the value for the Top property.

element.name: TListItem.SetTop.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TListItem.IsEqual
element.short: Determines if the specified list item has the same values as the current class instance.

descr.p: IsEqual is a Boolean function used to determine if the list item has the same values as the list item specified in AItem. IsEqual compares the values in the Caption, Data, and the internal FStates member in both TListItem instances. The return value is True when the content in the instances is the same.

element.name: TListItem.IsEqual.Result
element.short: True when the list items have the same content.

element.name: TListItem.IsEqual.AItem
element.short: List item compared to the current class instance.

element.name: TListItem.IsOwnerData
element.short: Determines if the list item has an owner with a valid handle.

descr.p: IsOwnerData is a Boolean function used to determine if the list item has an owner with a valid handle. IsOwnerData always returns False in TListItem. It is overridden in descendent classes like TOwnerDataListItem.

element.name: TListItem.IsOwnerData.Result
element.short: True if the list item has an owner with a valid handle.

element.name: TListItem.GetCheckedInternal
element.short: True if the member variable for the Checked property contains True.

descr.p: Used in methods in the widgetset class.

element.name: TListItem.GetOwner
element.short: Gets the owner of the class instance.

descr.p: Returns the value in the Owner property.

element.name: TListItem.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TListItem.Assign
element.short: Copies values from the specified persistent object into the current class instance.

descr.p: Assign is an overridden method used copy property values from the persistent object in ASource into the current class instance. When ASource is a TListItem descendant, the following property values are copied:
If ASource is not descended from TListItem, the inherited method is called to handle the assignment.

element.name: TListItem.Assign.ASource
element.short: Persistent object with values copied in the method.

element.name: TListItem.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. AOwner is the TListItems instance which acts as the container for the list item.

Create sets the default values in member variables used in the class instance. The property interfaces are not used before they are not available until the list item is added to the TListItems container.

element.name: TListItem.Create.AOwner
element.short: Container which owns the list item.

element.name: TListItem.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance.

Destroy sets the internal flag that marks the list item for destruction in the Owner. When the Owner is assigned, its ItemDestroying method is called to signal destruction of the list item in the container.
Destroy free and Nils resources allocated for the SubItems property, and calls the inherited destructor prior to exit.

element.name: TListItem.Delete
element.short: Removes the list item from the container.

element.name: TListItem.MakeVisible
element.short: Makes the item visible in the list view control which owns the container and the list item.

element.name: TListItem.MakeVisible.PartialOK
element.short: True is the list item can be partially visible in the control.

element.name: TListItem.DisplayRect
element.short: DisplayRect - returns the coordinates of a rectangle for displaying the current item.

descr.p: DisplayRect - returns the coordinates of a rectangle for displaying the current item.
Display codes can be: drBounds, drIcon, drLabel, drSelectBounds.

element.name: TListItem.DisplayRectSubItem
element.short: DisplayRectSubItem - returns the coordinates of a display rectangle for a specified sub-item.

descr.p: DisplayRectSubItem - returns the coordinates of a display rectangle for a specified sub-item.
Display codes can be: drBounds, drIcon, drLabel, drSelectBounds.

element.name: TListItem.EditCaption
element.short: Makes the item the selection in the list view control and displays the editor when allowed.

element.name: TListItem.EditCaption.Result
element.short: True if the control is not ReadOnly and the editor is valid, otherwise False.

element.name: TListItem.GetStates
element.short: Returns all the states for the list item.

descr.p: GetStates is a TListItemStates function used to get the state values for an item in a list view control. The state values are retrieved using methods in the widgetset class for the TCustomListView control which owns the list item. If the widgetset class does not return the values, the return value contains the existing values in the States member for the TListItem instance.

element.name: TListItem.GetStates.Result
element.short: State values for the list item.

element.name: TListItem.Caption
element.short: Caption - the name given to this item on the list.

element.name: TListItem.Checked
element.short: Checked - if True, a check mark is present beside the item implying it has been selected.

element.name: TListItem.Cut
element.short: Cut this item from the list (but it can be placed on the clipboard).

element.name: TListItem.Data
element.short: Pointer to the Data associated with this item.

element.name: TListItem.DropTarget
element.short: DropTarget - returns True if this is a valid target on the list for dropping.

element.name: TListItem.Focused
element.short: Property is true if this item has Focus.

element.name: TListItem.Index
element.short: The index of this item in the list (integer).

element.name: TListItem.ImageIndex
element.short: The index of the image associated with this Item in the list.

element.name: TListItem.Left
element.short: The position of the Left side of the list item.

element.name: TListItem.ListView
element.short: The ListView in which this Item is found.

element.name: TListItem.Owner
element.short: The Owner of the ListItem.

element.name: TListItem.Position
element.short: The coordinates of the position where the ListItem is located.

element.name: TListItem.Selected
element.short: Whether this Item has been Selected (often denoted by a check-mark).

descr.p: Selected is a Boolean property which indicates if the list item has been selected. The property value is determined by examing the internal TListItemStates set for the class instance. When lisSelected has been included in the state values, the property is True. Otherwise, the property is False.

Setting a new value for the property causes the value lisSelected to be included in or removed from the internal set. AIsSet indicates whether the state value is set. When True, the state value is included in the set. Otherwise, the state value is excluded.

element.name: TListItem.SubItems
element.short: The list of SubItems associated with this ListItem.

element.name: TListItem.SubItemImages
element.short: SubItemImages - the list of Images associated with the SubItems.

element.name: TListItem.Top
element.short: The position of the Top of this ListItem.

element.name: TListItemClass
element.short: Class reference used to create new instances of TListItem.

element.name: TOwnerDataListItem
element.descr: TOwnerDataListItem is a TListItem descendant.

element.name: TListItemsEnumerator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TListItemsEnumerator.Create.AItems
element.short: List items navigated in the enumerator.

element.name: TListItemsFlag
element.short: Widgetset flags applied to the TListItems container.

element.name: TListItemsFlags
element.short: Set type used to store TListItemsFlag enumeration values.

element.name: TListItems
element.short: TListItems - a list of items with a cache of the last accessed item.
element.descr: TListitems has a built-in cache for the last accessed item. This will speed up interface updates since Item.Index is often used for the same item updating more properties. If FCacheIndex contains -1 then the cache is not valid.

element.name: TListItems.ReadData
element.descr: Reads data in a Delphi compatible way.

element.name: TListItems.ReadLazData
element.descr: Reads data in a 64-bit safe way.

element.name: TListItems.WriteLazData
element.descr: Writes data in a 64-bit safe way.

element.name: TListItems.DefineProperties
element.short: DefineProperties - calls inherited method, then defines some specific binary properties.

element.name: TListItems.GetCount
element.short: GetCount - find the number of Items in the list.

module.element: GetItem returns the ListItem specified by AIndex. .

element.name: TListItems.WSCreateItems
element.short: WSCreateItems - instruction to the widgetset to create Items.

element.name: TListItems.SetItem
element.short: SetItem - writes the Index and content of a given Item to a local variable.

element.name: TListItems.Add
element.short: Add an Item to the Collection.

element.name: TListItems.AddItem
element.short: AddItem - add the specified AItem to the collection.

element.name: TListItems.BeginUpdate
element.short: BeginUpdate - start the update process.

element.name: TListItems.Clear
element.short: Clear - remove all Items from the list.

element.name: TListItems.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TListItems: calls inherited Create then creates the list.

module.element:
Destroy destructor for TListItems: frees the individual items on the list, then calls inherited Destroy. .
TPersistent.Destroy

element.name: TListItems.Delete
element.short: Remove the Item specified by AIndex from the collection.

element.name: TListItems.EndUpdate
element.short: EndUpdate - finish the update process.

element.name: TListItems.FindCaption
element.short: FindCaption - returns the ListItem with the specified caption at the given starting place.

element.name: TListItems.FindData
element.short: FindData - returns the ListItem associated with the specified data pointer.

element.name: TListItems.Insert
element.short: Insert an item in the list at AIndex, returning the value of the ListItem.

element.name: TListItems.InsertItem
element.short: InsertItem - procedure to insert AItem at position AIndex in the list.

element.name: TListItems.Count
element.short: Count - the number of items in the collection.

element.name: TListItems.Item
element.short: An Item in the list, specified by its Index value.

element.name: TListItems.Owner
element.short: Owner - the ListView that owns this collection of ListItems.

element.name: TWidth
element.short: ImageIndex.
element.descr: TWidth is an Integer range type. Range is 0..MaxInt.

descr.p: TSortIndicator is an enumerated type with values that represent the sort indicators available in the TListColumn class. TSortIndicator is the type used to implement the SortIndicator property in TListColumn.

element.name: TSortIndicator.siNone
element.short: No sort indicator is used for the list column.

element.name: TSortIndicator.siAscending
element.short: Uses an ascending sort indicator for the list column.

element.name: TSortIndicator.siDescending
element.short: Uses a descending sort indicator for the list column.

element.name: TListColumn
element.short: Represents an individual column in a multi-column list control.

descr.p: TListColumn is a TCollectionItem descendant which represents an individual column in a multi-column list control.
TListColumn is the type used for items added to the TListColumns collection.

element.name: TListColumn.SetIndex
element.short: SetIndex - calls inherited method and if this is a new index value, changes to the new column index.

element.name: TListColumn.GetDisplayName
element.short: GetDisplayName returns the Caption; if this is blank, calls inherited method.

element.name: TListColumn.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TListColumn: calls inherited Create then sets defaults for size, alignment and index.

element.name: TListColumn.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TListColumn: if update allowed, updates columns then calls inherited Destroy.

element.name: TListColumn.Assign
element.short: Assign - if source is of correct type, copies alignment, caption, visibility and size properties, otherwise calls inherited Assign which probably raises an exception.

element.name: TListColumn.WidthType
element.descr: WidthType is a read-only TWidth property.

element.name: TListColumn.Alignment
element.short: Sets alignment of caption: text is left or right justified or centered.

element.name: TListColumn.AutoSize
element.short: When other columns have fixed width, auto-calculate width of this column, to fill entire width.

element.name: TListColumn.Caption
element.short: Caption text of column.

element.name: TListColumn.ImageIndex
element.short: Index of icon, inside ImageList object for columns of Listview.

element.name: TListColumn.MaxWidth
element.short: Maximal width for this column.

element.name: TListColumn.MinWidth
element.short: Minimal width for this column.

element.name: TListColumn.Tag
element.short: Int value, to store some info for this column.

element.name: TListColumn.Visible
element.short: Allow to show this column.

element.name: TListColumn.Width
element.short: Current width of column. May be calculated auto, if AutoSize used.

element.name: TListColumn.SortIndicator
element.short: Indicator of the sorting order. Serves only the visual purpose, doesn't affect the actual sorting order.

element.name: TListColumns
element.short: TListColumns - a collection of Items of type TListColumn (the columns appearing in a multi-column list).

element.name: TListColumns.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TListColumns: sets ownership then calls inherited Create.

element.name: TListViewProperty

descr.p: TListViewProperty is an enumerated type with values representing Boolean properties used in TCustomListView.

Values from the enumeration are included in or excluded from the TListViewProperties set type. When a value is included in the set, the corresponding Boolean property has been set to True. When a value is excluded from the set, the corresponding Boolean property has been set to False.

element.name: TListViewProperties
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TListViewProperty enumeration.

descr.p: TListViewProperties is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TListViewProperty enumeration.

The set represents Boolean property values found in TCustomListView / TListView. When a value is included in the set, the corresponding property in TCustomListView has been set to True. The value is excluded from the set when the corresponding property in TCustomListView is set to False.
TListViewProperties is the type used to implement the internal FProperties member in TCustomListView.

element.name: TListHotTrackStyle
element.short: Represents cursor shapes displayed during hot tracking in a control.

descr.p: TListHotTrackStyle is an enumerated type with values for cursor shapes displayed for the "hot tracking" state in a TCustomListView control. Hot tracking occurs when the mouse pointer hovers over an item in a control, and it is highlighted (aka hot-lighted). Values from TListHotTrackStyle are stored in the TListHotTrackStyles set type used for the TCustomListView.HotTrackStyles property.

element.short: For current ListView item, show the HandPoint mouse cursor.

element.name: TListHotTrackStyle.htUnderlineHot
element.short: For current ListView item, show the bold underline.

descr.p: TListHotTrackStyles is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TListHotTrackStyle enumeration. TListHotTrackStyles is the type used to implement the TCustomListView.HotTrackStyles property.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor
element.short: Provides multi-platform editing capabilities for a list view control.

descr.p: Used to provide multi-platform editing capabilities for TCustomListView. Implements the internal editor control in TCustomListView.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.ListViewEditorKeyDown
element.short: Implements the OnKeyDown event handler for the editor control.

descr.p: Ensures that the VK_ESCAPE and VK_RETURN virtual key codes are handled for the editor. VK_ESCAPE causes the editor to be hidden, and focused in returned to the parent control. VK_RETURN does not hide the editor, but focus is returned to the parent control. In both cases, Key is set to 0 to indicate that the key was handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.ListViewEditorKeyDown.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.ListViewEditorKeyDown.Key
element.short: Virtual key code examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.ListViewEditorKeyDown.Shift
element.short: Shift / Ctrl / Alt modifier for the key code.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.DoExit
element.short: Performs actions needed when the editor loses focus.

descr.p: Calls the HideEditor method in the parent control (TCustomListView). Calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.
element.descr: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry.

element.name: TCustomListViewEditor.Item
element.short: List item updated in the editor control.

descr.p: Item is a TListItem property with the list item updated in the editor control. The value in Item is assigned in the ShowEditor method in the parent control (TCustomListView). Item is set to Nil when the editor control is hidden.

element.name: TCustomListView
element.short: TCustomListView - the base class for TListView.

descr.p: TCustomListView is the base class for TListView. It provides a multi-platform implementation of the List View control from the Windows API. TCustomListView allows a collection of items to be displayed using different view styles. For instance:

dl.dd: Each list item has an large icon with a caption.
Each list item has a small icon with a caption.
Each list item has a small icon with a caption, and is displayed in a single column in the control.
Each list item is displayed on a single line, with sub-items displayed as additional columns. The first column has a small icon and a caption. Other columns contain the text for the sub-items.

descr.remark: TCustomListView does not implement some features available for Windows version 6 or higher, including: the Tile View style, List View Item Grouping, and List View Work Areas.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetProperty

descr.p: GetProperty is a Boolean method used to determine if the specified property value has been set to True in the control.

ALvpOrd contains a value from the TListViewProperty enumeration which identifies the property value accessed in the method. The return value is True when ALvpOrd has been included in the internal TListViewProperties set.
This technique allows multiple Boolean properties to be represented using a single set type member variable. It avoids allocating a Boolean member for each of the property values.
GetProperty is used as the read access specifier for several properties in TCustomListView, including:
See SetProperty for the write access specifier equivalent.

element.name: TCustomListView.ResizeLastColumn
element.short: Makes the last visible column fill the remaining width in the control.

descr.p: ResizeLastColumn is a method used to make the last visible column fill the remaining unused width for the control.
ResizeLastColumn is relevant when ViewStyle is set to vsList or vsReport, and ColumnCount is not set to 0 (zero). No actions are performed in the method if both conditions are not met.

ResizeLastColumn examines the values in Columns (in reverse order) to find the last TListColumn instance with its Visible property set to True. The accumulated width for the preceding visible columns (and borders) is calculated. The difference between ClientWidth and the accumulated width is used for the last column when it is a positive non-zero value.
The column affected in the method has its AutoSize, MinWidth, and MaxWidth properties reset before applying the new Width.
ResizeLastColumn is used when AutoWidthLastColumn is set to True. The method is called when the bounds for the control have been changed, or when the value in AutoWidthLastColumn has been changed.

element.name: TCustomListView.HideEditor
element.short: Hides the editor control for the list view.

descr.p: HideEditor is a method used to hide the TCustomListViewEditor instance used as the editor in the list view control.

HideEditor applies the current text in the editor to the selected Item by calling DoEndEdit. The Visible property in the editor is set to False. Values in the editor are reset, including the reference to the list item and the bounds for the editor control.
HideEditor is called when the list view control loses focus. It is also called when horizontal and vertical scroll messages are handled in the control, and when a column has been clicked.
Use ShowEditor to configure and display the editor for the current item in the list view control.

element.name: TCustomListView.ShowEditor
element.short: Displays the editor for the list view.

element.name: TCustomListView.WMHScroll
element.short: Handles the LM_HSCROLL message for the control.

element.short: Indicates if ShowEditor has been called asynchronously for the control.

element.short: ItemDeleted - the specified listitem is removed from the list.

element.name: TCustomListView.ItemInserted
element.short: ItemInserted - the specified item is inserted into the list.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size for new instances of the class.

element.name: TCustomListView.InitializeWnd
element.short: InitializeWnd - calls inherited method, then sets various local properties.
element.descr: InitializeWnd - calls inherited method, then sets style, adds columns, sets imagelists and item depending properties (scroll bars, sorting etc), adds items and sets other miscellaneous properties (default item height, hot track styles, hover time etc)

element.name: TCustomListView.FinalizeWnd
element.short: FinalizeWnd stores the list origin then calls inherited method.

element.short: Signals the OnCreateItemClass event handler (when assigned) to get the class type used for new list items, and creates a new list item.

element.short: List item created in the method.

element.short: Creates a new TListItems instance.

element.name: TCustomListView.CreateListItems.Result
element.short: TListItems instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomListView.CanEdit
element.short: Determines if the specified Item can be edited in the control.

descr.p: CanEdit is a Boolean function used to determine if the editor can be displayed and activated for the specified Item. The return value defaults to True.

CanEdit signals the OnEditing event handler (when assigned), where the return value can be modified. Use values in Item or the list view control to determine the return value (including their respective ReadOnly properties).
CanEdit is called from the ShowEditor method, and occurs before the Editor in the control is configured and displayed.

element.name: TCustomListView.CanEdit.Result
element.short: True if the editor can be displayed and activated for the specified item.

element.name: TCustomListView.CanEdit.Item
element.short: List item to examine in the method.

element.name: TCustomListView.Change
element.short: Change - Internal procedure to simulate the OnChange event.

descr.p: This is an internal procedure which is called after an item has been changed. It is a programmatic method for simulating the OnChange event if the programmer has assigned a method to this event.

element.name: TCustomListView.ColClick
element.short: ColClick - procedure to simulate the OnColumnClick event.

descr.p: ColClick - procedure to simulate the OnColumnClick event. Can be used in code to execute the same code as is used to respond to the OnColumnClick event.

element.name: TCustomListView.Delete
element.short: Deletes the specified list item.

descr.p: Delete is a method used to delete the list item specified in AItem.

In Delphi, Delete is called in reaction to Items.Delete. But if you call it directly, it will also do the actual deletion and then call the OnDeletion handler. We simply call Items.Delete and this will then call Delete again and in the second run we call the OnDeletion handler. Not 100% Delphi compatible, but more compatible then it was before. (BB)

element.name: TCustomListView.Delete.AItem
element.short: List item deleted in the method.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoDeletion
element.short: Performs actions needed to delete the specified list item.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoInsert
element.short: Performs actions needed to insert the specified list item.

element.name: TCustomListView.InsertItem
element.short: Inserts an Item into the List.

descr.p: Signals the OnInsert event handler (when assigned) using the value in AItem as an argument.
InsertItem is called from the DoInsert method when an overridden method has been implemented in a descendent class and called from ItemInserted.

element.name: TCustomListView.InsertItem.AItem
element.short: Item with the values inserted into the Items for the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoItemChecked
element.short: Synchronizes the checked state for an item with the widgetset class.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoSelectItem
element.short: Signals the OnSelectItem event handler when the current selection is changed.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoAutoAdjustLayout
element.short: Adjusts layout for the list view using the specified arguments.

descr.p: DoAutoAdjustLayout is an overridden procedure used to adjust the layout for the list view using the specified arguments. DoAutoAdjustLayout calls the inherited method.

DoAutoAdjustLayout extends the ancestor method to include support for sizing the columns in the list view using the proportions specified in AXProportion and AYProportion for the display density (DPI). DoAutoAdjustLayout also ensures that the widgetset class is initialized for each of the image list sizes represented by the TListViewImageList enumeration.
No actions are performed in the method if AMode does not include one of the following values: lapAutoAdjustWithoutHorizontalScrolling or lapAutoAdjustForDPI.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AMode
element.short: Layout adjustment policy used in the method.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AXProportion
element.short: Factor used to adjust widths.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AYProportion
element.short: Factor used to adjust heights.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoSetBounds
element.short: Resizes the last column (if enabled) when the bounds for the control have been changed.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoEndEdit
element.short: Performs actions when editing has been completed for an item in the control.

descr.p: Calls an overridden Edit method when available, or signals the OnEdited event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomListView.Edit
element.short: Signals OnEdited to validate the editor text, and updates the caption for the specified list item.

element.name: TCustomListView.Edit.AItem
element.short: List item updated in the method.

element.name: TCustomListView.ImageChanged
element.short: ImageChanged - procedure to signal that an image has changed.

descr.p: Creates columns in the widgetset class when the Handle for the control has been allocated. Calls the inherited method prior to exit.
Ensures that members for the LargeImages, SmallImages, and StateImages are set to Nil when the corresponding image list is removed.

element.name: TCustomListView.IsCustomDrawn
element.short: IsCustomDrawn - returns True if a target has been custom drawn.

descr.p: Indicates whether the control, items, or sub-items are custom-drawn using the event handlers available in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.CustomDraw
element.short: CustomDraw - performs custom drawing in the given rectangle and returns True if successful.

descr.p: Draws the control using the OnCustomDraw or OnAdvancedCustomDraw event handlers (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomListView.CustomDrawItem
element.short: CustomDrawItem - custom draws the specified item and returns True if successful.

descr.p: Draws an item in the control using the OnCustomDrawItem or OnAdvancedCustomDrawItem event handlers (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomListView.CustomDrawSubItem
element.short: CustomDrawSubItem - custom draws the specified subitem returning True if successful.

descr.p: Draws a sub-item in the control using the OnCustomDrawSubItem and OnAdvancedCustomDrawSubItem event handlers (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomListView.IntfCustomDraw
element.short: IntfCustomDraw - uses the interface to perform custom drawing and returns a result of drawing.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetUpdateCount
element.short: Gets the value for the internal update counter.
element.descr: The internal counter is maintained when the BeginUpdate and EndUpdate methods are called.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetUpdateCount.Result
element.short: Value for the internal update counter in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.DrawItem
element.short: Draws the specified list item with a given state.

descr.p: Signals the OndrawItem event handler (when assigned) to draw the list item. Calls the FillRect and TextOut methods in the control Canvas when the event handler is not assigned.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoGetOwnerData
element.short: Performs actions to get list item data when OwnerData is True.

descr.p: Signals the OnData event handler (when assigned) to get the data for the list item. Properties in Item are updated in the event handler with the values needed for the list item.

element.name: TCustomListView.DoOwnerDataHint
element.short: Signals the OnDataHint event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomListView.DoOwnerDataStateChange
element.short: Signals the OnDataStateChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomListView.DblClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control is double clicked.

descr.p: Calls the inherited DblClick method. Ensures that ShowEditorQueued is set to True when the control has an assigned editor and is not marked as read-only.
Handles an F2 function key pressed when the control has focus. Ensures that the editor is displayed when the control is not marked as ReadOnly. The keystroke is digested (set to zero).
If the control is marked as ReadOnly, or Key is not the unshifted F2 function key, the inherited KeyDown method is called to handle the values in Key and Shift.

element.name: TCustomListView.AllocBy
element.short: When new items add to list, increase internal buffer capacity by this amount. Needed to not add to internal buffer by one.

element.name: TCustomListView.AutoSort
element.short: When user clicks ListView header's column, sort ListView by this column. After next click, sort in other order.

element.name: TCustomListView.AutoSortIndicator
element.short: If AutoSort is used on TListView, this property controls, if TListView should also automatically set SortIndicator for the selected sorting column.

element.name: TCustomListView.AutoWidthLastColumn
element.short: Resizes the last column to fill entire ListView width in Report view.

element.name: TCustomListView.ColumnClick
element.short: Enable to react to clicks on ListView header columns, and call the OnColumnClick event.

element.name: TCustomListView.Columns
element.short: Collection of items, which have properties for ListView columns (size, alignment, image index, etc.).

element.name: TCustomListView.DefaultItemHeight
element.short: Default height for items displayed in the ListView.

element.name: TCustomListView.HideSelection
element.short: If control looses focus, don't paint selection background for selected item(s).

element.name: TCustomListView.HoverTime
element.short: Time (in milliseconds) for which the mouse cursor must hover over an item before its tooltip is shown.

element.name: TCustomListView.LargeImages
element.short: ImageList object, which contains "big" icons for one if ListView layouts.

descr.p: A typical application might have two ImageLists: one of LargeImages and one of SmallImages containing two versions of the same collection of images, in large and small format; the index numbers of the first list would correspond with those in the second list.

SmallImages could be displayed beside the text strings in the list view and the programmer would supply code to ensure that when an item with its associated SmallImage was selected, the corresponding LargeImage would be displayed in another window.

A TImageList control needs to be selected and pasted on to the Form Designer and the ImageList Editor can be opened from the pop-up menu obtained by right-clicking on TImageList icon in the Form Designer. Then in the StringList editor for Items the correct ImageIndex must be allocated to each entry in the list.

element.name: TCustomListView.LargeImagesWidth
element.short: Contains the Width for the large images used in the list view.

descr.p: LargeImagesWidth is an Integer property used to access the width for large images in the list view. Reading and writing a value to the property accesses an internal array with width values for the image list using the TListViewImageList enumeration value. The default value for the property is zero (0).

element.name: TCustomListView.OwnerDraw
element.short: Use owner-draw mode. It means that program must paint ListView items, using OnCustomDraw* or OnAdvancedCustomDraw* events.

element.name: TCustomListView.ScrollBars
element.short: Kind of scrollbars in control: vertical, horizontal, none or both. Auto* mean that scrollbars hide automatically.

element.name: TCustomListView.ShowColumnHeaders
element.short: Show header area in ListView, which shows captions of columns.

element.name: TCustomListView.ShowWorkAreas
element.descr: The WorkAreas property sets the work areas in the ListView. This property allows to highlight each work area with its own color and show with own caption.

element.name: TCustomListView.SmallImages
element.short: ImageList object, which contains "small" icons for one if ListView layouts.

descr.p: A typical application might have two ImageLists: one of LargeImages and one of SmallImages containing two versions of the same collection of images, in large and small format; the index numbers of the first list would correspond with those in the second list.

SmallImages could be displayed beside the text strings in the list view and the programmer would supply code to ensure that when an item with its associated SmallImage was selected, the corresponding LargeImage would be displayed in another window.

A TImageList control needs to be selected and pasted on to the Form Designer and the ImageList Editor can be opened from the pop-up menu obtained by right-clicking on TImageList icon in the Form Designer. Then in the StringList editor for Items the correct ImageIndex must be allocated to each entry in the list.

element.name: TCustomListView.SmallImagesWidth
element.short: Width for the images in the SmallImages property.
element.descr: SmallImagesWidth is an Integer property that indicates the width used for small images displayed in the list view. The default value for the property is zero (0).

element.name: TCustomListView.SortType
element.short: Specifies the sorting mechanism used for the current SortColumn.

element.name: TCustomListView.SortColumn
element.short: Index of the column used to sort the items in the control, or -1 for none.

element.name: TCustomListView.SortDirection
element.short: Sorting direction (order) for the current SortColumn.

element.name: TCustomListView.StateImages
element.short: ImageList object with the state images for the items in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.StateImagesWidth
element.short: Width of the images in the StateImages property.

descr.p: StateImagesWidth is an Integer property the represents width used for state images displayed in the list view. The default value for the property is zero (0) and indicates that a default image width has not been specified.

element.name: TCustomListView.ToolTips
element.short: Indicates if a hint (tooltip) is automatically displayed for an item under the mouse cursor.

element.name: TCustomListView.ViewStyle
element.short: Sets one of ListView layouts: List (simple column), Report (few columns with full width), Icon (big icons), Small Icon (small icons, 16x16).

element.name: TCustomListView.OnChange
element.short: Called when content of list collection changes.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnColumnClick
element.short: Called when user clicks on column's header area.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnCompare
element.short: Called during sorting of list, by one of columns, to compare items.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnCreateItemClass
element.short: Event handler signalled to get the class used to create new list view items.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnData
element.short: Called for owner-data mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnDataFind
element.short: Called for owner-data mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnDataHint
element.short: Called for owner-data mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnDataStateChange
element.short: Called for owner-data mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnDeletion
element.short: Called when items are deleted by code.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnEdited
element.short: Event handler signalled when editing has been completed for an item in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnEditing
element.short: Event handler signalled to determine if editing can be started for an item in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnInsert
element.short: Called when items are inserted by code.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnSelectItem
element.short: Called when items are selected or selection changes.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnCustomDraw
element.short: Called for owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnCustomDrawItem
element.short: Called for owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnCustomDrawSubItem
element.short: Called for owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnDrawItem
element.short: event handler signalled to render an owner drawn item.

descr.p: OnDrawItem is a TLVDrawItemEvent property which is the event handler signalled to render an owner drawn item. The event is triggered (when assigned) in the DrawItem method only when OwnerDraw is set to True and ViewStyle contains vsReport.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnAdvancedCustomDraw
element.short: Called for owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnAdvancedCustomDrawItem
element.short: Called for owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.OnAdvancedCustomDrawSubItem
element.short: Called for owner-draw mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomListView: calls inherited Create then initializes columns, the list of items, the canvas and properties and some formats and styles.

element.name: TCustomListView.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.
element.descr: Destroy is the destructor for TCustomListView. It frees the Canvas, calls the inherited Destroy, and frees the columns and list items.

element.name: TCustomListView.AddItem
element.short: Adds a list item with the specified caption and optional object.

element.name: TCustomListView.AddItem.Item
element.short: Caption for the new list item.

element.name: TCustomListView.AddItem.AObject
element.short: Optional object instance for the list item.

element.name: TCustomListView.AlphaSort
element.short: Sorts the first column for the list view in ascending order.
element.descr: Always sorts column 0 in sdAscending order.

element.name: TCustomListView.Sort
element.short: Sorts the values in Items when SortType is not stNone and SortColumn is valid.

element.name: TCustomListView.CustomSort
element.short: Sorts the Items for the control using the specified procedure or the OnCompare event handler.

element.name: TCustomListView.BeginUpdate
element.short: BeginUpdate - start updating the list view.

element.name: TCustomListView.Clear
element.short: Clears the Items for the list view.

element.name: TCustomListView.EndUpdate
element.short: Finishes an active update for the list view.

element.name: TCustomListView.Repaint
element.short: Updates the OwnerData (when used), and repaints the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.FindCaption
element.short: FindCaption- search for and return the list item that contains the nominated caption.

descr.p: FindCaption- search for and return the list item that contains the nominated caption.
Starting from item at StartIndex
Looking for the string with the content in Value
Partial, Inclusive, Wrap, PartStart: Boolean arguments that allow matches with part of the string, permitting the string to wrap over a line, etc.

element.name: TCustomListView.FindData
element.short: Locates the specified list item data in the Items for the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetHitTestInfoAt
element.short: Gets hit text information from the widgetset class when its Handle has been assigned.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetItemAt
element.short: GetItemAt - find and return the list item at the specified coordinates.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetNearestItem
element.short: Locates the list item closest to the specified position.

descr.p: GetNearestItem is used to locate a list item from a position specified in pixel coordinates relative to the top left corner of the list view. It starts looking at the position specified by the Point parameter, and moves in the direction indicated by the Direction parameter until it locates a list item.If no item is found Nil is returned.

element.name: TCustomListView.GetNextItem
element.short: Gets the next list item in the given direction from the starting item.

descr.p: GetNextItem is a TListItem function used to find the next list item after StartItem in the direction given by the Direction parameter. Only items in the state indicated by the States parameter are considered. If no item is found, Nil is returned.

element.name: TCustomListView.ClearSelection
element.short: Clears single or multi-selections in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.SelectAll
element.short: Selects all items in the control when MultiSelect has been enabled.

element.name: TCustomListView.IsEditing
element.short: Indicates if the list view editor is active.
element.descr: Delphi compatible function which returns if our listview editor is active.

element.name: TCustomListView.BoundingRect
element.short: Coordinates of the rectangle containing the ListView.

element.name: TCustomListView.Canvas
element.short: TCanvas object, defines the area on which all graphic is drawn.

element.name: TCustomListView.Checkboxes
element.short: Show the check-boxes column, at the side of usual lines. Allows to check/uncheck items.

element.name: TCustomListView.Column
element.short: Property of ListView columns.

descr.p: This property can be used to read the information of a column.

The column whose information is to be retrieved is determined by an index (AIndex). As with nearly all indexes, this index is 0 based. In column[0] the caption of the listitem is show, in subsequent column the subitems of the listitem are shown.
To add, change or delete a column use the Columns property.

element.name: TCustomListView.Column.AIndex
element.short: Integer to determine the column of the ListView to retrieve information on.

element.name: TCustomListView.ColumnCount
element.short: The number of defined Columns for the control.
element.descr: ColumnCount is a read-only Integer property which indicates the number of columns displayed for the list view.

element.name: TCustomListView.DropTarget
element.short: The list item that is the drop target on the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.FlatScrollBars
element.short: Show ListView scrollbars in "flat" style (default off, not for all widgetsets).

element.name: TCustomListView.FullDrag
element.short: Indicates whether column headers are redrawn when they are dragged.

element.name: TCustomListView.GridLines
element.short: Show 1-pixel lines, as a grid, between rows and columns.

element.name: TCustomListView.HotTrack
element.short: Allow to highlight/underline current ListView item, which is under mouse cursor.

descr.p: HotTrack is the name given to the feature whereby, as the mouse pointer moves over some graphic item (e.g. a tab, an entry in a list, a button or other control in a form), that item becomes emphasized in some way.
The default list of emphasis possibilities is given by the definition.
In other words:

ul.li: It may be indicated by a hand pointer
It may be underlined even when Cold (i.e. the pointer has covered it and moved on but the underlining remains)
It may be underlined when Hot (i.e. when the pointer is directly on the item)

descr.p: This feature can be used in List Views and in TabControls.

element.name: TCustomListView.HotTrackStyles
element.short: More options for HotTrack property.

element.name: TCustomListView.IconOptions
element.short: Options for layouts, which show icons. Sets arrangement of icons, text-wrapping state.

element.name: TCustomListView.ItemFocused
element.short: ListView item, which is shown as focused.

element.name: TCustomListView.ItemIndex
element.short: Contains the position for the selected item in the control.

element.name: TCustomListView.Items
element.short: Collection of items in ListView.

descr.p: Items - the list of entries in the list. Held as a linked list with a cached index of the last accessed item.

Items is of type TListitems which has a built-in cache of the last accessed item. This speeds up interface updates since Item.Index is often used for the same item updating more properties. If FCacheIndex = -1 then the cache is not valid.

element.name: TCustomListView.MultiSelect
element.short: Allow to select several Listview items at a time, using Ctrl+click (select one item more).

element.name: TCustomListView.OwnerData
element.short: Use owner-data mode for ListView. It means, that ListView don't contain items, you must supply them using OnData* events.

element.name: TCustomListView.ReadOnly
element.short: Don't allow user to change item captions, by click with a delay.

element.name: TCustomListView.RowSelect
element.short: In Report view, this allows to highlight entire selected row, until right edge of ListView.

element.name: TCustomListView.SelCount
element.short: Number of currently selected items.

element.name: TCustomListView.Selected
element.short: Listview item, which is 1st selected.

element.name: TCustomListView.LastSelected
element.short: Listview item, which is last selected, in MultiSelect mode.

element.name: TCustomListView.TopItem
element.short: Listview item, which is shown at the top edge of ListView.

element.name: TCustomListView.ViewOrigin
element.short: Coordinate of the left/top visible point in ListView, updates when Listview scrolls.

element.name: TCustomListView.VisibleRowCount
element.short: Number of rows, which is currently shown with current Listview position/size/layout.

element.name: TListView
element.short: TListView - a window showing a list of Items which may or may not have associated icons.

descr.p: TListView - a window showing a list of items which may or may not have associated icons.

At first this control looks very like TListBox but it has a much higher degree of complexity. It is capable of displaying Items in Columns of Rows and it can have images associated with the list Items.

The important information is held in Items, a string-list that can be created using the string-list editor obtained by right-clicking on the ListView in the Form Editor or by clicking on the ellipsis (...) next to the Items entry in the Object Inspector.

A typical application might have two ImageLists: one of LargeImages and one of SmallImages, containing two versions of the same collection of images, in large and small format; the index numbers of the first list would correspond with those in the second list.

SmallImages (if assigned to a string-list) can be displayed beside the text strings in the list view and the programmer would supply code to ensure that when an item with its associated Small Image was selected, the corresponding Large Image would be displayed in another window.

One or more TImageList controls need to be selected and pasted on to the Form Designer and the ImageList Editor can be opened from the pop-up menu obtained by right-clicking on TImageList icon in the Form Designer. The image list can be populated by reading from files. Then in the StringList editor for Items the correct ImageIndex must be allocated to each entry in the list.

element.name: TProgressBarOrientation
element.short: Represents the orientations used for a progress bar.

descr.p: TProgressBarOrientation is an enumerated type with values that represent the orientations used for a progress bar. TProgressBarOrientation is the type used to implement the TCustomProgressBar.Orientation property.

element.name: TProgressBarOrientation.pbHorizontal
element.short: Progress bar is oriented horizontally, and displays progress from left to right.

element.name: TProgressBarOrientation.pbVertical
element.short: Progress bar is oriented vertically, and displays progress from bottom to top.

element.name: TProgressBarOrientation.pbRightToLeft
element.short: Progress bar is oriented horizontally, and displays progress from right to left.

element.name: TProgressBarOrientation.pbTopDown
element.short: Progress bar is oriented vertically, and displays progress from top to bottom.

element.name: TProgressBarStyle
element.short: Represents the visual display styles used for a progress bar.

descr.p: TProgressBarStyle is an enumerated type with values that represent visual display styles for a progress bar. TProgressBarStyle is the type used to implement the TCustomProgressBar.Style property.

element.name: TProgressBarStyle.pbstNormal
element.short: Progress bar indicator is displayed as a static bar using the native drawing style or theme for the platform.

element.name: TProgressBarStyle.pbstMarquee
element.short: Progress bar indicator is displayed as an animated marquee, where movement indicates activity but does not reflect the completed portion of a task.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar
element.short: Implements the base class for progress bar controls.

descr.p: TCustomProgressBar is a TWinControl descendant which implements a progress bar control.

A progress bar is used to indicate the progress for a lengthy operation. It contains an indicator bar that is updated with the completion percentage for the task. A progress bar can use either horizontal or vertical orientations. The visual appearance of the control can be configured using drawing styles, themes, and other property settings.
TCustomProgressBar is the ancestor for TProgressBar.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetMin
element.short: Gets the value for the Min property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetMin.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetMax
element.short: Gets the value for the Max property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetMax.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetPosition
element.short: Gets the value for the Position property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetPosition.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetParams
element.short: Sets the values for the Min and Max properties.

descr.p: SetParams is a convenience method used to set new values for both the Min and the Max properties.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetParams.AMin
element.short: New value for the Min property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetParams.AMax
element.short: New value for the Max property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetMin
element.short: Sets the value for the Min property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetMin.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetMax
element.short: Sets the value for the Max property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetMax.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetPosition
element.short: Sets the value for the Position property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetPosition.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetStep
element.short: Sets the value for the Step property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetStep.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetSmooth
element.short: Sets the value for the Smooth property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetSmooth.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetBarShowText
element.short: Sets the value for the BarShowText property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetBarShowText.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetOrientation
element.short: Sets the value for the Orientation property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetOrientation.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the Style property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.SetStyle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.ApplyChanges
element.short: ApplyChanges - apply any changes that have occurred.

descr.p: ApplyChanges is a method used to apply property values from the progress bar to the widgetset class.

Values in the Min, Max, and Position properties are normalized; i. e. Min <= Position <= Max. When the Handle has been allocated for the control, the values are applied to the widgetset class by calling its ApplyChanges method.
No actions are performed in the method when the component is being loaded using the LCL streaming mechanism.

ApplyChanges is called when the Handle is created (or re-created) in InitializeWnd, and from the Loaded method when component streaming has been completed. It is also called when values in properties are changed, including: Min, Max, Position, Step, Orientation, Smooth, and BarShowText.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.InitializeWnd
element.short: Applies property values to the widgetset class when the Handle is (re-)created.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Loaded
element.short: Applies property values to the widgetset class when component streaming is completed.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size for new instances of the class.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create sets component style flags needed for the control, and sets the default values for properties in the class instance.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.StepIt
element.short: Increments the Position for the progress bar by the value in Step.

descr.p: StepIt is a procedure used to move the progress bar indicator from its current Position using the increment specified in the Step property. The value is Step is added to the value in Position. Position is range limited to the values in Min or Max if needed.
If the Handle for the control has been allocated, the SetPosition method in the widgetset class is called to apply the change in the Position property.
Use StepBy to apply an arbitrary increment value to Position.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.StepBy
element.short: Applies an arbitrary increment value to the Position for the progress bar.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.StepBy.Delta
element.short: Increment applied to the value in Position.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Max
element.short: Specifies the maximum value for the Position in the progress bar.

descr.p: Max is an Integer property which specifies the maximum value allowed in the Position property. The default value for the property is 100.
Set values for the Min and Max properties as needed to represent the task or operation. Or, use the SetParams method to set both Min and Max values at the same time.
Changing the value for the property causes the ApplyChanges method to be called.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Min
element.short: Specifies the minimum value for the Position in the progress bar.

descr.p: Min is an Integer property which specifies the minimum value allowed in the Position property. The default value for the property is 0.
Set values for the Min and Max properties as needed to represent the task or operation. Or, use the SetParams method to set both Min and Max values at the same time.
Changing the value for the property causes the ApplyChanges method to be called.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Orientation
element.short: Specifies the orientation and direction for the progress bar.

descr.p: Orientation is a TProgressBarOrientation property which indicates the orientation and direction for the progress bar. The default value is pbHorizontal, and orients the progress bar horizontally. As the value in Position is increased, the progress bar is moved from left to right.
See TProgressBarOrientation for the available values and their meanings.
Changing the value for the property causes the ApplyChanges method to be called.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Position
element.short: The current position for the progress bar.

descr.p: Position is an Integer property which contains the current position for the progress bar. The values in Position, Min, and Max determine the completion percentage and the length for the progress bar indicator when Style is set to pbstNormal.

Position must be in the range specified by the Min and Max properties. Setting a new value for the property causes the ApplyChanges method to be called. It validates and range limits property values before they are applied to the widgetset class.
Use StepIt and Step to increment the value in Position by a fixed value.
Use StepBy to increment the value in Position by an arbitrary value.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Smooth
element.short: Indicates if the progress bar indicator is drawn as a smooth solid bar, as opposed to individual bar segments.

descr.p: The implementation of Smooth drawing is platform-dependent. Some widgetsets do not use the segmented drawing style for their progress bars. For those platforms, the value in the property is not used.
Use Style to control whether a normal progress bar is drawn, or if an animated marquee is used in the progress bar indicator.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Step
element.short: Increment applied to the value in Position in the StepIt method.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.Style
element.short: Drawing style for the progress bar.

descr.p: The default value for the property is pbstNormal, and causes a solid (or segmented bar) to be displayed. pbstMarquee causes the animated marquee-style progress bar to be displayed.

element.name: TCustomProgressBar.BarShowText
element.short: Indicates if status text is draw over the progress bar.

descr.p: BarShowText some widgetsets allow text to be displayed on the bar to indicate its position and range of values. The implementation of BarShowText is platform-specific. If the widgetset does not display text on the progress bar, the value in the property is not used.

element.name: TProgressBar
element.short: TProgress Bar - a bar that depicts what proportion of a process has been completed.

descr.p: TProgress Bar is a TCustomProgressBar descendant that implements a control which depicts the progress of a process, or the proportion of the process that has been completed. A series of colored rectangles appears in the control filling it from left to right or from top to bottom to represent the progress for the process.

element.name: TUDAlignButton
element.short: TUDAlignButton - enumerated type contains constants for alignment of an UpDown button.

element.name: TUDOrientation
element.short: TUDOrientation - enumerated type with constants for orientation of UpDown button (Horizontal or Vertical).

element.name: TUpDownDirection
element.short: Indicates whether a value is being increased, decreased, or not changed.

descr.p: TUpDownDirection is an enumerated type with values that indicates whether a value is being increased, decreased, or not changed in a TCustomUpDown control. TUpDownDirection is the type passed as an argument to TUDChangingEventEx event handlers.

element.name: TUpDownDirection.updNone
element.short: The value is not changed in the control.

element.name: TUpDownDirection.updUp
element.short: The value is increased in the control.

element.name: TUpDownDirection.updDown
element.short: The value is decreased in the control.

element.name: TUDBtnType
element.short: Represents the buttons used in a TCustomUpDown control.

descr.p: TUDBtnType is an enumerated type with values that represent the buttons used in a TCustomUpDown control.

element.name: TUDBtnType.btNext
element.short: Represents the Next (Up, Increase Value) button.

element.name: TUDBtnType.btPrev
element.short: Represents the Previous (Down, Decrease Value) button.

element.name: TUDClickEvent
element.short: TUDClickEvent - generic event handling procedure for clicking on an UpDown button.

element.name: TUDChangingEvent
element.short: TUDChangingEvent - generic event handling procedure for changes in UpDown button.

element.name: TCustomUpDown
element.short: TCustomUpDown - base class for TUpDown - a pair of arrow-like buttons which are used to increment or decrement some controlled variable; often attached to a scroll-bar but can also control a digital numeric display.

descr.p: TCustomUpDown - base class for TUpDown - a pair of arrow-like buttons which are used to increment or decrement some controlled variable; often attached to a scroll-bar but can also control a digital numeric display.

The control definition itself does not specify the variable upon which the buttons operate. The application programmer is responsible for supplying an event handler for OnClick to determine which button has been selected (designated btNext or btPrev) and incrementing or decrementing the variable in the control with which the UpDown is associated.
The amount by which the variable is changed is set by the integer property Increment with the optional multiplier Thousands (a boolean property).
