For example the UpDown control may be used to move a slider up and down a scale by a specified amount for each click; alternatively a number may be displayed in a text box and clicking the buttons of the UpDown control may increment or decrement the number displayed by a specified amount.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.FUseWS
element.short: Indicates if the control depends on access to its WidgetSet class.

descr.p: FUseWS is a private Boolean member used to indicate if the control depends on access to its WidgetSet class instance. The value in FUseWS is set in the constructor for the class instance.
FUseWS is used in the constructor to ensure that buttons are created for Prev and Next values when they are not part of the widgetset class implementation.

FUseWS is used in the InitializeWnd method to determine if the property values must be set in the widgetset class, including: MinPosition, MaxPosition, Position, Increment, Wrap, Orientation, and UseArrowKeys.
FUseWS is used in the UpdateOrientation method to determine whether the action is implemented in the widgetset class, or handled in TCustomUpDown.

FUseWS is used in the AdjustPos method to determine whether a change in the control value using its buttons is handled in the current class instance, or forwarded to the appropriate button click method in the widgetset class. Similarly, handling for mouse wheel events are determined using the FUseWS member.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.CheckMouseEntering
element.short: Indicates if the mouse pointer has entered the control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.CheckMouseEntering.Result
element.short: True when the mouse pointer in within the bounds for the control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.CheckMouseLeaving
element.short: Indicates if the mouse pointer has exited the control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.CheckMouseLeaving.Result
element.short: True when the mouse pointer is not in the client rectangle for the control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.AdjustPos
element.short: Applies changes to the control value using its increment and decrement buttons.

descr.p: AdjustPos is a method used to apply changes to the value for the control when the increment or decrement buttons are clicked. AdjustPos uses the value in the FUseWS member to determine if the change in value is handled in the widgetset class, or handled in TCustomUpDown.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.AdjustPos.incPos
element.short: True when the position value is being incremented. False when being decremented.

descr.p: InitializeWnd is an overridden method used to initialize the widgetset class for the control. InitializeWnd calls the inherited method. When the FUseWS member contains False, no additional actions are performed in the method. When it contains True, methods in its widgetset class are called to synchronize values in the Min, Max, Position, Increment, Wrap, Orientation, and UseArrowKeys properties.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.AssociateKeyDown
element.short: AssociateKeyDown - protected procedure for dealing with action to be taken if an associate key (Shift, Ctrl or Alt) is pressed while the control is active.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.OnAssociateChangeBounds
element.short: OnAssociateChangeBounds - event handler for a change in bounds of the associate control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize returns its own defaults, overriding inherited values.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.CanChange
element.short: CanChange - if True, control can be changed.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Notification
element.short: Notification calls inherited method; if the operation requires removal of the associate control, this is performed.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Click
element.short: Click - calls OnClick event handler if it is assigned.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.AlignButton
element.short: AlignButton - how to align the button: left or right.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.ArrowKeys
element.short: ArrowKeys - if True, the control can be operated by the keyboard's arrow keys which would simulate a click on the Next or Previous button.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Associate
element.short: Associate - the associated control whose properties (controlled variable) are to be changed by the UpDown control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Increment
element.short: The amount by which the controlled variable is to be increased or decreased on each click.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Max
element.short: Max - greatest value of controlled variable.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Min
element.short: Min - least value of controlled variable.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.MinRepeatInterval
element.descr: MinRepeatInterval is a Byte property. The default value for the property is 100.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.OnChanging
element.short: OnChanging - event handler for a change in the value of the controlled variable.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.OnClick
element.short: OnClick - special event handler for a click on up or down button.

descr.p: OnClick - special event handler for a click on up or down button.
The event handler must determine whether the [next] or [prev] button was clicked and therefore whether to increment or decrement the controlled variable and adjust the display.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Orientation
element.short: Whether horizontal or vertical.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Position
element.short: The Position of the UpDown control.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Thousands
element.short: If True, multiply all displayed values and the Increment by 1000.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Wrap
element.short: If True, displayed control or value starts again from minimum or maximum value if clicking a button would cause incrementing or decrementing beyond the extreme value.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomUpDown: calls inherited Create, initializes orientation, max and min, bounds, size and alignment.

element.name: TCustomUpDown.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomUpDown: removes connection with associate control and calls inherited Destroy.

element.name: TUpDown
element.short: TUpDown - a pair of arrow-like buttons which are used to increment or decrement some controlled variable; often attached to a scroll-bar but can also control a digital numeric display.

descr.p: TUpDown - a pair of arrow-like buttons which are used to increment or decrement some controlled variable; often attached to a scroll-bar but can also control a digital numeric display

The control definition itself does not specify the variable upon which the buttons operate. The application programmer is responsible for supplying an event handler for OnClick to determine which button has been selected (designated btNext or btPrev) and incrementing or decrementing the variable in the control with which the UpDown is associated.
The amount by which the variable is changed is set by the integer property Increment with the optional multiplier Thousands (a boolean property).

For example the UpDown control may be used to move a slider up and down a scale by a specified amount for each click; alternatively a number may be displayed in a text box and clicking the buttons of the UpDown control may increment or decrement the number displayed by a specified amount.

element.name: CN_DROPDOWNCLOSED
element.short: Control notification message constant.

element.name: TToolButtonStyle
element.short: TToolButtonStyle - enumerated type that determines the style of the tool buttons.

descr.p: These are the possible values of Style:

ul.li: tbsButton - The button appears and functions like a normal button.
tbsCheck - Clicking the button toggles the Down property. Once selected, the button remains selected until clicked again.
tbsDivider - The button appears as a vertical line on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).
tbsDropDown - The button displays a downwards-pointing arrow (suitable for accessing a drop-down menu).
tbsSeparator - The button appears as an empty space on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsButton
element.descr: The button appears and functions like a normal button.

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsCheck
element.descr: Clicking the button toggles the Down property. Once selected, the button remains selected until clicked again.

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsDropDown
element.descr: The button displays a downwards-pointing arrow (suitable for accessing a drop-down menu).

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsSeparator
element.descr: The button appears as an empty space on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).

element.name: TToolButtonStyle.tbsDivider
element.descr: The button appears as a vertical line on the toolbar (used to separate other controls).

element.name: TToolButtonFlag
element.short: Represents flag values that can be used in a TToolButton instance.

descr.p: Values from TToolButton are stored in the TToolButtonFlags set type.

element.name: TToolButtonFlag.tbfPressed
element.short: The tool button is in a pressed or down state.

element.name: TToolButtonFlag.tbfArrowPressed
element.short: The drop-down indicator is in a pressed or down state.

element.name: TToolButtonFlag.tbfMouseInArrow
element.short: The mouse cursor is hovered over the drop-down indicator.

element.name: TToolButtonFlag.tbfDropDownMenuShown
element.short: The the drop-down menu for the tool button is visible.

element.name: TToolButtonFlags
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TToolButtonFlag enumeration.

element.name: TToolButtonActionLink
element.short: TToolButtonActionLink - links a ToolButton on the ToolBar to an Action on an ActionList.

element.name: TToolButtonActionLink.AssignClient
element.short: AssignClient calls inherited method then sets client as ToolButton.

element.name: TToolButtonActionLink.SetChecked
element.short: SetChecked - stores the Checked status (True or False).

element.name: TToolButtonActionLink.SetImageIndex
element.short: SetImageIndex - stores the index value of the associated image.

element.name: TToolButtonActionLinkClass
element.short: TToolButtonActionLinkClass - class of TToolButtonActionLink.

element.name: TToolButton
element.short: TToolButton is a button control used in a TToolBar object.

descr.p: Use TToolButton to implement buttons on a toolbar. While other controls (including TButton and TSpeedButton) can be placed on toolbars, TToolButton utilizes special toolbar features to simplify the configuration of buttons and offers added display options such as edge borders and transparency.
To place tool buttons on a toolbar at design time, select the toolbar, right-click, and choose New Button.

element.name: TToolButton.cDefSeparatorWidth
element.short: Default width for tool buttons using the separator style.

element.name: TToolButton.cDefDividerWidth
element.short: Default width for tool buttons using the divider style.

element.name: TToolButton.cDefButtonDropDecArrowWidth
element.short: Default width the drop-down indicator in tools buttons.

element.name: TToolButton.FToolBar
element.short: Member variable with the tool bar where the button is used.

element.name: TToolButton.CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem
element.short: Copies properties from the specified menu item.

descr.p: CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem is a method used to copy property value from the menu item in Value into the current class instance. This ensures that the button has the same settings and behavior as the menu item assigned to the button.
No actions are performed in the method when Value has not been assigned (Nil). Calls BeginUpdate on entry, and EndUpdate when the method is completed.
The following properties are copied from the menu item in Value:
CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem is called from the Loaded method when LCL component streaming has been completed, and when a new value is assigned to the MenuItem property.

element.name: TToolButton.CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem.Value
element.short: Menu item with the properties copied in the method.

element.name: TToolButton.GetActionLinkClass
element.short: Gets the class type for the ActionLink in the tool button.

descr.p: GetActionLinkClass is overridden in TWToolButton to return the TToolButtonActionLink type in TToolButton.

element.name: TToolButton.GetActionLinkClass.Result
element.short: Class type for the ActionLink in the tool button.

element.name: TToolButton.ActionChange
element.short: Implements the handler signalled when the Action for the tool button is changed.

descr.p: ActionChange is an overridden method which implements an event handler signalled when the Action for the tool button is changed.
The Sender argument is the new TCustomAction instance assigned to the Action property for the tool button.
CheckDefaults indicates when values from the action are copied into the control. When set to True, the values in the Action are applied only when its property value has been assigned.

ActionChange calls the inherited method on entry to copy properties from Sender to the control. It provides support for translating the Checked property in the action to the Down property used in the tool button. It also changes the value in ImageIndex only when a valid image index has been assigned in the Action.

element.name: TToolButton.ActionChange.Sender
element.short: New action for the control, or Nil.

element.name: TToolButton.ActionChange.CheckDefaults
element.short: Indicates if the property in the action must be assigned (not empty).

element.name: TToolButton.AssignTo
element.short: Implements object persistence used to assign properties from the class instance to another persistent object.

descr.p: AssignTo is an overridden method used to implement object persistence for the TToolButton class type. It allows properties in the class instance to be stored to the persistent object in Dest when it is a TCustomAction instance.
AssignTo calls the inherited method on entry to transfer common TCustomAction values to Dest. Additional properties in the tool button, like Down and ImageIndex, are handled as well.

element.name: TToolButton.AssignTo.Dest
element.short: Persistent object where the property values are stored.

element.name: TToolButton.BeginUpdate
element.short: Starts an update process for the tool button.

descr.p: Increments the internal counter used to consolidate calls to methods which layout or draw the control, or signal event handlers.
Use EndUpdate to end an update process for the control. The consolidated process(es) are performed when the internal counter reaches 0 (zero).

element.name: TToolButton.EndUpdate
element.short: Ends an update process for the tool button.

descr.p: Decrements the internal update counter used to consolidate calls to methods which layout or draw the control, or signal event handlers. The consolidated process(es) are performed when the internal counter reaches 0 (zero).
Use BeginUpdate to start an update process for the control.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseMove
element.short: Detects whether the mouse is hovered over the drop-down indicator for the tool button.

descr.p: MouseMove is an overridden method in TToolButton used to handle mouse movement messages for the control. It provides support for detecting when the mouse pointer is hovered over the drop-down indicator for a tool bar button.
It calls the inherited method on entry to handle drag messages, and to signal the OnMouseMove event handler (when assigned).

If MouseCapture is not enabled for the control, and the button uses tbsDropDown in its Style property, the PointInArrow method is called is called to detect whether the mouse in inside the display area for the drop-down indicator. The value tbfMouseInArrow is include in or excluded from the flags for the tool button based on the return value from PointInArrow.
Invalidate is called to redraw the button if the flag values were modified.
MouseMove is called from the WMMouseMove message handler.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseMove.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, or Alt modifier for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseMove.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseMove.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseDown
element.short: Handles mouse click events for the tool button.

descr.p: MouseDown is an overridden method in TToolButton used to perform actions needed when a mouse down (or click) event is handled for the button control.

MouseDown updates flags for the button control to indicate whether a left mouse button event occurred over the Button or its drop-down indicator (when used). The inherited method is called to handle a control or a form focus change, and to signal the OnMouseDown event handler (when assigned).

If the mouse event is over the drop-down indicator, the DropDownMenu when its AutoPopUp property is enabled. This requires sending a LM_LBUTTONUP message to ensure that the feature works for all widgetsets.
If the mouse event is over the button, the Down property is set to True.
MouseDown is called from window message handlers for the control.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseDown.Button
element.short: Mouse button for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseDown.Shift
element.short: Shift, Alt, or Ctrl modifier for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseDown.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseDown.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseUp
element.short: Handles mouse up events for the tool button.

descr.p: MouseUp is an overridden method in TToolButton used to handle mouse up message events.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseUp.Button
element.short: Mouse button for the event.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseUp.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, or Alt modifier for the message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseUp.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseUp.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the mouse message.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseEnter
element.short: Handles a message sent when the mouse enters a control.

element.name: TToolButton.MouseLeave
element.short: Handles a message sent when the mouse lesaves a control.

element.name: TToolButton.Notification
element.short: Handles the notification sent when a component is added to or removed from the control.

element.name: TToolButton.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the notification message.

element.name: TToolButton.Notification.Operation
element.short: Operation performed for the component.

element.name: TToolButton.Paint
element.short: Draws the tool bar button to the Canvas for the control.

descr.p: Paint is an overridden method in TToolButton, and provides nested routines used to draw the the tool button using the style, caption, and image for the control. Paint requires ToolBar to be assigned before it can render the button control using the routines in the overridden method. When ToolBar is unassigned, only the inherited Paint method is called.
Paint calculates the area display area for the button, and calls GetButtonDrawDetail to get the Theme Element Details for the control.
When an OnPaintButton event handler has been assigned for the ToolBar, it is used to render the button using the theme details. No additional actions are performed in the method.

When OnPaintButton is unassigned, the default drawing routines are used to render the button on the Canvas for the control. This includes decorations like a drop-down indicator, an image using the required state, the Caption text, button relief, and dividers or separators. Methods in ThemeServices are called to render the control to the Handle for the Canvas.
Paint calls the inherited method prior to exit to signal the OnPaint event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TToolButton.TextChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the caption text for the tool button has been changed.

descr.p: TextChanged is an overridden method in TToolButton used to perform actions needed when the caption text for the tool button has been changed. No actions are performed in the method if the parent tool bar has not been assigned for the tool button.
When ShowCaptions is enabled, the Invalidate method is called to force the tool button to be redrawn.
TextChanged is called when the CM_TEXTCHANGED control message is handled for the control.

element.name: TToolButton.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: GetControlClassDefaultSize returns its own defaults, overriding inherited values.

element.name: TToolButton.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when LCL component streaming has been completed.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method on entry. Calls CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem to apply values from MenuItem to the properties in the class instance.

element.name: TToolButton.RefreshControl
element.short: Refreshes the button control by updating it parent tool bar.

element.name: TToolButton.SetToolBar
element.short: Sets the value for the internal member with the TToolBar instance for the button.

element.name: TToolButton.SetToolBar.NewToolBar
element.short: New value for the internal member.

element.name: TToolButton.UpdateControl
element.short: Causes the tool bar to adjust the size and position for its Buttons and Controls.

element.name: TToolButton.GetButtonDrawDetail
element.short: Gets the Theme Element Details used for the tool button.

descr.p: Uses values in Style, Enabled, and Down to determine the theme elements requested in the method. Calls ThemeElement.GetElementDetails to retrieve the theming details.
Called from the Paint method before the control is drawn.

element.name: TToolButton.SetParent
element.short: Sets the value for the Parent property.

descr.p: SetParent is an overridden method in TToolButton used to set the value for the Parent property.

SetParent ensures that the control in AParent is assigned, and allows child classes using the TToolButton class type. An EInvalidOperation exception is raised if the class instance cannot be a child control on AParent, or AParent is also the current class instance.

When the parent tool bar has been assigned, the tool button must be re-parented. The RemoveButton method in the tool bar is called to remove the button from its existing Parent. If AParent is a TToolBar instance, its properties are used to set the ButtonWidth and ButtonHeight for the control. The inherited method is called to update both the old and new Parent references and their control flags.

The value in the internal tool bar member is set to the value in AParent, and the AddButton method in the tool bar is called. The UpdateVisibleToolbar method is calls to align and re-display the button control (and its tool bar).

element.errors: Raises an EInvalidOperation exception if the class instance cannot be a child control on the new Parent, or the new AParent is also the current class instance.

element.name: TToolButton.SetParent.AParent
element.short: New value for the Parent property.

element.name: TToolButton.UpdateVisibleToolbar
element.short: Calls the corresponding method in the tool bar for the button.

descr.p: Calls a private method in the Parent control to update the tool bar buttons. No actions are performed if Parent is not a TToolBar instance, or unassigned.

element.name: TToolButton.GroupAllUpAllowed
element.short: Indicates if all buttons in the group are allowed to be in the 'Up' position.

descr.p: Adjacent check box-style buttons (and their separators / dividers) with their Grouped property set to True are considered to be in the same group. GroupAllUpAllowed examines the adjacent tool buttons on the Parent tool bar to determine whether any of the grouped buttons have the AllowAllUp property set to True. When one grouped check-box button has AllowAllUp set, the remaining buttons in the group are treated in the same manner.
descr.remark: Change the Grouped property to False on a separator or divider to force the preceeding or subsequent check-box buttons to be treated as a different group.

element.name: TToolButton.GroupAllUpAllowed.Result
element.short: True when the AllowAllUp property is set for any of the adjacent grouped check-box buttons on the tool bar.

element.name: TToolButton.DialogChar
element.short: Clicks the button when the message contains the accelerator key for the button control.

descr.p: Causes the tool button to be clicked when Message contains the accelerator key (shortcut) in the Caption for the button. ShowCaptions must be enabled in the Parent tool bar to allow the button to be clicked. If the message is not handled in the method, the inherited method is called.
The return value is True if the key message was handled as an accelerator key for the button control.

element.name: TToolButton.DialogChar.Result
element.short: True If the message was handled as an accelerator key for the tool bar button.

element.name: TToolButton.SetAutoSize
element.short: Sets the value the AutoSize property and adjusts the control size when needed.

descr.p: SetAutoSize is an overridden method in TToolButton used to set the value for the AutoSize property. It calls the inherited method to apply the new value for the property. It calls RequestAlign to adjust the size and alignment for the button control (and its siblings) on the Parent control.

element.name: TToolButton.SetAutoSize.Value
element.short: New value for the AutoSize property.

element.name: TToolButton.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TToolButton. It calls the inherited Create method, and sets the initial bounds for the control. Default values for style-related properties are also assigned.

element.name: TToolButton.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TToolButton.CheckMenuDropdown
element.short: Checks for and executes a drop-down menu for the tool button.

descr.p: CheckMenuDropdown is a Boolean function used to check whether a drop-down menu can be displayed and executed for the tool button. The menu can be represented using either the DropDownMenu property (with its AutoPopUp property set to True) or the MenuItem property.
No actions are performed in the method at design-time, when the parent tool bar has not been assigned, or when neither DropDownMenu nor MenuItem has been assigned.

When a menu is available, the flags for the tool button are updated to include the value tbfDropDownMenuShown. The CheckMenuDropdown method in the parent tool bar is called to display and execute the drop-down menu, and get the return value for the method. The return value is True if the menu was successfully display and executed by the parent tool bar. The button flags are reverted prior to exiting from the method.
CheckMenuDropdown is called from the MouseDown method when the left mouse button is clicked on a button (or its drop-down indicator).

element.name: TToolButton.CheckMenuDropdown.Result
element.short: True if the drop-down menu for the button was successfully displayed and executed.

element.name: TToolButton.ArrowClick
element.short: Signals the OnArrowClick event handler for the tool button.

descr.p: ArrowClick is a method used to execute the OnArrowClick event handler (when assigned) for the tool button. ArrowClick is called from the MouseDown method when the left mouse button has been clicked on the drop-down indicator and the DropDownMenu for the button is not already visible.
See Click for information about the actions performed when the button has been clicked, instead of its drop-down indicator.

element.name: TToolButton.GetCurrentIcon
element.short: Gets the image list, index, and drawing effect for the icon on the tool button.

descr.p: GetCurrentIcon is a method used to get information for the icon drawn on the tool button. It returns values in the variable parameters with the scaled image list for the icon, its position in the image list, and the drawing effect for the image.

ImageList is the scaled image list with the images from the parent tool bar. It is re-created in the method and uses the image size from the parent tool bar scaled to the run-time display density (PPI). The images in the list are retrieved from the Images, HotImages, or DisabledImages properties in the parent tool bar and reflect the values in the Enabled property and the tool button flags. The default value is Nil (unassigned).
TheIndex is the position in the image list for the icon image. It defaults to the value in the ImageIndex property.

TheEffect is a TGraphicsDrawEffect value that indicates the drawing effect to apply to the tool button. It reflects the values in the Enabled property, flags for the tool button, and the toUseGlyphEffects setting in ThemeServices. The following values are used in TheEffect:

dl.dd: Images are drawn using the normal, undecorated drawing effect. This is the default value.
Images are drawn using the shadowed effect when the button or drop-down indicator is pressed.
Images are drawn using highlighting when the button is Enabled and auto-effects are used in theme services. Otherwise, the tool bar HotImages or DisabledImages are used.
Images are drawn using the dimmed effect when the button is not Enabled, or tool bar DisabledImages are not available.

descr.p: GetCurrentIcon is called from the Paint method.

element.name: TToolButton.GetCurrentIcon.ImageList
element.short: Scaled Image list with the available images for the icon.

element.name: TToolButton.GetCurrentIcon.TheIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in the image list for the icon image.

element.name: TToolButton.GetCurrentIcon.TheEffect
element.short: Graphic drawing effect needed for the button state.

element.name: TToolButton.GetPreferredSize
element.short: Returns default/preferred height and width, for use in auto-sizing.

descr.p: Called during AutoSize calculations. Only positive values are valid. Negative or 0 are treated as undefined, and the LCL uses other sizes instead.
When WithThemeSpace is True, additional space is reserved for stacking.

Calls the inherited method on entry. Values from the ButtonWidth and ButtonHeight properties in the parent tool bar may be used in the PreferredWidth and PreferredHeight arguments, depending on the orientation for the tool bar. No additional actions are performed in the method if the parent tool bar has not been assigned.

element.name: TToolButton.Index
element.short: Index - is the sequence number for the button in ButtonList.

descr.p: Index is a read-only Integer property with the sequence number for the current button in the list of buttons. When the internal toolbar button list has been assigned, its IndexOf method is called to get the position for the current class instance in the toolbar control. When the internal toolbar is unassigned (contains Nil), the value -1 is used as the return value.

element.name: TToolButton.PointInArrow
element.short: Indicates if the specified position is within the bounds for the arrow drawn on a drop-down button.

element.name: TToolButton.PointInArrow.Result
element.short: True when the coordinates are within the arrow for the drop-down.

element.name: TToolButton.PointInArrow.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate examined in the method.

element.name: TToolButton.PointInArrow.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate examined in the method.

element.name: TToolButton.AllowAllUp
element.short: Indicates if all buttons in a group can have their Down property set to False.

descr.p: AllowAllUp, when True, indicates that all buttons in a group are allowed to be 'Up' at the same time. The default value for the property is False, and indicates that one of the grouped buttons must have its Down property set to True.

element.name: TToolButton.AutoSize
element.short: Allows the control to grow to the size for its content.

descr.p: Allows automatic adjustment of the size for the control, according to its content. The action performed depends on the control type. For example, a label or button can become bigger or smaller to accommodate a longer or shorter caption.
Default value for the property is False, and disables auto-sizing for the control instance.
The write access specifier is overridden in TToolButton to resize and align the tool button and its parent tool bar when needed.

element.name: TToolButton.Down
element.short: Is this button Down (i.e. has it been selected)? Default false.

descr.p: Down is a Boolean property which indicates if the tool button is in a "pressed" or "down" state. The default value for the property is False.

When the value for the property is changed to True in a check-box button (Style = tbsCheck), other buttons on the parent tool bar are also updated. Adjacent buttons with their Grouped property set to True are checked to ensure that their Down property is set to False. The button(s) are redrawn if their Down property was changed. The ToolButtonDown method in the parent tool bar is called to set the button state in the tool bar to the new property value. The button and the tool bar are redrawn following the change.

element.name: TToolButton.DropdownMenu
element.short: The drop-down menu that appears when the button is pressed.

descr.p: A DropDownMenu that appears when this button is selected.
It uses the same code as a TPopupMenu and offers a series of additional menu choices.

element.name: TToolButton.Enabled
element.short: Determines whether the button can respond to click events, and how it is displayed.

descr.p: Enabled is a Boolean property which determines whether the tool button can respond to mouse click events at run-time. Enabled, along with Down, Style, and values in the tool bar flags influence how the button is rendered in the Paint method.
The value for the property may be changed in the CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem method, or when the CM_ENABLEDCHANGED control message is handled for the button.

element.name: TToolButton.Grouped
element.short: Indicates if the tool button is a member of a group. The default value is False.

descr.p: Is this button a member of a group?

This would mean behavior similar to the radio buttons in a TRadioGroup where only one button in the group can be selected, or the check boxes in a TCheckGroup where more than one item can be selected but the members of the group interact in some way.

element.name: TToolButton.Height
element.short: Contains the height for the control in pixels.

descr.p: Height is an Integer property with the vertical size in pixels for the tool button. Height is normally set to the value in the ButtonHeight property for the parent tool bar.

element.name: TToolButton.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in an image list for the icon displayed on the tool button.

descr.p: ImageIndex is a TImageIndex property with the ordinal position in an image list for the icon displayed on the tool button. It refers to a position in Images, HotImages, or DisabledImages in the parent tool bar. The default value for the property is -1, and indicates that an image has not been specified for the tool button. Changing the value for the property causes the tool button to be redrawn.
The property value may be changed in the CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem method when a MenuItem is assigned to the tool button.
ImageIndex is used in the Paint method to select the icon drawn on the tool button.

element.name: TToolButton.Indeterminate
element.short: Indicates if the tool button is in an undetermined state.

descr.p: Indeterminate is a Boolean property which indicates if the tool button is in an undetermined state and may not be applicable to the current context. Indeterminate means that the button is neither selected nor unselected, and normally causes it to be displayed with a "grayed" or "dimmed" appearance.
The default value for the property is False. When the property value is changed to True, the Down property is automatically set to False and the tool button is redrawn.

element.name: TToolButton.Marked
element.short: Indicates if the tool button is marked.

descr.p: Marked is a Boolean property which indicates if the tool button is marked. The default value for the property is False.
Marked is provided for Delphi code compatibility; it is not used in the implementation of TToolButton or TToolBar.

element.name: TToolButton.MenuItem
element.short: Contains a menu item associated with the tool button.

descr.p: MenuItem is a TMenuItem property which contains a menu item associated with the tool button.

Normally, a button on an application tool bar is associated with a menu item in the application. When a TMenuItem instance is assigned to the property, its property values are copied into the TToolButton instance using the CopyPropertiesFromMenuItem method. If MenuItem is set to Nil, a free notification is performed for the tool button instance.
When MenuItem has sub-menu Items, they are displayed as a drop-down when the tool button uses a drop-down Style.
Use DropDownMenu to specify a TPopupMenu instance that is displayed when the button (or drop-down indicator) for the tool button is clicked.

element.name: TToolButton.OnArrowClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when the drop-down indicator for a tool button is clicked.

descr.p: OnArrowClick is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the drop-down indicator is clicked on a tool button using a drop-down Style.

OnArrowClick is signalled from the ArrowClick method (when assigned), and occurs when the left mouse button was clicked on the drop-down indicator. It is not executed if the DropDownMenu has already been displayed.
Use OnClick (or OnExecute in the Action) for the event handler signalled when the tool button was clicked.

element.name: TToolButton.OnClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when the tool button has been clicked.

descr.p: OnClick is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the left mouse button is clicked on the tool button.

element.name: TToolButton.ShowCaption
element.short: Indicates if the Caption text is displayed on the tool button.

descr.p: The ShowCaptions property in the parent tool bar takes precedence. Setting ShowCaption to False is relevant only when the List property in the tool bar is set to True.

element.name: TToolButton.Style
element.short: Determines the display style of the tool button.

descr.p: See TToolButtonStyle for the possible Style values.

element.name: TToolButton.Wrap
element.short: Indicates whether the tool button is forced onto the next row on the parent tool bar.

element.name: TToolBarFlag
element.short: Contains values used as status flags in the TToolBar control.

element.name: TToolBarFlag.tbfUpdateVisibleBarNeeded
element.short: Indicates the tool bar control needs to be redrawn.

element.name: TToolBarFlag.tbfPlacingControls
element.short: Indicates a button or other control has been moved on a tool bar control.

element.name: TToolBarFlags
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TToolBarFlag enumeration.

element.name: TToolBar
element.short: Implements an application tool bar with buttons or other visual controls.

descr.p: TToolBar is TToolWindow descendant which implements a control used to arrange and display buttons and other controls. The buttons are used to provide direct access to features or functions in the application, much like a menu.
A tool bar is normally aligned to an edge for the parent control so that it spans its width or height. The default alignment places the tool bar along the top edge of the parent control.

In basic usage, TToolBar allows TToolButton instances with the same height and width to be added to the control. The buttons can be displayed as check boxes, drop downs (combo-boxes), or drop down buttons as well. The tool bar can be configured to display images and/or captions, as well as dividers (thin) or separators (dividers with extra spacing) between buttons.
Other visual controls can be created using the tool bar as the parent control. These controls are resized to the width or height (depending on alignment) for the tool bar.

The tool bar can be configured to wrap buttons or child controls when the controls will not fit within the dimension for the tool bar alignment. Other visual aspects can be controlled, like use of edges around the tool bar or a flat appearance.
Use the Buttons property to access and maintain the tool buttons on the control. Use Controls to access other visual control types on the tool bar.

Use the OnPaint event handler to perform custom drawing on the tool bar control when the Paint method is called. Use the OnPaintButton event handler to perform custom drawing for individual tool buttons on the control.
TToolBar is the ancestor for the TExtendedTabToolBar in the LazControls package.

element.name: TToolBar.ApplyFontForButtons
element.short: Assigns the Font for the control to each of its Buttons.

descr.p: Called from the FontChanged method.

element.name: TToolBar.cDefButtonWidth
element.short: Default width for tool buttons on the control.

element.name: TToolBar.cDefButtonHeight
element.short: Default height for tool buttons on the control.

element.name: TToolBar.FPrevVertical
element.short: Member which indicates if the previous tool bar orientation was vertical.

element.name: TToolBar.IsVertical
element.short: Indicates if the tool bar is oriented to display buttons and controls vertically.

descr.p: IsVertical is a Boolean function in TToolBar used to determine if the tool bar displays its buttons or controls using a vertical orientation. The return value is determined by the value in the Align property, as follows:

dl.dd: The return value is True.
The return value is True when Height is larger than Width.

descr.p: If the tool bar is parented by a TCoolBar control, the value in its Vertical property is used as the return value.

element.name: TToolBar.IsVertical.Result
element.short: True when the buttons on the control are displayed vertically.

element.name: TToolBar.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers the tool bar class in the widgetset.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method on entry. Calls RegisterToolBar in the widgetset class to ensure that the TToolBar component is registered with the factory methods (when needed).

element.name: TToolBar.AdjustClientRect
element.short: Adjusts the client rectangle when the tool bar is drawn.

descr.p: AdjustClientRect is an overridden method in TToolBar used to adjust the display area in ARect for the tool bar when the control is drawn.

It calls the inherited method on entry to shrink ARect when values have been specified in the EdgeBorders, EdgeInner, and EdgeOuter properties. It also increases the left coordinate for the rectangle by the value specified in the Indent property.
AdjustClientRect is called from the AlignControls and WrapButtons methods.

element.name: TToolBar.AdjustClientRect.ARect
element.short: Rectangle with the client display area.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonHeightIsStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the ButtonHeight property.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonHeightIsStored.Result
element.short: True when ButtonHeight is 0 or larger.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonWidthIsStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the ButtonWidth property.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonWidthIsStored.Result
element.short: True when ButtonWidth is 0 or larger.

element.name: TToolBar.DropDownWidthIsStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the DropDownWidth property.

element.name: TToolBar.DropDownWidthIsStored.Result
element.short: True when DropDownWidth is 0 or larger.

element.name: TToolBar.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size for new instances of the class type.

descr.p: Uses a default size of 150 pixels (Width) by 26 pixels (Height).

element.name: TToolBar.DoAutoSize
element.short: Defers auto-sizing actions to the AlignControls method.

element.name: TToolBar.CheckMenuDropdown
element.short: Determines whether the specified button has a drop-down menu item which must be checked.

descr.p: Called from the TToolButton.CheckMenuDropdown method when the tool button is clicked.

element.name: TToolBar.CheckMenuDropdown.Result
element.short: True if the menu item for the button was checked (clicked) in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.CheckMenuDropdown.Button
element.short: Tool button examined in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.ClickButton
element.short: Calls the Click method for the specified tool button.

element.name: TToolBar.ClickButton.Button
element.short: Tool bar button executed in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.CreateWnd
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Handle for the control is created.

descr.p: Disables auto-sizing on entry, and re-enables auto-sizing prior to exiting from the method.

Calls the inherited method to update creation parameters and flags, and to initialize the window handle for the control. Calls UpdateVisibleToolbar to size and align the buttons and controls on the tool bar.

element.name: TToolBar.AlignControls
element.short: Performs actions to align the tool bar buttons in the specified rectangle.

descr.p: AlignControls is an overridden method in TToolBar and re-implements the method from the ancestor class. It does not call the inherited method.

No actions are performed in the method when tbfPlacingControls has already been included in the flags for the tool bar. This indicates that AlignControls has already been called, but not yet completed.

DisableAlign is called to prevent automatic alignment while the method is active. WrapButtons is called to position the buttons and controls in RemainingClientRect using the setting in Wrapable and the value from IsVertical. EnableAlign is called to re-enable alignment when the buttons have been positioned.
tbfPlacingControls is removed from the tool bar flags prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TToolBar.AlignControls.AControl
element.short: Not used in the overridden method

element.name: TToolBar.AlignControls.RemainingClientRect
element.short: Rectangle with the bounds where the tool bar and its buttons are aligned.

element.name: TToolBar.FindButtonFromAccel
element.short: Gets the tool bar button with the specified accelerator key.

descr.p: FindButtonFromAccel is a TToolButton function used to find the tool button with the accelerator key (virtual key code) value specified in Accel. FindButtonFromAccel visits the Visible and Enabled Buttons to find the TToolButton instance using the specified accelerator key in its caption. The return value is Nil if a tool button is not found using the specified accelerator key.

element.name: TToolBar.FindButtonFromAccel.Result
element.short: Tool button using the specified shortcut, or Nil when not found.

element.name: TToolBar.FindButtonFromAccel.Accel
element.short: Shortcut or accelerator key to locate in the tool bar buttons.

element.name: TToolBar.FontChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Font has changed for the control.

descr.p: FontChanged is an overridden procedure which performs action needed when the Font for the control has been changed. FontChanged calls the inherited FontChanged method, and applies the new font to the Buttons in the tool bar. Values are reset in internal members used to track the realized height and width for buttons and drop downs in the tool bar.

element.name: TToolBar.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control has finished loading from the LCL streaming mechanism.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method on entry. Calls UpdateVisibleBar to adjust the size and layout for Buttons on the tool bar.

element.name: TToolBar.Notification
element.short: Handles notifications for components added or removed from the control.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method on entry. Ensures that the DisabledImages, HotImages, and Images properties are Nil'd if their image list is removed from the control.

element.name: TToolBar.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component of the notification message.

element.name: TToolBar.Notification.Operation
element.short: Action which triggered the notification.

element.name: TToolBar.Paint
element.short: Draws the tool bar on the Canvas for the control.

descr.p: Paint is an overridden procedure used to display the tool bar. At design-time, a Red rectangle is drawn as a frame for the control. Paint calls the inherited Paint method to draw the inner and outer borders defined for the control. Paint signals the OnPaint event handler (when assigned) to perform drawing operations required for the tool bar.

element.name: TToolBar.RepositionButton
element.short: Repositions the tool button at the specified position in Buttons.

descr.p: Forces the entire tool bar to be redrawn. Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TToolBar.RepositionButton.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in Buttons for the tool button moved in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.RepositionButtons
element.short: Repositions the tool buttons on the tool bar.

descr.p: Forces the entire tool bar to be redrawn. Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TToolBar.RepositionButtons.Index
element.short: Not used in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.WrapButtons
element.short: Adjusts tool button sizes and positions, and handles wrapping to new rows or columns.

descr.p: WrapButtons is a Boolean function used to resize and position buttons on the tool bar. WrapButtons positions buttons from left to right in the client display area, and repositions any child control with its Align property set to clNone.
When Simulate is True, the child control sizes and positions are calculated but not applied to the tool bar.

Set Wrapable to text to allow a new row or column to be created when the cumulative button width is larger than the width for the tool bar. Or set the Wrap property in a specific tool button to True to force it and subsequent controls onto a new row or column.

element.name: TToolBar.CNDropDownClosed
element.short: Handles the CN_DROPDOWNCLOSED control notification message.

descr.p: Calls CloseCurrentMenu to hide an active drop-down menu displayed for the control.

element.name: TToolBar.CNDropDownClosed.Message
element.short: The CN_DROPDOWNCLOSED message and parameters handled in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create - constructor for TToolBar: calls inherited Create and sets many formatting and size defaults.
Among the variables initialized and defaults set are the list of buttons, button width and height, style, indentation, alignment, links for image change, the bounds and the edge borders.

element.name: TToolBar.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TToolBar.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TToolBar: frees buttons and links then calls inherited Destroy.

element.name: TToolBar.EndUpdate
element.short: Finishes an update process for the tool bar.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method on entry. Updates the size and layout for Buttons when the internal update counter is 0 (zero) and tbfUpdateVisibleBarNeeded has been included in the flags for the control.

element.name: TToolBar.FlipChildren
element.short: Disables reversing right and left alignment for child controls.

element.name: TToolBar.FlipChildren.AllLevels
element.short: Not used in the overridden method.

element.name: TToolBar.GetEnumerator
element.short: Gets a TToolBarEnumerator enumerator for the class instance.

descr.p: Creates a new TToolBarEnumerator instance using the current control as the owner.

element.name: TToolBar.GetEnumerator.Result
element.short: Tool bar enumerator created in the method.

element.name: TToolBar.SetButtonSize
element.short: Sets the width and height for Buttons on the control to the specified values.

descr.p: SetButtonSize is a convenience method used to assign values for the ButtonWidth and ButtonHeight properties in a single method call. It is called when a new value is assigned to the ButtonWidth or ButtonHeight properties.
For example:
is equivalent to:

The existing value in the property is kept when it is the same as the new value. No actions are performed in the method when neither value has been changed, or when BeginUpdate has already been called.

SetButtonSize visits each of the Buttons on the control to apply the changed values to the corresponding TToolButton properties. The button might not be updated if any of the following conditions are found.
For button width:

ul.li: The new value is too small for the width needed in a check box or drop-down style button.
The tool button has AutoSize enabled.
The control is not derived from TToolButton.

descr.p: For button height:

ul.li: In horizontal toolbars the height is set by the toolbar independent of the assigned size.

descr.p: SetButtonSize calls the SetBounds method in each tool bar button to apply the values in NewButtonWidth and NewButtonHeight.

element.name: TToolBar.SetButtonSize.NewButtonWidth
element.short: New value for the ButtonWidth property.

element.name: TToolBar.SetButtonSize.NewButtonHeight
element.short: New value for the ButtonHeight property.

element.name: TToolBar.CanFocus
element.short: Always returns False for TToolBar.

descr.p: The tool bar cannot be given focus, but its buttons or controls can.

element.name: TToolBar.CanFocus.Result
element.short: Always returns False for TToolBar.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonCount
element.short: Number of Buttons defined for the tool bar control.

descr.p: The property value is read from the Count property in ButtonList.

element.name: TToolBar.Buttons
element.short: Lists with the tool buttons on the tool bar.

descr.p: Buttons maintains a list of TToolButton instances. All tool buttons that share a TToolBar parent have the same height and (except for separators and dividers) the same width. Other controls on a toolbar are held in place by invisible separators, which are automatically created and destroyed.

To add tool buttons to the toolbar at design time, select the toolbar, right-click, and choose New Button. To create a space (separator) between one button and the next, select New Separator. To create a divider between buttons, add a button and set its Style property to tbsDivider. Other controls may be added to the toolbar directly from the Component palette.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonList
element.short: Contains the Buttons defined for the tool bar control.

descr.p: ButtonList is a read-only TList property which contains the TToolButton instances for the tool bar. It contains the values for the indexed Buttons property. It is also used in widgetset classes to access the buttons defined for the tool bar.

element.name: TToolBar.RowCount
element.short: Number of rows needed to display the buttons for the control.

descr.p: RowCount is a read-only Integer property with the number of rows needed to display the Buttons and Controls on the tool bar using its display settings. The value in RowCount is calculated in the WrapButtons method.
ButtonDropWidth is a read-only Integer property with the number of pixels needed for a drop-down button and its drop-down indicator.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonHeight
element.short: Contains the height for buttons on the tool bar control.

descr.p: Use 0 for auto-sized value.
An internal member with the real height for buttons is maintained when reading or writing the value for the property.

element.name: TToolBar.ButtonWidth
element.short: Contains the width for buttons on the tool bar control.

descr.p: Use 0 for auto-sized value
An internal member is maintained when reading or writing the value for the property.

element.name: TToolBar.DisabledImages
element.short: List with images displayed when a tool button is not enabled.

descr.p: DisabledImages is a TCustomImageList property with icon images displayed on tool buttons when they are not Enabled. Use Images for the images displayed when the tool button are enabled but not hovered. Use HotImages for the images displayed when tool buttons are hovered under the mouse cursor.

The image position for a tool button is stored in the ImageIndex property in the TToolButton instance.This requires the image at a given position in the image lists to target the same button on the tool bar control.

The image list should contain images which uses the sames width and height, and appropriately sized for the ButtonWidth and ButtonHeight for the tool bar. Use ImagesWidth to specify the size needed for tool button icons independent of the actual image size stored in the image lists.
When a new image list is assigned to the property, the tool bar is redrawn.
The image lists are used when the tool buttons get the current icon drawn in the Paint method.

element.name: TToolBar.DropDownWidth
element.short: Width of the drop down arrow button.

descr.p: Use 0 for auto-sized value.

element.name: TToolBar.EdgeBorders
element.short: Indicates which edges on the tool bar are drawn with a border.

descr.p: EdgeBorders is a TEdgeBorders property which indicates the edges to be drawn with a border on the control. It is redeclared in TToolBar to use the default value [ebTop].
Use EdgeInner and EdgeOuter to control the drawing style for the visible borders.
EdgeBorders is used in the inherited Paint method to render the control with borders in the specified positions using the drawing style in EdgeInner and EdgeOuter.

element.name: TToolBar.Flat
element.short: Indicates if the control is drawn with a flat appearance.

descr.p: Flat is a Boolean property which indicates if the control is drawn using a flat appearance (when True), or a raised drawing style (when False). The default value for the property is True.
Changing the value for the property causes the inherited Invalidate method to be called to refresh the control.

element.name: TToolBar.Height
element.short: Height for the tool bar control.

descr.p: Height is an Integer property re-declared in TToolBar to use a default value. The default value for the property is 32 (pixels).

element.name: TToolBar.HotImages
element.short: List with images displayed when a button is "hot" or hovered.

descr.p: HotImages is a TCustomImageList property with icon images displayed on tool buttons when the mouse is hovered over the controls. Use Images for the images displayed when the tool button are enabled but not hovered. Use DisabledImages for the images displayed when tool buttons are not enabled.

The image position for a tool button is stored in the ImageIndex property in the TToolButton instance.This requires the image at a given position in the image lists to target the same button on the tool bar control.

The image list should contain images which uses the sames width and height, and appropriately sized for the ButtonWidth and ButtonHeight for the tool bar. Use ImagesWidth to specify the size needed for tool button icons independent of the actual image size stored in the image lists.
When a new image list is assigned to the property, the tool bar is redrawn.
The image lists are used when the tool buttons get the current icon drawn in the Paint method.

element.name: TToolBar.Images
element.short: List with images displayed when a tool button is enabled.

descr.p: Images is a TCustomImageList property with icon images displayed on tool buttons when they are enabled. Use DisabledImages for the images displayed when the tool button are not enabled. Use HotImages for the images displayed when tool buttons are enabled and hovered under the mouse cursor.

The image position for a tool button is stored in the ImageIndex property in the TToolButton instance.This requires the image at a given position in the image lists to target the same button on the tool bar control.

The image list should contain images which uses the sames width and height, and appropriately sized for the ButtonWidth and ButtonHeight for the tool bar. Use ImagesWidth to specify the size needed for tool button icons independent of the actual image size stored in the image lists.
When a new image list is assigned to the property, the tool bar is redrawn.
The image lists are used when the tool buttons get the current icon drawn in the Paint method.

element.name: TToolBar.ImagesWidth
element.short: Width for the images displayed on the tool bar.

descr.p: ImagesWidth is an Integer property which indicates the width for images displayed on the tool bar. The default value for the property is zero (0).
Changing the value in the property causes the private UpdateVisibleBar method to be called to update control flags, and to resize both the control and its Buttons.

element.name: TToolBar.Indent
element.short: Number of pixels reserved as indentation spacing before buttons and controls on the tool bar.

descr.p: Indent is an Integer property with the number of pixels reserved as indentation spacing before buttons and controls on the tool bar. The default value for the property is 1.
When the value for the property is changed, the tool bar is redrawn.
Indent is used in the AdjustClientRect method to increment the left edge of the display area for tool buttons on the control.

element.name: TToolBar.List
element.short: Indicates whether buttons on the tool bar are displayed using a list style.

descr.p: List is a Boolean property which indicates if the buttons on the tool bar are displayed using a list style.

When List is set to True, the icon for a tool button is displayed on the left edge of the button immediately before the Caption text (when enabled). When set to False, the icon is centered in the button width and above the Caption text for the button.
The default value for the property is False. Changing the value for the property causes the tool bar to be resized and redrawn.
Set ShowCaptions to True to enable Caption text on the tool bar buttons.

element.name: TToolBar.ShowCaptions
element.short: Indicates whether captions are displayed on tool bar buttons.

descr.p: ShowCaptions is a Boolean property which indicates whether caption text is displayed on tool bar buttons. The default value for the property is False. Changing the value for the property causes the tool bar to be redrawn.

ShowCaptions is used in the Paint method for the tool buttons on the control. When set to True, the caption text for a button is centered aligned at the bottom edge of the button. The icon for a button is drawn center aligned at the top edge of the button.
Use the List property (along with ShowCaption in the tool buttons) to display captions and icons using a list-style format where the icon and caption are on a single line.

element.name: TToolBar.Transparent
element.short: Indicates whether the control is drawn with transparency.

descr.p: Transparent is a Boolean property which indicates whether the tool bar is drawn with transparency. The default value for the property is False.

When set to True, the content for the Parent control can be seen beneath the unused areas on tool bar. Changing the value for the property causes control flags to be updated to add or remove csOpaque as needed, and the tool bar to be redrawn.

element.name: TToolBar.Wrapable
element.short: Controls wrapping of tool buttons to the next row when they are too long for the orientation on the tool bar.

descr.p: Wrapable is a Boolean property which indicates if tool buttons can be wrapped to a new line when they are too long for the Align setting in the tool bar. The default value for the property is True. Changing the property value causes the child controls to be re-aligned, and the tool bar is redrawn.
Wrapable is used in the WrapButtons method.

element.name: TToolBar.OnPaintButton
element.short: Event handler signalled to draw a button on the tool bar.

descr.p: OnPaintButton is a TToolBarOnPaintButton property which contains the event handler signalled when one of the Buttons on the tool bar is drawn.

OnPaintButton is signalled (when assigned) from the Paint method in TToolButton, and is used instead of the default drawing routines for the tool button. The Sender argument contains the TToolButton instance for the event notification. It is assumed that the event handler handles all aspects of drawing the button on the tool bar using the theme element details passed as an argument.

element.name: TToolBar.OnPaint
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Paint method is called for the control.

descr.p: Signalled after the inherited Paint method has been performed. The Sender argument contains the TToolBar instance for the notification.

element.name: TGrabStyle
element.short: Represent drawing styles available for the grab bar in TCustomCoolBar.

descr.p: TGrabStyle is an enumerated type with values used to represent drawing styles used for the grab bar (or gripper) in TCustomCoolBar. TGrabStyle is the type used to implement the GrabStyle property in TCustomCoolBar.

element.name: TGrabStyle.gsSimple
element.short: Drawn as a simple raised block.

element.name: TGrabStyle.gsDouble
element.short: Drawn as two thin raised blocks.

element.name: TGrabStyle.gsHorLines
element.short: Drawn as equidistant horizontal lines.

element.name: TGrabStyle.gsVerLines
element.short: Drawn as equidistant vertical lines.

element.name: TGrabStyle.gsGripper
element.short: Drawn as parallel rows of raised dots.

element.name: TGrabStyle.gsButton
element.short: Drawn with a push button appearance.

element.name: TDragBand
element.descr: TDragBand is an enumerated type with values that indicates the action performed when a TCoolBar band control is dragged. TDragBand is used in the implementation of TCustomCoolBar / TCoolBar.

element.name: TDragBand.dbNone
element.short: No action. Do not allow dragging.

element.name: TDragBand.dbMove
element.short: Move or re-order the band.

element.name: TDragBand.dbResize
element.short: Resize the band.

element.name: TCoolBand
element.short: Implements a band displayed on the TCoolBar control.

descr.p: TCoolBand is a TCollectionItem descendant which implements a band displayed on the TCoolBar control.

A band contains a single Control that is displayed as a movable, sizable area on the TCoolBar control. It has a Grabber (sizing grip) that is used to move and resize the band. It can also have a bitmap image and text displayed at the start of the band prior its Control. The band be configured with a fixed size, and may occupy the entire width for the TCoolBar.
TCoolBand is the type used for the items in the TCoolBands collection.

element.name: TCoolBand.IsBitmapStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the Bitmap property.

element.name: TCoolBand.IsBitmapStored.Result

element.name: TCoolBand.IsColorStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the Color property.

element.name: TCoolBand.IsColorStored.Result
element.short: True when ParentColor is not set.

element.short: Default indentation used for the grabber (sizing grip).

element.short: Left coordinate for the Control in the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.FControlTop
element.short: Top coordinate for the Control in the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.FTextWidth
element.short: Width (pixels) for the value in the Text property.

element.name: TCoolBand.CalcControlLeft
element.short: Calculates the left coordinate for the Control in the band.

descr.p: Reserves space needed for elements in the TCoolBand instance, including:

ul.li: Indent spacing for the Grabber (Sizing Grip)
The space needed for the Text
The space needed for the Image (scaled to the current PPI)

descr.p: The return value contains the offset in the band where the Control is displayed.

element.short: Offset in the band where the Control is displayed.

element.name: TCoolBand.CalcPreferredHeight
element.short: Calculates the band height using the orientation and settings in the parent control.

element.name: TCoolBand.CalcPreferredWidth
element.short: Calculates the band width using the orientation and settings in the parent control.

element.name: TCoolBand.CalcTextWidth
element.short: Gets the number of pixels needed for Text using the Font in the parent control.

element.name: TCoolBand.GetDisplayName
element.short: Gets the display name for the collection item.

descr.p: Uses the value in Text (when assigned). Otherwise, the ClassName is used as the display name.

element.name: TCoolBand.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create sets the default values for properties in the collection item, including:
Create calls the inherited method using aCollection as the owner of the collection item. An exception is raised if ACollection is not a TCoolBands descendant.
The internal TCoolBar reference in the class instance is set to the reference used in aCollection.
Create allocates resource needed for the Bitmap property, and sets its OnChange event handler to the InvalidateCoolBar method.

element.name: TCoolBand.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the items in the class instance.

element.name: TCoolBand.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Frees resources allocated for the Bitmap property, and calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: TCoolBand.Assign.ASource
element.short: Persistent object with property values loaded in the method.

element.name: TCoolBand.AutosizeWidth
element.short: Gets the width needed for the band when its Control is auto-sized.

element.name: TCoolBand.InvalidateCoolBar
element.short: Causes the parent control to be redrawn when the collection item is changed.

descr.p: Calls the inherited Changed method to update the current collection item, and to notify the parent control of a change to the collection.

element.name: TCoolBand.Height
element.short: Height needed for the band and its visual elements.

descr.p: Height is a read-only Integer property with the height needed for the band and its visual elements including the Control. The value in Height is updated when the TCoolBar instance calls its CalculateAndAlign method, which occurs when the Update method for the collection is called.

element.name: TCoolBand.Left
element.short: Left coordinate for the band.

descr.p: Left is a read-only Integer property with the horizontal coordinate for the band. Its value is relative to corresponding coordinate in the TCoolBar control. The value is assigned when the CalculateAndAlign method in the TCoolBar control is called, which occurs when the Update method for the collection is called.

element.name: TCoolBand.Right
element.short: Right coordinate for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.Top
element.short: Top coordinate for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.Bitmap
element.short: Bitmap image displayed for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.BorderStyle
element.short: Border style drawn around the band.

descr.p: The default value for the property is bsNone, and indicates that borders are not drawn around the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.Break
element.short: Indicates whether the band starts a new row (or column) in the TCoolBar control.

element.name: TCoolBand.Color
element.short: Color for the band.

descr.p: The default value for the property is clDefault. Please note that the default value for ParentColor is True, and causes the color defined for the TCoolBar control to be used.

element.name: TCoolBand.Control
element.short: Control displayed on the band.

descr.p: Setting a new value for the property causes the Collection for the class to be updated. The existing control on the band is Nil'd and the new value is assigned. The Parent property in the control is set to the TCoolBar instance.

element.name: TCoolBand.FixedBackground
element.short: Indicates if a fixed background is drawn for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.FixedSize
element.short: Indicates whether the band is drawn with a fixed size.

element.name: TCoolBand.HorizontalOnly
element.short: Indicates if the band is limited to the horizontal orientation.

element.name: TCoolBand.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the image displayed for the band.

descr.p: Contains ordinal position in the TCoolBar.Images property with the image for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.MinHeight
element.short: Minimum height for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.MinWidth
element.short: Minimum width for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.ParentColor
element.short: Indicates if the Color in the Parent control (TCoolBar) is used for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.ParentBitmap
element.short: Indicates if the Bitmap in the TCoolBar control is used as the background for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.Text
element.short: Text displayed as an identifier for the band.

element.name: TCoolBand.Visible
element.short: Indicates if the band is visible.

element.name: TCoolBand.Width
element.short: Width for the band.

element.name: TCoolBands
element.short: Implements a collection for TCoolBand items.

descr.p: TCoolBands is a TCollection descendant used to store TCoolBand instances used the TCoolBar control. TCoolBands is the type used for the TCoolBar.Bands property.

element.name: TCoolBands.GetItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: TCoolBands.GetItem.Result
element.short: Value for the indexed property.

element.name: TCoolBands.GetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item in the property value.

element.name: TCoolBands.SetItem
element.short: Sets the value for the Items property.

element.name: TCoolBands.GetOwner
element.short: Gets the owner for the persistent object.

element.name: TCoolBands.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Persistent object which owns the collection.

element.name: TCoolBands.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TCoolBands.Create.ACoolBar
element.short: Control which owns the class instance.

element.name: TCoolBands.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to the TCoolBand instances in the collection.

descr.p: Items is a TCoolBand property which provides indexed access to the class instances in the collection. Values in the collection are accessed by their ordinal position.
Items is the default property for the collection.
Use Add to create a new TCoolBand instance in the collection.
Use Delete and Clear to remove one or all items in the collection.

element.name: TCoolBands.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item.

element.name: TCoolBandMaximize
element.short: Not used in the current LCL implementation.

descr.p: BandMaximize is not used now but is needed for Delphi compatibility. It is not used in Delphi's TCoolBar implementation either.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar
element.short: Implements a Rebar-like control with resizable bands.

descr.p: TCustomCoolBar is a TToolWindow descendant which implements a control like the Windows Rebar control. It provides a collection of windowed controls which are displayed in movable, resizable bands.

Each band (or TCoolBand) on the control can have a configurable sizing grip (or grabber), a bitmap, a text label, and a single windowed control. The CoolBar handles the size and position for the control when its band is moved. Each band can have a fixed size, or can automatically re-size to the contained control. Bands can be displayed one band per line, or re-sized and positioned to fill the available width or height for the CoolBar control.

A common use case is hosting multiple toolbars in an application. Separate TToolbar instance are created and configured with event handlers or actions as needed. Each toolbar is assigned as the control for a band. A perfect example is the Lazarus IDE, which uses TCoolbar to host the file, view and run toolbars in its interface.
Do not create instances of TCustomCoolBar; use the TCoolBar descendant which sets the visibility for the properties in the control.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.GetAlign
element.short: Gets the value for the Align property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.GetAlign.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.RowEndHelper
element.short: Determines if a band should wrap during alignment.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.SetBandBorderStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the BandBorderStyle property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.SetBandBorderStyle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.SetBands
element.short: Sets the value for the Bands property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.SetBands.aValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.SetBitmap
element.short: Sets the value for the Bitmap property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.SetBitmap.aValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.FDraggedBandIndex
element.short: -1 indicates the space below the last row; other negative values are an invalid area.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.FDragInitPos
element.short: Initial mouse X - position (for resizing Bands).

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Align is a TAlign property which is re-introduced in TCustomCoolBar to change its default value. The default value for the property is alTop.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.BandBorderStyle
element.descr: The default value for the property is bsSingle.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.BandMaximize
element.descr: The default value for the property is bmClick.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.GrabStyle
element.descr: GrabStyle is a TGrabStyle property. The default value for the property is cDefGrabStyle.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.GrabWidth
element.descr: GrabWidth is an Integer property. The default value for the property is cDefGrabWidth.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.HorizontalSpacing
element.short: Horizontal space reserved between visual elements in the control.

descr.p: HorizontalSpacing is an Integer property with the space reserved between visual elements in the control when the horizontal orientation is used. The default value for the property is defined in the cDefHorSpacing constant.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.ImagesWidth
element.short: Width for the Images used in the control.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.ShowText
element.short: Indicates that text captions are displayed on the bands in the control.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.Themed
element.short: Enables themed rendering for the control.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.Vertical
element.short: Indicates if control is displayed vertically instead of horizontally.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.VerticalSpacing
element.short: Vertical space reserved between visual elements in the control.

element.name: TCustomCoolBar.OnChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when Bands are re-sized or re-ordered using the mouse.

element.name: TCoolBar
element.descr: TCoolBar is a TCustomCoolBar descendant.

element.name: TTrackBarOrientation

element.name: TTickStyle.tsAuto
element.short: The tick mark count is determined using the Min, Max, and Frequency for a track bar control.

element.name: TTickStyle.tsManual
element.short: The number of tick marks is manually calculated. Used for the Mac OS Cocoa widgetset.

element.name: TTrackBarScalePos
element.short: TTrackBarScalePos - enumerated type denoting position of the scale for a track bar.
