element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for TCustomTrackBar, and calls the inherited method on entry.

Create sets the default values for properties and members in the class instance, including the component and control style flags. The initial bounds for the control are set to the values from the GetControlClassDefaultSize method.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.SetTick
element.short: Sets the position for the tick mark displayed on the track bar control.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Frequency

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Min
element.short: Minimum value or position for the track bar slider.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Position

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.Reversed
element.short: True if the values are displayed in ascending order from right-to-left.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.ScalePos
element.short: Position where the scale is displayed.
element.descr: This is a GTK-specific property.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.SelEnd

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.SelStart
element.short: Starting value for the selection range in the track bar control.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.ShowSelRange
element.short: Displays a selection range and indicators using the values in SelStart and SelEnd.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.TickMarks
element.short: Position for the tick marks relative to the slider in the track bar.

descr.p: Tickmarks indicates where the ticks appear relative to the slider in the track bar control.

dl.dd: Tick marks are displayed on the bottom for the horizontal orientation, and on the right for the vertical orientation.
Tick marks are displayed on the top for the horizontal orientation, and on the left for the vertical orientation.
Tick marks are displayed on both sides for the selected orientation.

element.name: TCustomTrackBar.TickStyle
element.short: Indicates the tick mark drawing style for the control.

dl.dd: Disables display of tick marks.
Tick mark count is automatically calculated using Min, Max, and Frequency.
Used for Mac OS Cocoa. For other widgetsets, it displays the Selection Range markers but no other tick marks.

element.name: TTrackBar
element.short: TTrackBar: a device which allows the user to determine the value of a variable using a quasi-analog slider.

descr.p: TTrackBar: a device which allows the user to determine the value of a variable using a quasi-analog slider.

The device looks like a slider-potentiometer control on a hi-fi amplifier and consists of a slider which can be moved along a bar using the mouse. Tick marks can be displayed along one or both edges, giving an indication of the proportion of the maximum value of the controlled variable that is being selected.
The Position property indicates the distance along the bar that the slider has been placed, either by the program or by mouse capture and movement.
In the example, movement of the slider is detected and shown in the associated TProgressBar.

element.name: TNodeState
element.short: Enumerated type denoting the state for a TreeNode.

descr.p: TNodeState is an enumerated type with values representing the state a tree node. The values reflect the settings in property values in a TTreeNode instance, or the use a node in a tree structure. Value(s) from the enumeration are stored in the TNodeStates type.

element.name: TNodeState.nsCut
element.short: Cut has been set in the the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsDropHilited
element.short: DropTarget has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsFocused
element.short: Focused has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsSelected
element.short: Selected has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsMultiSelected
element.short: MultiSelected has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsExpanded
element.short: Expanded has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsHasChildren
element.short: HasChildren has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsDeleting
element.short: Deleting has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsVisible
element.short: Visible has been set in the TTreeNode.

element.name: TNodeState.nsBound
element.short: The tree node is bound to a tree (has a Parent) or is a top-level node.

element.name: TNodeStates
element.short: Set type used to store TNodeState value(s).
element.descr: TNodeStates is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TNodeState enumeration. TNodeStates is the type used to implement the TTreeNode.States property.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode
element.short: Location where a new tree node is attached to its Parent, Child, or Sibling nodes.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode.naAdd
element.short: Add as the last sibling in a destination.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode.naAddFirst
element.short: Add as the first sibling in a destination.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode.naAddChild
element.short: Add as the last child in a destination.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode.naAddChildFirst
element.short: Add as the first child in a Destination.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode.naInsert
element.short: Insert as the prior sibling for the specified node.

element.name: TNodeAttachMode.naInsertBehind
element.short: Insert as the next sibling for the specified node.

element.name: TAddMode
element.short: TAddMode - enumerated type containing a series of constants to determine the place where a node should be placed in a tree.

descr.p: This set is used in TTreeNode.InternalMove and TTreeNodes.InternalAddObject.

element.name: TAddMode.taAddFirst
element.short: Adds the node as the first child.

element.name: TAddMode.taAdd
element.short: Adds the node as the last child.

element.name: TAddMode.taInsert
element.short: Adds the node in front another node.

element.name: TMultiSelectStyles
element.short: Represents available multi-select styles.

element.name: TMultiSelectStyles.msControlSelect
element.short: Enables multi-select using Ctrl+Click to select an additional item.

element.name: TMultiSelectStyles.msShiftSelect
element.short: Enables multi-select for a range of items from the current selection using Shift+Click.

element.name: TMultiSelectStyles.msVisibleOnly
element.short: Enables multi-select for visible (expanded) items only using Shift+Click.

element.name: TMultiSelectStyles.msSiblingOnly
element.short: Enables range multi-select for sibling items using Shift+Click.

element.name: TMultiSelectStyle
element.short: Set type used to store value(s) from TMultiSelectStyles.

descr.p: TMultiSelectStyle is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TMultiSelectStyles enumeration. TMultiSelectStyle is the type used to implement the TCustomTreeView.MultiSelectStyle property.

element.name: TTreeNodeArray
element.short: Pointer to a TTreeNode type which is the first instance in an allocated block of memory.

element.name: ETreeNodeError
element.short: Exception type raised for an error retrieving a tree node.

descr.p: ETreeNodeError is an Exception descendant with the base exception type raised for errors that occur when TTreeNode instances are retrieved. It is the ancestor for the ETreeViewError exception.

element.name: ETreeViewError
element.short: Exception type raised for errors in a tree view.

descr.p: ETreeViewError is a ETreeNodeError descendant and the exception raised for errors in a tree structure.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason
element.short: Represents reason codes passed to event handlers when a tree node has been changed.

descr.p: TTreeNodeChangeReason is an enumerated type with values that represent the reason code passed to event handlers when a tree node has been changed. TTreeNodeChangeReason is passed as an argument to the TTVNodeChangedEvent event handler.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncTextChanged
element.short: The Node Text has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncDataChanged
element.short: The Node Data has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncHeightChanged
element.short: The Node Height has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncImageEffect
element.short: The Node Image Effect has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncImageIndex
element.short: The Node Image Index has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncParentChanged
element.short: The Node Parent has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncVisibility
element.short: The Node Visibility has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncOverlayIndex
element.short: The Node Overlay Index has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncStateIndex
element.short: The Node State Index has changed.

element.name: TTreeNodeChangeReason.ncSelectedIndex
element.short: The Node Selected Index has changed.

element.name: LCLStreamID
element.short: A constant with the identifier for a LCL stream.

element.name: TTVChangingEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a tree node is about to be changed.

descr.p: TTVChangingEvent is an object procedure type which specifies an event handler signalled when a tree node is about to be changed. TTVChangingEvent is the type used to implement the TCustomTreeView.OnChanging property.

element.name: TTVChangingEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TTVChangedEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a tree node has been changed.

descr.p: TTVChangedEvent is an object procedure type which specifies an event handler signalled when a node has been changed in a TCustomTreeView / TTreeView control.
Sender is the TObject instance for the change notification event.
Node is the TTreeNode instance that has been modified.
TTVChangedEvent is the type used for the TCustomTreeView.OnChange property.

element.name: TTVChangedEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TTVChangedEvent.Node
element.short: Tree node for the event notification.

element.name: TTVNodeChangedEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when values in a tree node have been changed.

descr.p: TTVNodeChangedEvent is an object procedure type which specifies an event handler signalled when values in a tree node have been changed.
Sender contains the tree view control for the change notification.
Node is the TTreeNode instance with the modified value.
ChangeReason is a TTreeNodeChangeReason enumeration value that indicates the property changed in the tree node.
TTVNodeChangedEvent is the type used for the TCustomTreeView.OnNodeChanged property.

element.name: TTVNodeChangedEvent.Sender
element.short: Object (tree view control) for the event notification.

element.name: TTVNodeChangedEvent.Node
element.short: Tree node with the modified value.

element.name: TTVNodeChangedEvent.ChangeReason
element.short: Indicates the value that was changed in the tree node.

element.name: TTVEditingEvent
element.short: TTVEditingEvent - generic event handling method for editing a specified node if AllowEdit is True.

element.name: TTVEditedEvent
element.short: TTVEditedEvent - generic event handling method for a node that has been edited.

element.name: TTVExpandingEvent
element.short: TTVExpandingEvent - generic event handling method for expanding a tree node if AllowExpansion is True.

element.name: TTVCollapsingEvent
element.short: TTVCollapsingEvent - generic event handling method for collapsing a Tree Node if AllowCollapse is True.

element.name: TTVExpandedEvent
element.short: TTVExpandedEvent - generic event handling method for a Tree Node that has been expanded.

element.name: TTVCompareEvent
element.short: TTVCompareEvent - generic event handling method for comparing two Tree Nodes.

element.name: TTVCustomDrawEvent
element.short: TTVCustomDrawEvent - generic event handling method for Tree View custom drawing.

element.name: TTVCustomDrawItemEvent
element.short: TTVCustomDrawItemEvent - generic event handling method for Tree View Item custom drawing.

element.name: TTVAdvancedCustomDrawEvent
element.short: TTVAdvancedCustomDrawEvent - generic event handler method for Tree View advanced custom drawing.

element.name: TTVAdvancedCustomDrawItemEvent
element.short: TTVAdvancedCustomDrawItemEvent - generic event handler method for Tree View Item advanced custom drawing.

element.name: TTVCustomCreateNodeEvent
element.short: TTVCustomCreateNodeEvent - generic event handling method for Tree View node creation.

element.name: TTreeNodeCompare
element.short: TTreeNodeCompare - generic function to compare Tree Nodes: returns -1 if Node1 is less than Node2, zero if equal, +1 if Node1 is greater.

element.name: TOldTreeNodeInfo
element.short: TOldTreeNodeInfo - record type (old version) for Tree Node information.

element.name: TTreeNodeInfo
element.short: TTreeNodeInfo - record structure for (new) Tree Node information.

element.name: PDelphiNodeInfo
element.short: A pointer to TDelphiNodeInfo.

element.name: TDelphiNodeInfo
element.short: TDelphiNodeInfo - record structure for Tree Node information (for Delphi compatibility).

element.name: TTreeNode
element.short: Contains data for an item displayed in a TTreeView control.

descr.p: A TTreeNode is part of a TTreeView and is used to store the data displayed in the control. This can be done by using the Text property or for more complex data the Data property can be used. Each node can have sibling or child items associated with it.

element.name: TTreeNode.Changed
element.short: Performs a change notification for the node with the specified reason.

descr.p: Calls the NodeChanged method in the associated TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.Changed.ChangeReason
element.short: Indicates the property value that was changed in the tree node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetOwner
element.short: Gets the owner of the object instance.

descr.p: The return value contains the TTreeNodes container which owns the class instance.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Persistent object which owns the object instance.

element.name: TTreeNode.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TTreeNode, and calls the inherited Create on entry. Create sets the default values for properties and members in the class instance. The value in SubTreeCount is set to 1. The owner of the class instance is set to the TTreeNodes instance in AnOwner.

element.name: TTreeNode.Create.AnOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TTreeNode.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for TTreeNode.

It notifies the owner ( the TTreeNodes container) that the tree node and its accessibility object are being deleted. The Unbind method is called to remove any references to the node in the parent and sibling nodes, or as a selection in TreeNodes.
Child nodes are removed by setting HasChildren to False. Child nodes in Items are freed, and its storage is set to Nil.
The Pointer in the Data property is set to Nil.
Destroy calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TTreeNode.AlphaSort
element.short: Sorts the top-level child nodes in Items.

descr.p: Calls the CustomSort method to perform the default sort algorithm (alphabetic).
The return value is the result from the CustomSort method, and contains True on success.

element.name: TTreeNode.AlphaSort.Result
element.short: True on success.

element.name: TTreeNode.Bottom
element.short: Gets the vertical coordinate for the bottom of the tree node.

descr.p: Bottom is an Integer function used to get the vertical coordinate for the bottom of the tree node. The return value is calculated as the sum of the Top and Height properties.

element.name: TTreeNode.Bottom.Result
element.short: Bottom coordinate for the tree node.

element.name: TTreeNode.BottomExpanded
element.short: Gets the bottom coordinate for the last visible, expanded child node in the subtree.

descr.p: BottomExpanded is an Integer function used to get the bottom coordinate for the node subtree when it is expanded.

If the tree node has a visible sibling, the value in its Top property is used as the return value. When a sibling node does not exist, the bottom coordinate for the last visible and expanded child node is used. If the current node does not have child nodes, the value in the Bottom property is used as the return value.

element.name: TTreeNode.BottomExpanded.Result
element.short: Bottom coordinate for the last node in the subtree.

element.name: TTreeNode.CustomSort
element.short: CustomSort - Sorts the child nodes using SortProc.

descr.p: The child nodes (but not the grand-children) are sorted. If SortProc is Nil the method DefaultTreeViewSort is used. The default implementation always returns True.

element.name: TTreeNode.CustomSort.Result
element.short: Always returns True.

element.name: TTreeNode.CustomSort.SortProc
element.short: Sorting algorithm executed in the method, or Nil to use the default procedure.

element.name: TTreeNode.DefaultTreeViewSort
element.short: DefaultTreeViewSort - returns result of string comparison between names of Node1 and Node2

descr.p: DefaultTreeViewSort - returns result of string comparison between names of Node1 and Node2.
DefaultTreeViewSort compares the text of two TreeNodes and returns the following result:

dl.dd: if Node1.Text<Node2.Text.
if Node1.Text=Node2.Text.
if Node1.Text>Node2.Text.

descr.p: The comparison takes into account ANSI characters, i.e. it takes care of strange accented characters. Contrary to AnsiCompareText, the comparison is case sensitive.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayExpandSignLeft
element.short: DisplayExpandSignLeft - returns the position of the left edge of the expand / collapse indicator.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayExpandSignRect
element.short: DisplayExpandSignRect - returns the coordinates of the rectangle within which the expand sign are displayed.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayExpandSignRect.Result
element.short: Rectangle with the display area for the expand / collapse indicator.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayExpandSignRight
element.short: DisplayExpandSignRight - returns the position of the right edge of the expand sign (i.e. takes into account the width of the icon etc).

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayExpandSignRight.Result
element.short: Rectangle with the display area for the expand / collapse indicator.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayIconLeft
element.short: DisplayIconLeft - returns the position of the actual icon for the expand sign (usually 1 pixel greater than DisplayExpandSignLeft).

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayRect
element.short: DisplayRect - returns the coordinates of the rectangle containing the current entry; if TextOnly is True, returns the coordinates for the text.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayStateIconLeft
element.short: DisplayStateIconLeft - returns the position of the State Icon.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayTextLeft
element.short: DisplayTextLeft - returns the position of the left edge of the text.

element.name: TTreeNode.DisplayTextRight
element.short: DisplayTextRight - returns the position of the right edge of the text.

element.name: TTreeNode.EditText
element.short: Edits the text for the node in the associated TreeView control.

descr.p: EditText is a Boolean function used to start editing the Text for the tree node in the associated TreeView control. The return value is True when TreeView has been assigned and the value tvsIsEditing is present in the States property for the tree view control.
EditText calls the BeginEditing method in TreeView to configure, display, and activate the editor for the node.
Use EndEdit to close and optionally cancel the editing process in the associated TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.EditText.Result
element.short: True if editing was enabled for the tree node in the method.

element.name: TTreeNode.FindNode
element.short: Gets the child node in Items with the specified text.

descr.p: FindNode is a TTreeNode function used to get the child node with the text specified in NodeText.

FindNode examines the child nodes found in the Items property for the class instance. The GetFirstChild method is called to get the first child node in Items. Each tree node in Items is examined after calling GetNextSibling until a node with the requested value is located. The return value is the TTreeNode instance with a Text property that matches the value in NodeText, or Nil if a tree node is not found.
Use methods in the TTreeNodes container to locate tree nodes not in the current subtree; i. e. FindNodeWithText or FindNodeWithTextPath.

element.name: TTreeNode.FindNode.Result
element.short: The TTreeNode instance in Items with the specified value, or Nil if not found.

element.name: TTreeNode.FindNode.NodeText
element.short: Text for the node to retrieve from Items.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetFirstChild
element.short: Gets the first child node in the Items property.

descr.p: GetFirstChild is a TTreeNode function used to get the first child node in the subtree for the current tree node. GetFirstChild returns the first TTreeNode instance stored in the Items property (index position 0). The return value is Nil if Items is empty (Count is 0).
Use GetFirstVisibleChild to get the first child node with its Visible property set to True.
Use GetFirstSibling, GetNextSibling, GetPrevSibling, or GetLastSibling to retrieve a tree node at the same level in the tree hierarchy.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetFirstChild.Result
element.short: First tree node in the Items property, or Nil when Items is empty.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetFirstSibling
element.short: Gets the first tree node at the same level in the tree.

descr.p: GetFirstSibling is a TTreeNode function which returns the first tree node at the same Level in the tree node hierarchy. The return value may be the same as the current class instance when it is the first (or only) node at the current Level.

When a Parent node has been assigned, its GetFirstChild method is used to get the return value. Otherwise, the internal linked list for the sub-tree is used to get the previous tree node as the return value.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetFirstSibling.Result
element.short: First tree node at the same level.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetFirstVisibleChild
element.short: Gets the tree node that is the first visible child node in the subtree.

descr.p: GetFirstVisibleChild is a TTreeNode function used to get the tree node that is the first visible child node in the subtree.

GetFirstVisibleChild calls GetFirstChild to retrieve the first child node in Items. If the first child node is not visible, each of the TTreeNode instances in Items is examined after calling GetNextVisibleSibling.
The return value is the first TTreeNode instance with its Visible property set to True. The return value is Nil if no visible child node was found in Items.
Use GetLastVisibleChild to retrieve the last visible child node in Items.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the Handle property.

descr.p: GetHandle is a THandle function used to get the value for the Handle property. It is the Handle allocated for the associated TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetHandle.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetLastChild
element.short: Gets the last node that is a top-level child node in the subtree.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetLastChild.Result
element.short: TTreeNode instance that is the list node in Items.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetLastSibling
element.short: Gets the last node at the same level as the current node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetLastSubChild
element.short: GetLastSubChild - returns the last sub-child node of this parent.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetLastVisibleChild
element.short: Gets the last child node in Items with its Visible property set to True.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNext
element.short: Gets the next node in the tree.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextChild
element.short: GetNextChild - returns the next child node of the parent specified by AValue.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextExpanded
element.short: GetNextExpanded - returns the next expanded node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextMultiSelected
element.short: GetNextMultiSelected - returns the next node in a multi-selection.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextSibling
element.short: GetNextSibling - returns the next node in the same level as the current node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextVisible
element.short: Gets the next visible node.

descr.p: GetNextVisible is a TTreeNode function used to get the next visible node for the current tree node.

If the current tree node is Expanded and Visible, the next node is the first visible child node. Otherwise, the next visible sibling node is used as the next node. If a sibling node does not exist, the Parent is searched for a visible sibling (next visible ancestor?).
The return value is Nil if a visible node is not found using the preceding logic, or when none of the ancestor nodes are visible and expanded.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextVisible.Result
element.short: Next node in the tree node navigation order, or Nil.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetNextVisibleSibling
element.short: Gets the next visible node at the same level in the tree.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetParentNodeOfAbsoluteLevel
element.short: GetParentNodeOfAbsoluteLevel - returns the parent of all nodes at this absolute level.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrev
element.short: Gets the previous node in the tree.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevChild
element.short: Gets the previous child node starting at the specified child node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevChild.Result
element.short: Node which is the previous child node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevChild.AValue
element.short: Node which is the previous sibling for the specified child, or Nil.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevExpanded
element.short: GetPrevExpanded - returns the previous expanded node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevMultiSelected
element.short: GetPrevMultiSelected - returns the previous node in a multi-selection.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevSibling
element.short: GetPrevSibling - returns the previous node in the same level as the current node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevVisible
element.short: GetPrevVisible - returns the previous visible (not hidden) node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetPrevVisibleSibling
element.short: Gets the previous visible sibling tree node for the current node.

element.name: TTreeNode.GetTextPath
element.short: GetTextPath - returns a string containing the path to the current node delimited by slash.

element.name: TTreeNode.HasAsParent
element.short: HasAsParent - returns True if the node specified by AValue has a parent node.

element.name: TTreeNode.IndexOf
element.short: Get the index position for the specified child tree node.

descr.p: The return value is -1 if the tree node in AValue is not a child node (its Parent node is not the current class instance). Calls GetIndex to calculate the position of the child node relative to previous sibling nodes. Roughly equivalent to calling IndexOf in the Items container, but using a TTreeNode search value instead of a String.

element.name: TTreeNode.IndexOf.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the specified child node, or -1 when not a child node.

element.name: TTreeNode.IndexOf.AValue
element.short: Child node to locate in Items.

element.name: TTreeNode.IndexOfText
element.short: IndexOfText - returns the index of the node containing the specified Text string.

element.name: TTreeNode.Assign
element.short: Assign - if Source is of correct type, copies details directly, otherwise calls inherited Assign which probably raises an exception.

element.name: TTreeNode.Assign.Source
element.short: Persistent object with properties copied in the method.

element.name: TTreeNode.Collapse
element.short: Collapses the current tree node, and optionally collapses any descendent nodes.

element.name: TTreeNode.Collapse.Recurse
element.short: True to collapses all descendent nodes in the subtree.

element.name: TTreeNode.ConsistencyCheck
element.short: ConsistencyCheck - makes sure all references to and from the node are consistent.

element.name: TTreeNode.Delete
element.short: Frees the current tree node when the Deleting property is not True.

descr.p: Delete is a method used to remove the tree node from the TTreeNodes container. Delete calls Free to destroy the object instance if the Deleting property is not set to True. No actions are performed when Deleting is True.

element.name: TTreeNode.DeleteChildren
element.short: DeleteChildren - remove the descendent Nodes in the tree structure.

element.name: TTreeNode.EndEdit
element.short: Ends editing of the tree node in the associated tree view control.

element.name: TTreeNode.EndEdit.Cancel
element.short: True if the edited value for Text is discarded.

element.name: TTreeNode.Expand
element.short: Expands the current tree node, and optionally all descendent nodes.

descr.p: Calls the ExpandItem method to implement the expansion and optional recursion.

element.name: TTreeNode.Expand.Recurse
element.short: True to expand all descendent nodes.

element.name: TTreeNode.ExpandParents
element.short: Expands any tree node which is an ancestor of the current node.

element.name: TTreeNode.FreeAllNodeData
element.short: Frees the Pointer in Data, including any child nodes in Items.

element.name: TTreeNode.MakeVisible
element.short: Forces the node tree node to become visible.

descr.p: Calls the EnsureNodeIsVisible method in the associated TreeView (when assigned). Otherwise, calls the ExpandParents method.

element.name: TTreeNode.MoveTo
element.short: MoveTo - method for relocating a node to the specified Destination using the specified mode of attachment.

descr.p: MoveTo - method for relocating a node to the specified Destination using the specified mode of attachment.
Definition of the modes of attachment:

dl.dd: Add as last sibling of Destination
Add as first sibling of Destination
Add as last child of Destination
Add as first child of Destination
Insert in front of Destination
Insert behind Destination

element.name: TTreeNode.MultiSelectGroup
element.short: MultiSelectGroup - method for multi-selecting a group of nodes.

element.name: TTreeNode.Update
element.short: Redraws the associated TreeView control if an update is not already in progress.

element.name: TTreeNode.WriteDebugReport
element.short: WriteDebugReport - for debugging. If Recurse is True, report for all descendants as well.

element.name: TTreeNode.AbsoluteIndex
element.short: AbsoluteIndex - the absolute index of the current node, i.e. without taking into account the level of ancestry.

element.name: TTreeNode.Count
element.short: The number of nodes where the current node is the parent node.
element.descr: Contains the same value as the Count property in Items.

element.name: TTreeNode.Cut
element.short: Indicates if the tree node has been cut from the tree structure.

descr.p: Cut is a Boolean property which indicates if the tree node has been cut from the tree structure. The property value is True when nsCut has been included in the States property for the tree node. Changing the value for the property causes the States property to be updated to include or exclude the node state value.

element.name: TTreeNode.Data
element.short: Pointer to the custom data for the node.

descr.p: Data is a Pointer property with a pointer to the custom data for the node. Data can contain any arbitrary data type, and must be cast to the correct types when used in an application.

Setting a new value for the property causes the associated TreeView (when assigned) to sort the parent node or all of the TreeNodes when needed and allowed. It is needed when the tree view uses SortType stData or stBoth. It is allowed if the node is not being deleted and is bound to other tree nodes (States).
The Changed method is called with the ncDataChanged node change reason.

element.name: TTreeNode.Deleting
element.short: True if the node has been marked for deletion in the associated tree view control.

descr.p: Deleting is a read-only Boolean property which indicates is the node is marked for deletion. Its value is True when ndDeleting has been included in the States property for the node. nsDeleting is added to States in the Destroy method, and indicates that the node will be freed. The Delete method in the TreeView control is called to signal an OnDeletion event (when assigned) before references for the node are removed and the TreeNodes are refreshed. It prevents the Delete method from being executed more than once.

element.name: TTreeNode.DropTarget
element.short: True if the node is a drop target in a drag and drop operation.

descr.p: DropTarget is a Boolean property which indicates if the node is a drop target in a drag and drop operation. The value for the property is True when nsDropHilited has been included in the States property.

Setting a new value for the property causes States to be updated to reflect the new value. When set to True, nsDropHilited is included in State and the internal last drop target is updated in the associated TreeView control. When set to False, nsDropHilited is excluded from States and the last drop target is set to Nil in the TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.Expanded
element.short: True if the node has been expanded, False when collapsed.

descr.p: Expanded is a Boolean property which indicates if the node has been expanded in the associated TreeView control. The property value is True when nsExpanded has been included in the States property.
The Expand method is called when the new value for the property is True. Otherwise, the Collapse method is called. States is updated in the Expand and Collapse methods.

element.name: TTreeNode.Focused
element.short: True if the node has focus in the TreeView control.

descr.p: Focused is a Boolean property which indicates if the node has focus in the associated TreeView control. The value for the property is True when nsFocused has been included in the States property.

Setting a new value for the property causes the values in States to be updated. When set to True, nsFocused is included in States. When set to False, nsFocused is excluded from States. The Update method is called to force the TreeView control to be redrawn.

element.name: TTreeNode.Handle
element.short: Handle for the tree view control which owns the TreeNodes container and the tree node.

descr.p: THandle is a read-only THandle property with the handle assigned for the associated TreeView control. The property value is 0 (zero) if a handle has not been assigned for the TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.HasChildren
element.short: Indicates whether the tree node has child nodes.

descr.p: HasChildren is a Boolean property which indicates whether the tree node has child nodes.
The property value is True when States includes the value nsHasChildren. Items is not used to determine the property value.
Setting a new value for the property causes States to be updated to include or exclude nsHasChildren to reflect the new value. When the value is False, child nodes in the Items property are freed.
The Update method is called to refresh the associated TreeView control (when assigned).

element.name: TTreeNode.Height
element.short: The height for the node including its text, images, and indicators.

descr.p: Height is an Integer property with the height for the node including its text, images, and indicators.

Height uses a default value if it contains 0 (zero) or a negative integer value. If an associated TreeView control has been assigned, the value in its DefaultItemHeight property is used as the property value. If TreeView in unassigned, the value in the DefaultTreeNodeHeight constant is used.

Setting a new value for the property causes the States property in the associated TreeView control to be updated (when assigned). The values tvsScrollbarChanged and tvsTopsNeedsUpdate are included in the control States. The Update method is called to force the TreeView to be redrawn. The Changed method is called with the ncHeightChanged node change reason.
Height is used along with Top to calculate the return value for the Bottom method. It is also used in the implementation of methods like DisplayRect and DisplayExpandSignRect.

element.name: TTreeNode.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the image displayed for the node, or -1 when no image is assigned.

descr.p: ImageIndex is an Integer property with the ordinal position for the image displayed for the node. It refers to a bitmap stored in the Images property of the associated TreeView control. The default value for the property is -1, and indicates that an image has not been assigned.
Setting a new value for the property causes the Update method to be called to redraw the associated tree view control. The Changed method is called with the ncImageIndex node change reason.

element.name: TTreeNode.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the node in its parent node.
element.descr: Returns the number of previous siblings (nodes on same level in the parent node).

element.name: TTreeNode.IsFullHeightVisible
element.short: True if the entire node is visible in the display area for the associated TreeView control.

descr.p: IsFullHeightVisible is a read-only Boolean property which indicates if the entire tree node is visible in the display area for the associated TreeView control.

The IsNodeHeightFullVisible method in TreeView is called to get the value for the property. If the TreeView control has not been assigned, the AreParentsExpandedAndVisible method is used to get the return value.
IsFullHeightVisible is used in the SelectionVisible method in TCustomTreeView when MultiSelect has not been enabled for the tree view control.

element.name: TTreeNode.IsVisible
element.short: True if the node is visible.

descr.p: IsVisible is a read-only Boolean property which indicates if the tree node is visible in the associated TreeView control. IsVisible is True if the node can be seen in the display area for the control. The property value is False when an ancestor node is collapsed (not Expanded).
The IsNodeVisible method in TreeView is called to get the value for the property. If TreeView has not been assigned, the AreParentsExpandedAndVisible method is called to get the property value.
IsNodeVisible is used in the Repaint method in TTreeNodes, and in the SelectionVisible method in TCustomTreeView.

element.name: TTreeNode.Items
element.short: Provides indexed access to the child nodes for the current node.

descr.p: Items is an indexed TTreeNode property which provides access to the child nodes for the current node by their ordinal position. ItemIndex contains the ordinal position for the tree node instance, and must be in the range 0..Items.Count-1. An ETreeNodeError exception is raised if ItemIndex is not in the range needed for the Items property.
Items is the default property for the class instance.
Storing a new value to the indexed property causes the Assign method in the TTreeNode instance to be called to copy the properties values.

element.name: TTreeNode.Items.ItemIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for a child node.

element.name: TTreeNode.Level
element.short: The number of ancestor nodes for the current tree node.

descr.p: Level is a read-only Integer property which contains the level in the tree structure for the node. It indicates the number of ancestor nodes in the structure, and implies the indentation for the node in the tree view control.
The root of the tree is level 0. The value for the property is determined by counting the number of Parent nodes for each TTreeNode instance in the tree starting at the current node.

element.name: TTreeNode.MultiSelected
element.short: MultiSelected - if True, several nodes have been selected simultaneously (e.g. using the Shift or Ctrl key while selecting).

element.name: TTreeNode.NodeEffect
element.short: Graphic drawing effect applied to the node in the associated TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.OverlayIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the overlay image used for the node.
element.descr: This icon is drawn above the normal icon. If Images.HasOverlays then it is fetched from Images via Images.Overlay(Node.Overlay) for Delphi compatibility.

element.name: TTreeNode.Owner
element.short: Owner of the tree node instance.

descr.p: Owner is a read-only TTreeNodes property with the container that owns the current TTreeNode instance.

element.name: TTreeNode.Parent
element.short: Parent node for the current tree node.

descr.p: Parent is a read-only TTreeNode property which contains the parent node for the current tree node.
Use Items to access and maintain the child nodes for the current tree node.

element.name: TTreeNode.Selected
element.short: True if the current node is selected in the tree view control.

descr.p: Selected is a Boolean property which indicates the current node is selected in the associated TreeView control. The property value is True when nsSelected or nsMultiSelected has been included in the States property. nsSelected indicates that the node is assigned to the TCustomTreeView.Selected property. nsMultiSelected indicates that the node is stored in the the TCustomTreeView.Selections property when it has MultiSelect enabled.
Setting a new value for the property causes the values in States to be updated. Similarly, the TreeView control is updated to used the node in the Selected or Selections property.
The Update method is called to force the TreeView control to be redrawn.

element.name: TTreeNode.SelectedIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the image displayed when the tree node is Selected.

descr.p: SelectedIndex is an Integer property with the ordinal position for the image displayed when the node is Selected. It refers to a bitmap in the Images property for the TreeView control, and allows an alternate image to be displayed for the node when it is selected. The default value is -1 and indicates that an image index has not been assigned.
Changing the value in the property causes the Update method to be called to redraw the associated TreeView control. The Changed method is called with the ncSelectedIndex node change reason.
Use ImageIndex to set the ordinal position for the image displayed when the tree node is not selected.

element.name: TTreeNode.StateIndex
element.short: StateIndex the index of the state (within an enumerated type).

descr.p: StateIndex the index of the state (within an enumerated type).
Definition of enumerated type NodeState:
nsCut, nsDropHilited, nsFocused, nsSelected, nsMultiSelected, nsExpanded, nsHasChildren, nsDeleting, nsBound

element.name: TTreeNode.States
element.short: Contains active state flags for the tree node.

descr.p: States is a read-only TNodeStates properties which contains active state flags for the tree node. TNodeState enumeration values are included in or excluded from the set type as needed in methods for the tree node, the TreeNodes container, and the associated TreeView control.

element.name: TTreeNode.SubTreeCount
element.short: The number of subtrees in the ancestor nodes for the class instance.

element.name: TTreeNode.Text
element.short: Text displayed for the tree node.

descr.p: Text is a String property which contains the text displayed as the caption for the tree node.

Changing the value in the property causes the TreeView control to be updated. Its States property is modified to include the value tvsMaxRightNeedsUpdate, which causes the node sizes to be recalculated and the control to be re-displayed.
If the SortType for the TreeView is set to stText or stBoth, the Parent node is re-sorted. If the TreeView has not been assigned, the TreeNodes container is re-sorted.
The Changed method is called with the ncTextChanged node change reason.

element.name: TTreeNode.Top
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the top of the tree node.

descr.p: Top is a read-only Integer property with the vertical coordinate for the top of the tree node. Top contains an Y-axis offset where the tree node is located in the display area for the associated TreeView control.

The property value is calculated by calling the UpdateAllTops method in the TreeView control. The value contains the accumulated Height for all preceding TreeNodes starting at the first visible node in the control, and reflects their Visible and Expanded settings. The value is calculated in UpdateAllTops when tvsTopsNeedsUpdate has been included in the States property for the TreeView control.
Use Height to get height for the text, images, and indicators used in a tree node. Use Bottom to get the vertical coordinate for the bottom of the tree node.

element.name: TTreeNode.TreeNodes
element.short: The container where the tree node is stored, and the owner of the class instance.

descr.p: TreeNodes is a read-only TTreeNodes property with the container where the tree node is stored, and the owner of the TTreeNode instance. TreeNodes provides properties and methods needed to store, access, and maintain the tree nodes for the TreeView control. TreeNodes is a reference to the Items property found in TreeView.
The property value is Nil if Owner has not been assigned or is not derived from TTreeNodes.

element.name: TTreeNode.TreeView
element.short: The tree view control where the node is displayed.

descr.p: TreeView is a read-only TCustomTreeView property with the tree view control where the tree node and other nodes in TreeNodes are displayed. It is a reference to the Owner assigned to the TreeNodes property.

TreeView provides access to the properties, methods, and events in the control. It is used to get the position for the node in the display area for the control. It is also notified when property values in the node are changed.
Use TreeNodes to access the TTreeNode instances stored in TreeView.

element.name: TTreeNode.Visible
element.short: True if the tree node is visible in the associated TreeView control.

descr.p: Visible is a Boolean property which indicates if the tree node is visible in the associated TreeView control. Its value is True when nsVisible has been included in the States property for the tree node. The default value for the property is True.
Setting a new value for the property causes the States property to be udpated. Selected is set to False when the value in Visible is changed.

Values are included in the States property for the associated TreeView control (when assigned) to indicate that the size and layout for the tree nodes in the control have been changed. The Update method is called to force the control to be refreshed. The Changed method is called with the ncVisibility node change reason.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator
element.short: Implements an enumerator for items in the TTreeNodes container.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.GetCurrent
element.short: Gets the value for the Current property.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.GetCurrent.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Create stores the value in ANodes in the TTreeNodes member. Creates set the default value for the internal position counter used in the class instance.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.Create.ANodes
element.short: Container with the tree nodes visited in the enumerator.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Indicates if another tree node is available to the enumerator.

descr.p: MoveNext is a Boolean function which indicates if another tree node is available to the enumerator. MoveNext increments the internal position counter for the enumerator. The return value is True if the position counter is less than the number of entries in the internal TTreeNodes container (in the range 0..TTreeNodes.Count-1).
Use Current to access the TTreeNode instance when MoveNext returns True.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: True when more tree nodes are available in the internal container.

element.name: TTreeNodesEnumerator.Current
element.short: Gets the current tree node instance for the enumerator.

descr.p: Use MoveNext to navigate to the first or subsequent TTreeNode instance for the enumerator. Raises an exception if Current is accessed before the MoveNext method is called to retrieve the first value for the enumerator.

element.name: PNodeCache
element.short: PNodeCache - pointer to TNodeCache.

element.name: TNodeCache
element.short: TNodeCache - a cache (temporary storage record) for a TTreeNode and its index.

element.name: TTreeNodes
element.short: Implements a container for TTreeNode instances.

descr.p: TTreeNodes is a TPersistent descendant which implements a container used to store TTreeNode instances. TTreeNodes provides properties and methods used to create, store, access, and maintain nodes with a hierarchical tree structure.
The indexed Item property provides access to the nodes in the container by their ordinal position. An enumerator can also be used to access tree nodes in the container.
TTreeNodes is the type used for the Items property in TCustomTreeView.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetHandle
element.short: Gets the handle for the TreeView component using the collection of nodes.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetHandle.Result
element.short: The handle for the TreeView, or 0 when TreeView is unassigned.

element.name: TTreeNodes.InternalAddObject
element.short: InternalAddObject - method for adding text of data within the structure of the current node; returns the value of the new updated node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetCount
element.short: Gets the value for the Count property.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetCount.Result
element.short: Value for the Count property.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetOwner
element.short: Gets the value for the Owner property.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Owner of the collection.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SetItem
element.short: Assigns values from the specified tree node to a node in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the node updated in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SetItem.AValue
element.short: Tree node with the values assigned to an existing node in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited method on entry. Create allocates resources for the internal selection list in the class instance. The value in AnOwner is stored in the Owner property.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Create.AnOwner
element.short: Owner for the class instance.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls Clear to remove TTreeNode instances stored in Item and values in the internal cache. The selection list for the class instance is also cleared, and its allocated resources are freed. Destroy calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Add
element.short: Adds a new tree node as a sibling of the specified node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Add.Result
element.short: Tree node created and added in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Add.SiblingNode
element.short: Tree node that is a sibling of the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Add.S
element.short: Text for the new tree node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Add.Data
element.short: Pointer to the data for the new tree node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Add.AddMode
element.short: Indicates the position for the new node relative to its sibling(s).

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChild
element.short: Adds a node tree with the specified text as a child of the specified parent node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChild.Result
element.short: TTreeNode instance created in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChild.ParentNode
element.short: Parent node for the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChild.S
element.short: Text for the new tree node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChildFirst
element.short: AddChildFirst - adds a node with specified text as the first child of the parent node and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChildObject
element.short: AddChildObject - adds a child node with specified text and data-pointer to the parent node and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddChildObjectFirst
element.short: AddChildObjectFirst - adds a node with specified text and data as the first child of the parent node and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddFirst
element.short: AddFirst - adds a node with specified text as the first node in the same level as SiblingNode. and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddObject
element.short: AddObject - adds a node with specified text and data-pointer in the same level as SiblingNode. and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.AddObjectFirst
element.short: AddObjectFirst - adds a node with specified text and data-pointer as the first node in the same level as SiblingNode. and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindNodeWithData
element.short: FindNodeWithData - returns a node containing the specified data pointer.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindNodeWithText
element.short: Finds a node containing the specified text string.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindNodeWithTextPath
element.short: Finds a node with the text ancestry specified in TextPath.

descr.p: Returns the TTreeNode instance found which matches the text ancestry in TextPath, or Nil if a tree node is not found matching the specified values.

TextPath contains the delimited text values used to locate a tree node. The '/' (Slash) character is used as the delimiter between text values in TextPath. An initial slash character representing the root node is not needed or allowed. The search always starts at the top-level tree nodes in the container. The FindNode method is used to locate subsequent delimited text values in TextPath.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindNodeWithTextPath.Result
element.short: Tree nodes matching the specified text values.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindNodeWithTextPath.TextPath
element.short: Delimited text values used to locate the tree node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindTopLvlNode
element.short: Gets a top-level node containing the specified text.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindTopLvlNode.Result
element.short: Tree node with the specified text, or Nil.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FindTopLvlNode.NodeText
element.short: Text to locate in the top-level siblings.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetEnumerator
element.short: Gets the TTreeNodesEnumerator enumerator for the class instance.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetEnumerator.Result
element.short: TTreeNodesEnumerator instance created in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetFirstNode
element.short: GetFirstNode - returns the first node in the collection.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetFirstVisibleNode
element.short: Gets the first top-level tree node with its Visible property set to True.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetLastExpandedSubNode
element.short: GetLastExpandedSubNode - absolute last node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetLastNode
element.short: Gets the last top-level tree node in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetLastSubNode
element.short: Gets the last child or descendent node in the last top-level node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetLastVisibleNode
element.short: Gets the last top-level tree node with its Visible property set to True.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetSelections
element.short: Gets the tree node at the specified position in the list of selected nodes.

descr.p: Raises an ETreeNodeError exception if AIndex is not a valid ordinal position in the internal selection list. AIndex must be in the range 0..SelectionCount-1.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetSelections.Result
element.short: Tree node at the specified position in the selection list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.GetSelections.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in the selection list for the node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Insert
element.short: Inserts a node with the specified text before the specified node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.InsertBehind
element.short: Inserts a new node with the specified text just after the specified node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.InsertObject
element.short: InsertObject - inserts a new node with specified text and data just before the specified Next node and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.InsertObjectBehind
element.short: InsertObjectBehind - inserts a new node with specified text and data-pointer just behind specified Previous node and returns the new node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.IsMultiSelection
element.short: True if the node is part of a multi-selection in the internal selection list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.IsMultiSelection.Result
element.short: True if the node is part of a multi-selection in the internal selection list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Assign
element.short: Assign - if Source is of correct type, copies properties directly, otherwise calls inherited Assign which probably raises an exception.

element.name: TTreeNodes.BeginUpdate
element.short: Starts an update process for the tree nodes in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Clear
element.short: Removes tree nodes in the container and its internal cache.

element.name: TTreeNodes.ClearMultiSelection
element.short: ClearMultiSelection - clears a series of nodes in a multi-selection (provided the selection has not already been cleared).

element.name: TTreeNodes.ConsistencyCheck
element.short: ConsistencyCheck - makes sure all references to and from the nodes are consistent.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Delete
element.short: Removes the specified tree node from the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Delete.Node
element.short: Tree node deleted in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodes.EndUpdate
element.short: Finishes an update process for the tree nodes in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.FreeAllNodeData
element.short: Frees the pointer in the Data property for all nodes in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SelectionsChanged
element.short: Adds or removes the specified tree node to / from the internal selections list when its Selected property is changed.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SelectionsChanged.ANode
element.short: Tree node added to or removed from the selections list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SelectionsChanged.AIsSelected
element.short: True to add the node, False to remove the node in the selection list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SelectOnlyThis
element.short: Clears any existing multi-selections and selects the specified node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SelectOnlyThis.Node
element.short: Node selected in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodes.MultiSelect
element.short: Adds nodes relative the specified node to the multi-selection list.

descr.p: MultiSelect is a method used add nodes to the internal selection list relative to the node specified in Node. MultiSelect uses values in the MultiSelectStyle property for the tree view control in Owner to determine the nodes added. Specifically:

dl.dd: When present, only sibling nodes are selected for the specified node. When omitted, child nodes are added to the multi-selection.
When present, only visible nodes are included in the multi-selection. When omitted, all nodes are eligible regardless of their visibility.

descr.p: ClearWholeSelection indicates whether all existing nodes in the multi-selection are cleared before added new node(s) to the selection list. When set to True, the ClearMultiSelection method is called. Otherwise, the last node in the selection list is removed.
Nodes in the internal selection list are visited to set their MultiSelected property to True. Members used to track the first and last nodes in the multi-selection are updated prior to exit.

element.name: TTreeNodes.MultiSelect.Node
element.short: Tree node with the child or sibling nodes added to the selection list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.MultiSelect.ClearWholeSelection
element.short: True to remove all existing nodes in the selection list, False to remove the most recent node.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SortTopLevelNodes
element.short: Sorts the top-level nodes using the specified sorting procedure.

element.name: TTreeNodes.WriteDebugReport
element.short: WriteDebugReport - for debugging.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Count
element.short: Contains the number of nodes in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Item
element.short: Provides indexed access to the TTreeNode instances in the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Item.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the TTreeNode instance in the property value.

element.name: TTreeNodes.KeepCollapsedNodes
element.short: KeepCollapsedNodes - if True, preserves the nodes that have been collapsed.

element.name: TTreeNodes.Owner
element.short: The TCustomTreeView control that is the owner of the container.

element.name: TTreeNodes.SelectionCount
element.short: Number of tree nodes included in the internal selection list.

element.name: TTreeNodes.TopLvlCount
element.short: The number of tree nodes at the top level of the tree structure.

element.name: TTreeNodes.TopLvlItems
element.short: Provides indexed access to tree nodes at the top level of the tree structure.

element.name: TTreeNodes.TopLvlItems.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the TTreeNode instance in the property value.

element.name: TTreeViewState
element.short: TTreeViewState - enumerated type containing the permissible values for state of a TTreeView.

descr.p: TTreeViewState is an enumerated type containing the permissible state values for TCustomTreeView and TTreeView.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsScrollbarChanged
element.short: Scrollbar visibility or position has been changed in the control.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsMaxRightNeedsUpdate
element.short: The maximum width for expanded nodes needs to be recalculated.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsTopsNeedsUpdate
element.short: The top coordinate for visible, expanded nodes needs to be recalculated.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsMaxLvlNeedsUpdate
element.short: The maximum level for all nodes needs to be recalculated.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsTopItemNeedsUpdate
element.short: The first visible node on the control has changed.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsBottomItemNeedsUpdate
element.short: The last visible node on the control has changed.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsCanvasChanged
element.short: The canvas for the control has been changed.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsDragged
element.short: A node has been dragged to a new location in the tree.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsIsEditing
element.short: The BeginEditing method has been called for the control.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsStateChanging
element.short: Values in the States property for the control have been changed.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsManualNotify
element.short: A tree node has been expanded or collapsed using code.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsUpdating
element.short: This tree view state is deprecated, and has no functionality after r64855.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsPainting
element.short: The control has called it Paint method.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsMouseCapture
element.short: Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsWaitForDragging
element.short: A Drag operation and its timer has been started.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsDblClicked
element.short: A mouse double click event has been handled for the control.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsTripleClicked
element.short: A mouse triple click event has been handled for the control.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsQuadClicked
element.short: A mouse quadruple click event has been handled for the control.

element.name: TTreeViewState.tvsSelectionChanged
element.short: The selected node(s) have been changed in the control.

element.name: TTreeViewStates
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TTreeViewState enumeration.
element.descr: TTreeViewStates is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TTreeViewState enumeration. TTreeViewStates is the type used for the States property in TCustomTreeView.

element.name: TTreeViewOption
element.short: TTreeViewOption - enumerated type containing the permissible values for Options in TreeViews.

descr.p: TTreeViewOption - enumerated type containing the permissible values for Options in TreeViews.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoAllowMultiselect
element.short: Allows selection of several tree-items, e.g. using Ctrl+click and Shift+click. Has the same affect as setting the MultiSelect property to True.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoAutoExpand
element.short: Automatically expands child nodes for a tree-item when user clicks it, or the item is activated by code. Has the same affect as setting the AutoExpand property to True.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoAutoInsertMark
element.short: Allows painting a horizontal line below a tree-item under cursor when mouse moves. Good for drag-drop.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoAutoItemHeight
element.short: Detect height of a tree-item based on current font and icons.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoHideSelection
element.short: If a control looses focus, then don't paint selection for selected tree-item. Same as HideSelection property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoHotTrack
element.short: Additionally highlight/underline a tree-item when mouse is over it. Same as HotTrack property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoKeepCollapsedNodes
element.short: When some items change, keep previously folded tree-items in folded state.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoReadOnly
element.short: Don't allow to change item captions by clicking on items with a delay. Same as ReadOnly property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoRightClickSelect
element.short: Right-click also selects a tree-item. Otherwise it only calls PopupMenu. Same as RightClickSelect property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoRowSelect
element.short: When a tree-item is selected, paint selection background with full width. Same as RowSelect property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoShowButtons
element.short: Show expand/collapse (fold/unfold) icons at left side for nodes with sub-nodes. Same as ShowButtons property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoShowLines
element.short: Show vertical lines at left side which paint tree structure for nested nodes. Same as ShowLines property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoShowRoot
element.short: Show the root tree-item which is always present in code but may be hidden for user. Same as ShowRoot property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoShowSeparators
element.short: Show horizontal lines below all tree-items.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoToolTips
element.short: Show tooltip (hint) for a tree-item when the item is too long to fit by width and mouse is over it. Same as ToolTips property.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoNoDoubleClickExpand
element.short: Prevents toggling the expanded state for the tree view item when it is double clicked.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoThemedDraw
element.short: Tree view item is drawn using settings from theme services.

element.name: TTreeViewOption.tvoEmptySpaceUnselect
element.short: Indicates if empty space can be be drawn below unselected items in the tree view.

element.name: TTreeViewOptions
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TTreeViewOption enumeration.

descr.p: TTreeViewOptions is a set type used to store zero (0) or more values from the TTreeViewOption enumeration. Values included in the set indicate that a feature or behavior is enabled for a tree view control.
TTreeViewOptions is the type used for the TCustomTreeView.Options property.

element.name: DefaultTreeViewOptions
element.short: A set of TreeViewOptions which are set be default.

descr.p: A set of default values used to set the options of a TreeView object when first placed on a form. This set consists of the following items:
For the meaning of these options, see the TTreeViewOption documentation.

element.name: DefaultMultiSelectStyle
element.short: Default value(s) used for the MultiSelectStyle property in TCustomTreeView.

element.name: DefaultTreeNodeHeight
element.short: Default value used as the height for a TTreeNode instance.

element.name: DefaultTreeNodeExpandSignSize
element.short: Default size used for expand and collapse indicators in TCustomTreeView.

descr.p: DefaultTreeNodeExpandSignSize contains thew default value used in the TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignSize property. The value may be scaled at run-time in TCustomTreeView if the PPI (Pixels Per Inch) setting in the control differs from the value used at design-time.

element.name: TTreeViewExpandSignType
element.short: Represents symbols types used for expanded or collapsed tree nodes.

descr.p: TTreeViewExpandSignType is an enumerated type which specifies the symbol displayed in a Treeview to denote the expanded or collapsed state for a given tree node. TTreeViewExpandSignType is the type used to implement the TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignType property.

element.name: TTreeViewExpandSignType.tvestTheme
element.short: Uses the mechanism provided by Theme Services.

element.name: TTreeViewExpandSignType.tvestPlusMinus
element.short: Uses a Plus or Minus sign.

element.name: TTreeViewExpandSignType.tvestArrow
element.short: Uses an unfilled Arrow.

element.name: TTreeViewExpandSignType.tvestArrowFill
element.short: Uses a filled Arrow.

element.name: TTreeViewInsertMarkType
element.short: Represents insert mark locations used in TCustomTreeView.

descr.p: TTreeViewInsertMarkType is an enumerated type with values representing insert mark locations used for nodes in the TCustomTreeView control. TTreeViewInsertMarkType is the type used to implement the InsertMarkType property in TCustomTreeView.

element.name: TTreeViewInsertMarkType.tvimNone
element.short: No insert mark is used in a tree view.

element.name: TTreeViewInsertMarkType.tvimAsFirstChild
element.short: Uses an insert mark for the root or first child node in a tree view.

element.name: TCustomTreeView
element.short: Ancestor class for TTreeView.

descr.p: TCustomTreeView - ancestor class for TTreeView, which displays a collection of items in a hierarchical tree form. This class defines many properties which are inherited by descendent classes, including loading the data from files or streams, saving to files or streams, updating, sorting alphabetically, editing, making visible or invisible, expanding or collapsing the tree display, and many more.

Please note that Accessibility support in TCustomTreeView might make this control slower if there are a very large number of items, for example: 10,000+ items. If the performance impact is unacceptable, it is possible to turn accessibility off for tree view items by setting the AccessibilityOn property to False. The default value is True.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DragScrollTimerTick
element.short: Implements the OnTimer event handler for the internal Drag/Scroll timer.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DragScrollTimerTick.Sender
element.short: Timer object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanvasChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control Canvas has been changed.

descr.p: Updates the States property to include the value tvsCanvasChanged.
descr.remark: CanvasChanged is not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetAutoExpand
element.short: Gets the value for the AutoExpand property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetAutoExpand.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetBackgroundColor
element.short: Gets the value for the BackgroundColor property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetBackgroundColor.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetBottomItem
element.short: Gets the value for the BottomItem property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetBottomItem.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetDropTarget
element.short: Gets the value for the DropTarget property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetDropTarget.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.FChangeTimer
element.short: Member with the OnChange timer for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.FEditor
element.short: TEdit used as the editor in the tree view control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default dimensions used for new instances of the class.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetControlClassDefaultSize.Result
element.short: Size for the new control instance.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Added
element.short: Performs actions needed when the specified tree node is added to Items.

descr.p: Signals the OnAddition event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Added.Node
element.short: Tree nodes added to the Items for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditorEditingDone
element.short: Implements the OnEditingDone event handler for the Editor in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditorEditingDone.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditorKeyDown
element.short: Implements the OnKeyDown event handler for the Editor in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditorKeyDown.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditorKeyDown.Key
element.short: Virtual key code for the notification.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditorKeyDown.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, or Alt modifier for the key down event.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.BeginEditing
element.short: Prepares the control to edit the text for the specified tree node.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method for any of the following conditions:

ul.li: ANode has not been assigned (contains Nil).
BeginEditing has been called and EndEditing has not yet been called.
CanEdit (and the OnEditing event handler) returns False.

descr.p: If a different node is being edited in the control, the EndEditing method is called.
BeginEditing updates the States property to include the value tvsIsEditing.

The TEdit control used as the Editor in the tree view is created (when needed), configured, and aligned to the display rectangle for the tree node. The value in the TTreeNode.Text property is assigned to the Editor, its content is selected, and the Editor is given focus.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.BeginEditing.ANode
element.short: Tree node with the text value for the Editor in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanChange
element.short: True if the specified tree node can be used in the Selected or Selections properties.

descr.p: Signals the OnChanging event handler (when assigned) to determine if a change is allowed for the specified tree node. Change entails using the tree node as the current Selected node, or including it in Selections when multi-select is enabled in the Options for the control.
The return value is updated in the event handler, and can be set to True to allow a change to the tree node. The return value is always True if the OnChanging event handler has not been assigned.
Use CanEdit to determine if the text for the tree node can edited in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanChange.Result
element.short: True if the specified tree node can be used in the Selected or Selections properties.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanChange.Node
element.short: Tree node examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanCollapse
element.short: Returns True if a given TreeNode can be collapsed.

descr.p: CanCollapse is a Boolean function used to determine if the tree node in Node can be collapsed. CanCollapse signals the OnCollapsing event handler (when assigned) to determine if the tree node can be collapsed.

The return value is updated in the event handler, and can be set to True when the node has child nodes and is currently expanded. The return value should be set to False if the node does not have any child nodes.
The return value is always True if the OnCollapsing event handler has not been assigned, or when the component is being freed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanCollapse.Result
element.short: True if the specified node can be collapsed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanCollapse.Node
element.short: Tree node examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanEdit
element.short: Returns True if the specified tree node can be edited.

descr.p: CanEdit is a Boolean function used to determine if the tree node in Node can be edited. CanEdit signals the OnEditing event handler (when assigned) to determine if the TTreeNode instance can be modified.

The return value is updated in the event handler, and can be set to True if the tree view control is not configured to be read-only and the tree node is eligible for modification. Use the Options property in the tree view control to check for the read-only setting. The return value is always True if the OnEditing event handler has not been assigned.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanEdit.Result
element.short: True if the specified tree node can modify its property values.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanEdit.Node
element.short: Tree node examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanExpand
element.short: True if the specified tree node can be expanded.

descr.p: CanExpand is a Boolean function used to determine if the tree node specified in Node can be expanded. CanExpand signals the OnExpanding event handler (when assigned) to get the return value for the method.
The return value can be set to True when Node is visible and contains child nodes. The return value is always True if the OnExpanding event handler has not been assigned.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanExpand.Result
element.short: True if the specified node can be expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CanExpand.Node
element.short: Tree node examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CreateNode
element.short: CreateNode - creates a new node in a TreeView and returns its content.

descr.p: CreateNode is a TTreeNode function used to create a new tree node for the control. The OnCustomCreateItem event handler is signalled (when assigned) to create the class instance used as the return value. If the event handler has not been assigned, or returns a Nil value, the TTreeNodeClass class reference is used to create the tree node in the return value.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CreateNode.Result
element.short: New tree node instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CreateNodes
element.short: Creates a TTreeNodes container for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CreateNodes.Result
element.short: TTreeNodes instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CustomDraw
element.short: CustomDraw - returns True if Custom Drawing is proceeding in the specified Rectangle.

descr.p: CustomDraw - returns True if Custom Drawing is proceeding in the specified Rectangle.
Stage indicates whether PrePaint, PostPaint, PreErase or PostErase.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CustomDrawItem
