element.short: CustomDrawItem - returns True if Custom Image drawing is proceeding at the specified TreeNode.

descr.p: CustomDrawItem - returns True if Custom Image drawing is proceeding at the specified TreeNode.
State denotes one of Selected, Grayed, Disabled, Checked, Focused, Default, Hot, Marked or Indeterminate.
Stage indicates whether PrePaint, PostPaint, PreErase or PostErase.
If PaintImages is True, Images should be painted as well as text.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DefaultItemHeightIsStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the DefaultItemHeight property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DefaultItemHeightIsStored.Result
element.short: True when tvoAutoItemHeight in not in the Options for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoAutoAdjustLayout
element.short: Applies a layout adjustment policy using the specified scaling factors.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AMode
element.short: Layout adjustment policy applied in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AXProportion
element.short: Horizontal scaling factor for the layout policy.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoAutoAdjustLayout.AYProportion
element.short: Vertical scaling factor for the layout policy.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignSizeIsStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the ExpandSignSize property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignSizeIsStored.Result
element.short: True when ExpandSignSize has a value other than the default (-1).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetBuiltinIconSize
element.short: Gets the default size for icons when Images has not been assigned.

descr.p: The TSize instance contains 0 (zero) in both the Width and Height members.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetBuiltinIconSize.Result
element.short: TSize instance with the Width and Height for an icon.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetDragImages
element.short: Gets the image list with the Drag images for the control.

descr.p: GetDragImages is an overridden TDragImageList function used to get the image list with images displayed during drag and drop operations in the control. GetDragImages re-implements the method to use the TDragImageList member defined in the class instance (when assigned and not empty). Otherwise, Nil is returned from the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetDragImages.Result
element.short: Image list with drag and drop images for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetImageSize
element.short: Gets a TSize instance with the dimensions for images in the control.

descr.p: GetImageSize is a TSize function used to get the dimensions for images displayed in the tree view control. The return value has Width and Height members with the image dimensions.

When an image list has been assigned to the Images property, its SizeForPPI method is used to scale the value in ImagesWidth to the current display density in Font. When Images has not been assigned, the GetBuiltinIconSize method is called to get the return value.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetImageSize.Result
element.short: TSize instance with the dimensions for images in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetMaxLvl
element.short: GetMaxLvl - returns the maximum level of branching of the tree structure.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetMaxScrollLeft
element.short: GetMaxScrollLeft - returns maximal extent of scrolling to the left.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetMaxScrollTop
element.short: GetMaxScrollTop - returns the maximal extent of scrolling upwards.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeAtY
element.short: GetNodeAtY - returns the node at the specified vertical coordinate.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeDrawAreaHeight
element.short: Gets the height for the usable drawing area in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeDrawAreaWidth
element.short: Gets the width for the usable drawing area in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IndentIsStored
element.short: Implements the storage specifier for the Indent property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IndentIsStored.Result
element.short: True when Indent has a value other than the default (-1).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsCustomDrawn
element.short: IsCustomDrawn - returns True if the specified target is custom drawn.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsCustomDrawn.Result
element.short: True when event handlers have been assigned for the specified target and stage.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsCustomDrawn.Target
element.short: Drawing target examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsCustomDrawn.Stage
element.short: Drawing stage examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsNodeVisible
element.short: Returns True if the specified tree node and its parent nodes are visible and expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsNodeVisible.Result
element.short: True if the specified tree node and its parent nodes are visible and expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsNodeVisible.ANode
element.short: Tree node examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsNodeHeightFullVisible
element.short: IsNodeHeightFullVisible - returns True if the full height of the specified node is visible in the current view.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsInsertMarkVisible
element.short: IsInsertMarkVisible - returns True if an Insert mark is visible.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveSelection
element.short: Makes the specified node selected in the tree view control.

descr.p: MoveSelection is a method used to make the tree node in ANewNode a selected node in the tree view control. The actions performed depend on the multi-selection setting for the control. When tvoAllowMultiSelect has been included in the Options property, the node is included in Selections when ASelect is True.
If multi-selection has not been enabled for the control, the value in ANewNode is assigned to the Selected property.
The MakeVisible method in the TTreeNode instance is called to make the node visible, and the scrollbars for the control are updated.
Used in the implementation of the KeyDown method. Used to implement methods like MoveHome, MoveEnd, MovePageDown, MovePageUp, MoveToNexNode, and MoveToNexNode.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveSelection.ANewNode
element.short: Tree node to select in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveSelection.ASelect
element.short: True to include the tree node in Selections (when enabled), False to select only the specified node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Change
element.short: Performs actions needed when the selection in the control has been changed to include the specified tree node.

descr.p: Change is a method used to perform actions needed when the selection in the control has been changed. Node contains the tree node that was used in the control selection. Change signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
Change is called from the event handler used for the internal timer activated when a new selection is made and the control synchronizes the tree nodes to the visual display.
Use the OnSelectionChange event handler for the notification that occurs before the node is included in the control selection.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Change.Node
element.short: Tree node included in the selection for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Collapse
element.short: Performs actions needed when the specified tree node is collapsed.

descr.p: Collapse is a method used to perform actions needed when the tree node in Node is collapsed. Collapse updates the visibility and position for the scrollbars in the control. The OnCollapsed event handler is signalled (when assigned) for the tree node in Node.
No actions are performed in the method when the component is being freed.
Collapse is called when the Collapse method in the TTreeNode instance is called.
See Expand for the actions performed when a tree node is expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Collapse.Node
element.short: Tree node collapsed in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CreateWnd
element.short: Performs actions needed when the handle for the control is (re-)created.

descr.p: CreateWnd is an overridden method in TCustomTreeView used to perform actions needed when the handle for the control is created or re-created. CreateWnd ensures that the States property is updated to remove the value tvsStateChanging. The internal flags for scrollbar visibility are reset, and the inherited method is called.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Click
element.short: Performs actions needed when mouse is clicked on a tree node in the control.

descr.p: Click is an overridden method in TCustomTreeView. It calls the inherited method when a tree node has been selected using a mouse down event. No actions are performed in the method when a tree node has not been selected using the mouse.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DblClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Left mouse button is double clicked on a selected tree node.

descr.p: DblClick is an overridden method in TCustomTreeView. It calls the inherited method when a tree node has been double clicked using the mouse. No actions are performed in the method when a tree node has not been selected and a double click event occurs.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Delete
element.short: Performs actions needed when the specified tree node is deleted.

descr.p: Delete is a method used to perform actions needed when the specified tree node is deleted from the list of tree nodes in Items. Delete signals the OnDeletion event handler (when assigned) for the tree node specified in Node. No actions are performed in the method if OnDeletion has not been assigned.
Delete is called when a TTreeNode instance is freed, or when the Delete method in TTreeNodes is executed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Delete.Node
element.short: Tree node deleted from the Items in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DestroyWnd
element.short: Performs actions needed when the handle for the control is destroyed.

descr.p: Includes the tvsStateChanging flag in the States property, and calls the inherited method. Ensures that the Canvas handle has been freed after calling the inherited method. Resets size values in the ScrollInfo for the horizontal and vertical scrollbars.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoCreateNodeClass
element.descr: Signals the OnCreateNodeClass event handler (when assigned).

descr.p: Ensures that the previous drop target is reset, and that the drag scroll timer is disabled. Restores the Tooltips to their previous values.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoPaint
element.short: Implements the Paint method for the control.

descr.p: DoPaint is a method used render the control to its canvas. It Implements the overridden Paint method. No actions are performed in the method when tvsPainting has been included in the States property (Paint has already been called).

DoPaint includes the value tvsPainting in the States property to indicate that the paint method is active. It includes the value tvoFocusedPainting in States when Focused is True, or excludes the value when Focused is False.
The UpdateDefaultItemHeight is called when tvoAutoItemHeight is included in the Options for the control. The existing value in DefaultItemHeight is used when the Option is omitted.

DoPaint performs the multi-stage drawing process for nodes in the tree view control using its Canvas and a display rectangle using the ClientWidth for the control. If the control includes event handlers for the cdPrePaint stage, the CustomDraw method is called.

DoPaint draws the nodes on the tree view starting at the node in TopItem. If the node is Visible, the DoPaintNode method is called to render the tree node. The next visible node in the tree is retrieved, and the process is repeated until no more nodes are available or the drawing area is filled.
An InsertMark is drawn for the root node if needed.
Borders are drawn around the control using the value in BorderWidth.
If the control has event handlers for the cdPostPaint stage, the CustomDraw method is called.
The value tvsPainting is excluded from the States property prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoPaintNode
element.short: Renders the specified tree node to the canvas for the control.

descr.p: DoPaintNode is a method used to render the tree node specified in Node to the Canvas for the control. DoPaintNode is called from the DoPaint method, and occurs for visible nodes processed in the method. No actions are performed in the method when the Node is not in the visible client area for the control.
DoPaintNode draws the elements which represent a given tree node, including:

ul.li: An Image or State Image for the node.
Expand or Collapse indicators for the node.
Background for the node using theme services or node state.
An Insert mark for the initial child node in the tree hierarchy.
Horizontal and vertical lines used to join nodes in the tree hierarchy.
The Separator line drawn after a node.

descr.p: DoPaintNode retrieves scaled image resolutions needed for the Images and StateImages in the control. The images sizes are determined by applying the scaling factor in Canvas to the current Pixels Per Inch setting in Font.

Use of multi-stage custom drawing is supported. If event handlers are provided for the cdPrePaint and cdPostPaint stages, the CustomDraw and CustomDrawItem methods are used to render the node with the drawing state for the node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoPaintNode.Node
element.short: Tree node rendered in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EndEditing
element.short: Updates the specified tree node and hides editor.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method if tvsIsEditing has not been included in the States property (BeginEditing was not called).
EndEditing removes the value tvsIsEditing from the States property to indicate that editing has been completed for the control.
The OnEdited event handler is signalled (when assigned) to validate or modify the new text value, and the text is stored in Node.
EndEditing calls the Invalidate method to force the control to be redrawn.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EnsureNodeIsVisible
element.short: Ensures parent nodes are expanded, and the specified node is visible in the control.

descr.p: No actions are performed in the method if ANode has not been assigned (contains Nil).
Calls the ExpandParents method in ANode to expand any parent nodes not already expanded. Ensures that the tree node in ANode is visible in the client area for the control.
EnsureNodeIsVisible is used in the TTreeNode.MakeVisible method, and called from BeginEditing when the editor is displayed for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Expand
element.short: Expands the specified tree node and updates the scrollbars for the control.

descr.p: Expand is a method used to expand the tree node specified in Node on the tree view control. Expand is called after when the TTreeNode instance in Node has updated its States property and notified the Items container of the change.
Expand updates the scrollbars for the control. The OnExpanded event handler is signalled (when assigned) to performs actions needed after the tree node has been expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Expand.Node
element.short: Tree node expanded in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the index of the image for the specified node.

descr.p: Allows the image index for the tree node to be updated before the node is drawn. Signals the OnGetImageIndex event handler (when assigned) where the image index can be determined and stored in the specified tree node.
Called from the DoPaintNode method for any unselected nodes in the tree view. Use the OnGetSelectedIndex event handler to get the image index for a selected node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetImageIndex.Node
element.short: Tree node examined in the method (and possibly updated in the event handler).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetSelectedIndex
element.short: Gets the index for the image used a selected node in the control.

descr.p: Allows the image index for a selected node to be updated before the node is drawn. Signals the OnGetSelectedIndex event handler (when assigned) where the image index can be determined and stored in the specified tree node.
Called from the DoPaintNode method for any a selected node in the tree view. Use the OnGetImageIndex event handler to get the image index for a node that is not selected.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetSelectedIndex.Node
element.short: Tree node examine in the method (and possibly updated in the event handler).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.KeyDown
element.short: Handles key down events for the control.

descr.p: KeyDown is an overridden method in TCustomTreeView which handles key down events for the control.
Key contains the virtual key code examined in the method.
Shift is the Shift, Alt, Ctrl modifier for the key code.
KeyDown calls the inherited method on entry. KeyDown ensures that the following Key codes are handled in the method:

dl.dd: Moves to the next node in the tree. Shift+Down includes the next node in the Selections property.
Moves to the previous node in the tree. Shift+Up includes the next node in the Selections property.
Moves to the tree node at the top of the visible area. Shift+Home includes an affected range of nodes in the Selections property.
Moves to the tree node at the bottom of the visible area. Shift+End includes an affected range of nodes in the Selections property.
Moves the first node on the previous page for the control. Shift+PageUp includes an affected range of nodes in the Selections property.
Moves the first node on the next page for the control. Shift+PageDn includes an affected range of nodes in the Selections property.
Collapses the current node (when expanded) and moves to the parent node.
Expands the current node (when needed), or moves to the next expanded node in the tree.
Expands the current node.
Collapses the current node.
Calls BeginEditing for the Selected node if the control is not ReadOnly.

descr.p: If the key event is handled in the method, Key is set to VK_UNKNOWN.
Calls MoveSelection if the key event changes the Selected tree node (or Selections) in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.KeyDown.Key
element.short: Virtual key code examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.KeyDown.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, Alt modifier for the key code.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseDown
element.short: Handles mouse down events for the tree view control.

descr.p: MouseDown is an overridden method in TCustomTreeView used to handle mouse down events in the control.
Button identifies the mouse button for the event.
Shift contains the Shift, Alt, or Ctrl modifier for the mouse event.
X and Y contain the coordinates for the mouse event.
MouseDown updates the States property to remove the values tvsEditOnMouseUp and tvsSingleSelectOnMouseUp.
The tree node for the mouse event is retrieved using GetNodeAt for the mouse coordinates. The Selected state for the tree node is saved so the selection can be restored prior to exit.

MouseDown ensures that both Left and Right mouse button events are handled (when needed). When RightClickSelect is True, the Selection can be changed using the Right mouse button. Otherwise, it is ignored. Multi-selection is handled when the Shift modifier is set for the mouse event.
A mouse event on an unused space in the control causes ClearSelection to be called when RowSelect is True. Selected is set to Nil if RowSelect is False.

When MultiSelect has not been enabled, the selected tree node is assigned to the Selected property. When it has been enabled, the MultiSelect method in Items is used to include the selected tree node in the Selections property. ClearSelection is called if the tree node was de-selected by the mouse event. Selected is set to Nil if the tree node was de-selected by the mouse event.
The control is Focused (when needed and allowed) by calling the SetFocus method.

Mouse events in the Expand or Collapse indicator causes the Expanded state for the tree node to be toggled. When RowSelect is enabled, the MouseUp event causes the editor to be activated for the node.
MouseDown calls the inherited method to handle drag messages or close the editor for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseDown.Button
element.short: Mouse button for the event.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseDown.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, or Alt modifier for the mouse event.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseDown.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the mouse event.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseDown.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the mouse event.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseUp
element.short: Handles mouse up events for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MouseLeave
element.short: Performs actions needed when the mouse cursor leaves the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.NodeChanged
element.short: Performs actions when a property value in the specified tree node has been changed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.NodeChanged.Node
element.short: Tree node with the changed property value.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.NodeChanged.ChangeReason
element.short: Indicates the value changed in the tree node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Paint
element.short: Renders the tree view control.

descr.p: Calls DoPaint to implement the Paint method for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ScrollView
element.short: Scrolls the visible area in the control by the specified horizontal and vertical offsets.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ScrollView.DeltaX
element.short: Horizontal offset applied to the visible area for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ScrollView.DeltaY
element.short: Vertical offset applied to the visible area for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SetOptions
element.short: Sets the value for the Options property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SetOptions.NewOptions
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.UpdateDefaultItemHeight
element.short: Calculates and updates the value in the DefaultItemHeight property.

descr.p: UpdateDefaultItemHeight is a procedure used to calculate and update the value for the DefaultItemHeight property. No actions are performed in the method for the following conditions:

ul.li: tvoAutoItemHeight has not been included in the Options for the control.
The handle for the control has not been allocated.
The handle for the control Canvas has not been allocated.

descr.p: The height for the Text in the node is calculated using the TCanvas.TextHeight method, and space is reserved for the default spacing for the tree node.

GetImageSize is called to get the height needed for Images or StateImages used in the control. Values in ImageSize and StateImageSize are updated with the scaled image heights including default spacing. The calculated value is enlarged for the Image sizes if needed.
UpdateDefaultItemHeight updates the States property to include values that indicate the item height for nodes has changed. The Invalidate method is called to force the control to be redrawn.
UpdateDefaultItemHeight is called from methods like: InitializeWnd, Loaded, SetOptions, and DoPaint.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.UpdateInsertMark
element.short: UpdateInsertMark - see if there is an insert mark at X,Y and put one in if necessary.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DoSelectionChanged
element.short: DoSelectionChanged - perform the code required for a change in selection.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMHScroll
element.short: Handles the WMHScroll message for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMHScroll.Msg
element.short: Control message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMVScroll
element.short: Handles the WMVScroll message for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMVScroll.Msg
element.short: Control message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMLButtonDown
element.short: Handles the WMLButtonDown message for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMLButtonDown.AMessage
element.short: Message examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMSetFocus
element.short: Handles the WMSetFocus message for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMSetFocus.Message
element.short: Control message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMKillFocus
element.short: Handles the WMKillFocus message for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WMKillFocus.Message
element.short: Control message handled in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Resize
element.short: Resizes the control and updates the scrollbars and the States property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EditingItem
element.short: Contains the tree node being edited in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.States
element.short: Contains the state values in effect for the control.
element.descr: States is a read-only TTreeViewStates property which contains the state values in effect for the control. Value from the TTreeViewState enumeration are included in the set type to indicate that the corresponding state is "ON", "TRUE", or "ACTIVE".

element.name: TCustomTreeView.AccessibilityOn
element.short: Allows to turn accessibility off to speed up the control.

descr.p: This property is provided for the case when a tree view contains a huge amount of items, lets say 10.000+. In this case accessibility might slow the tree down, so turning this property off might make things faster.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.AutoExpand
element.short: Unfold a tree-item when user clicks it or an item activated by code.

descr.p: AutoExpand is a Boolean property which indicates if a tree node is automatically expanded when it is Selected using a mouse click or keyboard navigation. The default value for the property is False.

The property value is True when the value tvoAutoExpand has been included in the Options property. Changing the value in the property causes the Options property to be updated. When set to True, the value tvoAutoExpand is included in the Options property. Otherwise, the value is excluded from Options.

AutoExpand is used when the TTreeNodes container in the Items property adds or moves a tree node. If the new tree node or its owner has AutoExpand set to True, the value is also applied to its Parent node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.HideSelection
element.short: Indicates if the current Selection is hidden when the control loses focus.

descr.p: HideSelection is a Boolean property which indicates if the current selection is hidden when the control loses focus. The default value for the property is True.

The value for the property is True if tvoHideSelection has been included in the Options for the control. Changing the value in the property causes tvoHideSelection to be included in or excluded from Options. The control is redrawn if Selected has an assigned tree node when the property is changed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.HotTrack
element.short: Additionally highlight/underline tree-item when mouse is over it.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.HotTrackColor
element.short: Font color used for the text in a tree node when hot tracking is enabled.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DisabledFontColor
element.short: Font color used for tree nodes when the control is not enabled.

descr.p: The default value for the property is clGrayText.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Indent
element.short: Size in pixels by which each nested branching level is to be indented.

descr.p: Use 0 for auto-sized value.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MultiSelect
element.short: Allow to select several tree-items at a time, e.g. using Ctrl+click (select one item more) or Shift+click (select range of items).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnAddition
element.short: Event handler signalled when a tree node is added or moved in the Items in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnAdvancedCustomDraw
element.short: OnAdvancedCustomDraw - event handler for advanced custom drawing.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnAdvancedCustomDrawItem
element.short: OnAdvancedCustomDrawItem - event handler for advanced custom drawing item.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - specialized event handler for a change in the TreeView.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnChanging
element.short: OnChanging - specialized event handler while TreeView is being changed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCollapsed
element.short: OnCollapsed - specialized event handler when part of the tree is collapsed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCollapsing
element.short: OnCollapsing - specialized event handler while part of the tree is being collapsed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCompare
element.short: OnCompare - specialized event handler for comparisons within the TreeView.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCreateNodeClass
element.short: Event handler signalled to get the class reference used to create new tree nodes.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCustomCreateItem
element.short: OnCustomCreateItem - event handler for custom item creation.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCustomDraw
element.short: OnCustomDraw - event handler for custom drawing.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCustomDrawItem
element.short: OnCustomDrawItem - event handler for custom drawing item.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnCustomDrawArrow
element.short: Event handler signalled to custom draw expand or collapse indicators.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnDeletion
element.short: Event handler signalled when a node is deleted from the node tree.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnEdited
element.short: OnEdited - specialized event handler when the TreeView has been edited.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnEditing
element.short: OnEditing - specialized event handler while a TreeView is being edited.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnEditingEnd
element.short: Event handler signalled when EndEditing is called for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnExpanded
element.short: OnExpanded - specialized event handler when a TreeView has been expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnExpanding
element.short: OnExpanding - specialized event handler while a TreeView is being expanded.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnGetImageIndex
element.short: OnGetImageIndex - event handler for finding the index of an image.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnGetSelectedIndex
element.short: OnGetSelectedIndex - event handler for finding index of selected item.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnNodeChanged
element.short: Event handler signalled when the text for a tree node has been changed.

descr.p: OnNodeChanged is a TTVNodeChangedEvent property with the event handler signalled when the text in a tree node has been changed. OnNodeChanged is signalled from the NodeChanged method, and allows actions to be performed when the Node is updated.
NodeChanged and OnNodeChanged are called from the TTreeNode.Changed method, and occurs after the value in the Text property for the TTreeNode instance has been updated.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.OnSelectionChanged
element.short: Event handler signalled when the selection in the tree view control is changed.

descr.p: OnSelectionChanged is a TNotifyEvent property with the event handler signalled when the selection for the control has been changed. OnSelectionChanged is signalled (when assigned) from the DoSelectionChanged method, and occurs after the value in Selection has been updated. It also occurs when the value in MultiSelected is changed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ReadOnly
element.short: Indicates whether the text (or caption) for tree nodes can be edited in the control.

descr.p: ReadOnly is a Boolean property which indicates whether the text for the TTreeNode instances in Items can be edited in the control. When ReadOnly is set to False, the BeginEditing method is not called when the F2 key is pressed, or when the Left mouse button is double clicked. The default value for the property is False.

The property value is True when tvoReadOnly has been included in the Options for the control. Setting a new value for the property causes tvoReadOnly to be included in or excluded from the values in Options. Changing the value to False causes the EndEditing method to be called.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.RightClickSelect
element.short: Right-click also selects tree-item. Else it only calls PopupMenu.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.RowSelect
element.short: When a tree-item is selected, paint selection background with full width.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ScrolledLeft
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the origin of the visible display area.

descr.p: ScrolledLeft is an Integer Property with the horizontal coordinate for the origin of the visible display area in the tree view control.
Use ScrolledTop for the vertical coordinate for the origin of the visible display area.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ScrolledTop
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the origin of the visible display area.

descr.p: ScrolledTop is an Integer Property with the vertical coordinate for the origin of the visible display area in the tree view control.
Use ScrolledLeft for the horizontal coordinate for the origin of the visible display area.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ShowButtons
element.short: Enables an expand/collapse (fold/unfold) icon for nodes with child nodes.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ShowLines
element.short: Enables the horizontal and vertical lines which join nodes in the tree hierarchy.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ShowRoot
element.short: Enables drawing of the root node indicator for the tree view control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ShowSeparators
element.short: Indicates if horizontal separators are drawn between nodes in the tree view control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SortType
element.short: Allow to show items sorted: by caption, by Data property or both.
element.descr: Changing the Text or Data of a node will sort again. While adding nodes does not. Call TreeView1.AlphaSort to sort the whole tree. Call ParentNode.CustomSort(nil) to sort only the child nodes of a single node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ToolTips
element.short: Show tooltip (hint) for a tree-item when the item is too long to fit by width and mouse is over it.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomTreeView: calls inherited Create then sets defaults for style, size, etc.

descr.p: Create - constructor for TCustomTreeView: calls inherited Create then sets defaults for style, size, etc.
Among the variables initialized and defaults set are:
size, color, the symbols for expansion etc, the border style and width, scroll bars, options, indentation, timers, action links

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomTreeView: frees images, nodes and links, then calls inherited Destroy.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.AlphaSort
element.short: Sorts tree nodes using default sort procedure (alphabetic).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.AlphaSort.Result
element.short: Always returns False (because CustomSort returns False).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ClearSelection
element.short: Clears the selection in the tree view control.

descr.p: ClearSelection is a method used to clear tree nodes selected in the tree view control. ClearSelection uses the value in MultiSelect to determine the actions needed to clear the selected nodes.
If MultiSelect has been enabled in the Options for the control, the ClearMultiSelection method is called to clear the selected nodes.

KeepPrimary indicates whether the first tree node in a multi-selection is retained. When set to False, all selected nodes are removed from the Selections property. Otherwise, the tree node in Selected is retained.
If MultiSelect has not been enabled, the value in the Selected property is set to Nil to clear the single node selection.
No actions are performed in the method when MultiSelect is False and KeepPrimary is True.
ClearSelections is called from methods that handle mouse or keyboard selection, like KeyDown and MouseDown. It is also called when a new value is assigned to the MultiSelect property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ClearSelection.KeepPrimary
element.short: True if the first node in a multi-selection is kept.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ConsistencyCheck
element.short: Verifies that values are updated and valid for the tree view control.

descr.p: ConsistencyCheck is a method used to validate and/or update property and member values in the control. It raises an Exception (catchable in the debugger) for invalid property values in the control, including:

dl.dd: Raises the exception if Canvas is not assigned.
Raises the exception if DefaultItemHeight has a negative value.
Raises the exception if FIndent has a negative value.
Raises the exception if FMaxRight has a negative value.
Raises the exception if IsEditing is True and Selected is unassigned.
Raises the exception if the node in Selected is not visible.
Raises the exception if Items has not been assigned.

descr.p: The Items property has additional validations performed for its property values. The ConsistencyCheck method in Items is called to verify node counts, update counts, index values, and hierarchy levels in the container. An Exception is raised for error conditions in these items as well.

Values in the States property are examined and updated (when needed) to refresh the display coordinates for tree nodes, the maximum width for the expanded nodes in the control, and the levels in the tree hierarchy. These operations may also raise an Exception for invalid states or values.
ConsistencyCheck is called from the WriteDebugReport method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CustomSort
element.short: If True, the external method specified in SortProc is used for sorting.

descr.p: CustomSort is a Boolean function used to sort the tree nodes in Items using the sort procedure specified in SortProc. If SortProc is not assigned, the DefaultTreeViewSort method is used in the sort procedure.
No actions are performed in the method when the number of tree nodes in Items is 0 (zero).
The return value is always False.
CustomSort calls BeginUpdate to minimize updates during the sorting process. EndUpdates is called when the sorting process is completed.

Top-level nodes in Items are sorted by calling the SortTopLevelNodes in items. Child nodes are then sorted (when present), starting at the first top-level node in the tree. The ClearCache method in Items is called to invalidate the node cache for the control.
The States property is updated to force the node coordinates and scrollbars to be refreshed in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CustomSort.Result
element.short: Always returns False.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.CustomSort.SortProc
element.short: Routine used to implement the sort procedure in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DefaultTreeViewSort
element.short: DefaultTreeViewSort - returns result of string comparison between names of Node1 and Node2

descr.p: DefaultTreeViewSort - returns result of string comparison between names of Node1 and Node2.
DefaultTreeViewSort compares the text of two TreeNodes and returns the following result:

dl.dd: if Node1.Text<Node2.Text.
if Node1.Text=Node2.Text.
if Node1.Text>Node2.Text.

descr.p: The comparison takes into account ANSI characters, i.e. it takes care of accented characters. Unlike AnsiCompareText, the comparison is case sensitive.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EraseBackground
element.short: Has an empty implementation in the current LCL version.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetHitTestInfoAt
element.short: GetHitTestInfoAt - returns the result of a hit test at the point (X, Y).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeAt
element.short: Searches all expanded nodes for the tree node at the specified position.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeAt.Result
element.short: Visible tree node at the specified position, or Nil when not found.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeAt.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the the node or row.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetNodeAt.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the tree node or row.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetInsertMarkAt
element.short: GetInsertMarkAt - find if there is an insert mark at the specified coordinates.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SetInsertMark
element.short: SetInsertMark - place an Insert mark at the specified node in the tree.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SetInsertMarkAt
element.short: SetInsertMarkAt - place an insert mark at the specified coordinates.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Invalidate
element.short: Causes the control to be redrawn when a redraw is not already in progress.

descr.p: Invalidate is an overridden method in TCustomTreeView, and causes the control to be redrawn if it is not already re-painting. Invalidate checks the States property for the tvsPainting flag. When present, the Paint method has already been called but not yet completed.
No actions are performed in the method when a paint operation is in progress.
Invalidate calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsEditing
element.short: Indicates if the control is currently editing a node in the tree.

descr.p: IsEditing is a Boolean function used to determine whether the control is currently editing a node in the tree view. IsEditing checks the values in the State property for the tvsIsEditing flag value. The return value is True when tvsIsEditing is present in the States property.
When present, the BeginEditing method has been called and the EndEditing method has not yet been called.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.IsEditing.Result
element.short: True if the tvsIsEditing flag is present in States.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.BeginUpdate
element.short: Starts an update process for the tree view control.

descr.p: BeginUpdate is a method used to start an update process for the tree view control. BeginUpdate is used with EndUpdate to maintain update counters used to consolidate updates and event notifications in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.EndUpdate
element.short: Finishes an update process for the tree view control.

descr.p: EndUpdate is a method used to finish an update process for the tree view control. EndUpdate is used with BeginUpdate to maintain update counters used to consolidate updates and event notifications in the control.
EndUpdates raises an Exception (catchable in the debugger) if the internal update counter is 0 or less when the method is called.
EndUpdates calls the EndUpdate method in the Items container. UpdateScrollBars is called to refresh the position in the visible scrollbars when a change actually occurred in the list of tree nodes.

element.errors: Raises an Exception if the internal update counter is 0 or less when the method is called.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.FullCollapse
element.short: Collapses all nodes in the tree view and displays only the root for the tree.

descr.p: Visits all top-level tree nodes in the Items property and calls their Collapse method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.FullExpand
element.short: Expands all nodes in the tree view.

descr.p: Visits all top-level tree nodes in Items and calls their Expand method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.LoadFromFile
element.short: Load tree view data from the specified file.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.LoadFromStream
element.short: Loads tree view data from the specified stream.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SaveToFile
element.short: Saves the tree view data to the specified file.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SaveToStream
element.short: Saves the tree view data to the specified stream.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.WriteDebugReport
element.short: WriteDebugReport - used for debugging.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.LockSelectionChangeEvent
element.short: LockSelectionChangeEvent - if the selection has changed, lock its status.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.UnlockSelectionChangeEvent
element.short: UnlockSelectionChangeEvent - unlock a selection to allow it to be changed.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetFirstMultiSelected
element.short: GetFirstMultiSelected - returns the first node from a multiple selection.
element.descr: This works only if tvoAllowMultiSelect is enabled.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetLastMultiSelected
element.short: Gets the last tree node added to a multi-selection in the Items for the controls.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.GetLastMultiSelected.Result
element.short: Last tree node in a multi-selection.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Select
element.short: Makes the specified node(s) become selected in the control.

descr.p: Select is an overloaded method used to make a node, array of nodes, or list of nodes become selected in the tree view control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Select.Node
element.short: Tree node assigned to Selected in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Select.ShiftState
element.short: Shift state for the selection; Shift assumes multi-selection is enabled.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Select.Nodes
element.short: Array or TList with TTreeNode instances to add to the Selections in the control; assumes multi-select is enabled.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SelectionVisible
element.short: SelectionVisible - returns True if a selection is visible.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MakeSelectionVisible
element.short: MakeSelectionVisible - method for making a selection visible.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ClearInvisibleSelection
element.short: Clears selected tree node(s) in the control if they are not visible.

descr.p: If MultiSelect has been enabled in the Options for the control, the ClearMultiSelection method in Items is called to clear the values in the Selections property. Otherwise the Selected property for the TTreeNode instance in Selected is set to False (which makes the Selected property unassigned).
No action are performed if MultiSelect has not been enabled and Selected has not been assigned.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.StoreCurrentSelection
element.short: Creates and fills a TStringList with the text for the selected nodes in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.StoreCurrentSelection.Result
element.short: TStringList instance with the selected nodes in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ApplyStoredSelection
element.short: Selects the first node with text matching a value in the specified list.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ApplyStoredSelection.ASelection
element.short: TStringList with the text for nodes selected in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ApplyStoredSelection.FreeList
element.short: True if the TStringList instance is freed in the method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveToNextNode
element.short: Moves the selection to the next tree node following the last selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveToNextNode.ASelect
element.short: True if the next node becomes selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveToPrevNode
element.short: Moves the selection to the visible tree node following prior to the last selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveToPrevNode.ASelect
element.short: True if the previous node becomes selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MovePageDown
element.short: Moves the selection to the next display page for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MovePageDown.ASelect
element.short: True if the node becomes selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MovePageUp
element.short: Moves the selection to the previous display page for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MovePageUp.ASelect
element.short: True if the node becomes selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveHome
element.short: Moves to and optionally selects the first visible node in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveHome.ASelect
element.short: True if the node is selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveEnd
element.short: Moves to and optionally selects the last expanded child node in Items.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MoveEnd.ASelect
element.short: True if the node is selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.BackgroundColor
element.short: Color of background area of control.

descr.p: Contains the same value as the Color property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.BottomItem
element.short: Last visible tree node starting at the TopItem in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Color
element.short: Color used for the control display area.

descr.p: The default value for the property is clWindow. Contains the same value as the BackgroundColor property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DefaultItemHeight
element.short: Default height for tree nodes in the control.

descr.p: DefaultItemHeight is an Integer property with the default height for tree nodes displayed in the control. The default value for the property is defined in the DefaultTreeNodeHeight constant, and assigned in the constructor for the class instance.

When tvoAutoItemHeight has been included in the Options for the control, the property value is determined using the Font and the images for the control. A new value assigned to the property is ignored when automatic item height has been enabled.

The value may be changed when a layout adjustment policy is applied in DoAutoAdjustLayout, or when the UpdateDefaultItemHeight method is called. It is also updated (if needed) when values are assigned to the Images or StateImages properties.
Setting a new value for the property causes the control to be redrawn.
DefaultItemHeight is the value used in the TTreeNode.Height property for tree nodes added to the Items container.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.DropTarget
element.short: DropTarget - the target node for dropping a dragged item.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignColor
element.short: Color used to paint expand/collapse (fold/unfold) symbol (i.e. plus/minus symbol).

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignSize
element.short: Size of expand/collapse (fold/unfold) symbol.

descr.p: Use 0 for the auto-sized value.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ExpandSignType
element.short: Sets the shape for the expand/collapse (fold/unfold) symbols.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Images
element.short: Image list which holds icons for the tree nodes in Items.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ImagesWidth
element.short: Width for the Images used in the tree view control.

descr.p: ImagesWidth is an Integer property which contains the width for the Images assigned in the control. ImagesWidth provides the value that is scaled to the Pixels Per Inch setting in the Font property when Images have been assigned for the control.
The default value for the property is 0 (zero), and indicates that an explicit image width has not been assigned.
Setting a new value for the property causes the control to the redrawn.
ImagesWidth is used in the DoPaintNode method to retrieve the scaled image resolution for the bitmaps in Images.
Use StateImagesWidth to set the width for the bitmaps in the StateImages property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.InsertMarkNode
element.short: InsertMarkNode - place a marker on the specified node.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.InsertMarkType
element.short: InsertMarkType - the type of marker to be inserted.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Items
element.short: The container with the TTreeNode instances used in the control.

descr.p: Items is a TTreeNodes property with the container used to access and maintain the hierarchical list of TTreeNode instances displayed in the tree view control.
Items allows indexed access to the TTreeNode instances in the container by their ordinal position. For example:
Methods in Items can be used to access and maintain the tree nodes and their hierarchy, including:
See TTreeNodes for more information about the properties and methods in the container class.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.KeepCollapsedNodes
element.short: KeepCollapsedNodes - if True, the collapsed nodes are to be retained.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.MultiSelectStyle
element.short: Additional options for the MultiSelect property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Options
element.short: The set of options enabled in the tree view control.

descr.p: Options is a TTreeViewOptions property with the set of options enabled for the tree view control. TTreeViewOption contains the enumeration values allowed in the set type, and cause features and behaviors to be enabled when included in the set type.

The default value for the property is defined in the DefaultTreeViewOptions constant. Assigning a new set of values to the property may cause other property values and/or the control state to be changed, and the control may be redrawn.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.ScrollBars
element.short: Specifies the scrollbars displayed for the tree view control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Selected
element.short: The selected tree node in the control.

descr.p: Selected is a TTreeNode property which contains the selected tree node in the control. A tree node is selected when the Left or Right mouse button is clicked on the code. It can also be selected by assigning a TTreeNode instance to the property.

When a tree node is selected or unselected, the Selected property in the TTreeNode instance is updated. Use the OnChanging event handler to determine if a specific tree node can become the selected node in the control. Use the OnChange event handler to perform actions needed after the tree node is made the Selected node in the control.

Selecting a tree node forces it to become fully visible in the control. This includes expanding parent nodes to ensure that the node is visible. The OnExpanding and OnExpanded event handlers are signalled before and after actions to a given tree node.

Use the Selections property to access the list of selected tree nodes when multi-selection has been enabled in the Options for the control. Use the SelectionCount property to get the number of tree nodes in the Selections property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SelectionColor
element.short: Color used to paint the background for the selected tree node in the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SelectionCount
element.short: Number of selected nodes in the tree view.

descr.p: SelectionCount is a read-only Cardinal property with the number of selected Items in the control. SelectionCount contains the value from the SelectionCount property in Items, and indicates the number of TTreeNode instances available in the Selections property.
SelectionCount and Selections are used when the value tvoAllowMultiSelect has been included in the Options property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SelectionFontColor
element.short: Color used to draw the text for a selected item.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SelectionFontColorUsed
element.short: Indicates if the selection font color is used for selected items.

descr.p: The default value for the property is False. Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Selections
element.short: Provides indexed access to the multi-selected tree nodes in the control.

descr.p: Selections is an indexed read-only TTreeNode property which provides indexed access to the selected tree nodes in the control. Selections is relevant when tvoAllowMultiselect has been included in the Options for the control. Use SelectionCount to get the number of nodes included in the Selections property.
Use Selected when multi-selection has not been enabled for the control.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.Selections.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in the list of selected tree nodes.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.SeparatorColor
element.short: Color used to paint horizontal lines between tree nodes when enabled.

descr.p: SeparatorColor is a TColor property with the color used to paint horizontal lines between nodes in the tree hierarchy. SeparatorColor is used in the DoPaintNode method when tvoShowSeparators has been included in the Options for the control. It is assigned to the Pen and drawn using the LineTo method.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.StateImages
element.short: Image list with the bitmaps used to represent the state for nodes in the tree.

descr.p: StateImages is a TCustomImageList property which contains bitmaps used to represent the state for nodes in the tree hierarchy. Images in the list correspond to the values used in the TTreeNode.StateIndex property.

Assigning a new value for the property causes the UnregisterChanges method in the image list to be called. The RegisterChanges method in the image list is called after the new images are assigned. The value in DefaultItemHeight is updated (when needed) to use the height for the images scaled to the current PPI setting in Font. The item height will include the default item spacing needed for the images. The control is redrawn when the new image list has been assigned to the property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.StateImagesWidth
element.short: Width for the bitmaps in the StateImages property.

descr.p: StateImagesWidth is an Integer property which contains the width for the StateImages assigned in the control. StateImagesWidth provides the value that is scaled to the Pixels Per Inch setting in the Font property when StateImages have been assigned for the control.
The default value for the property is 0 (zero), and indicates that an explicit image width has not been assigned.
Setting a new value for the property causes the control to the redrawn.
StateImagesWidth is used in the DoPaintNode method to retrieve the scaled image resolution for the bitmaps in StateImages.
Use ImagesWidth to set the width for the bitmaps in the Images property.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.TopItem
element.short: TopItem - the first visible node of the tree.

descr.p: Use TopItem to get the top-most visible node. It is usually needed when tree view contains many nodes and scroll bar is required to display them all. If you need the first node of the tree regardless of visibility use Items[0].

element.name: TCustomTreeView.TreeLineColor
element.short: Color used to draw the lines which connect the nodes in the tree.

descr.p: TreeLineColor is a TColor property with the color used to draw the lines which connect the nodes in the tree. The default value for the property is clWindowFrame. Setting a new value for the property causes the control to be redrawn.

TreeLineColor is used in the DoPaintNode method to set the color for canvas pixels when psPattern is used in the TreeLinePenStyle property. This is done because the LCL does not currently support the psPattern pen style.
TreeLineColor is also used in the DoPaint method to set the pen color when rendering insert marks for the nodes in the tree hierarchy.

element.name: TCustomTreeView.TreeLinePenStyle
element.short: Style of the TPen used to draw lines used to connect nodes in the control.

descr.p: TreeLinePenStyle is a TPenStyle property which contains the pen style used to draw lines connecting the nodes in the tree. TreeLinePenStyle can contain one of the following vales:
The default value for the property is psPattern.
TreeLinePenStyle is used in the DoPaintNode method to draw the lines which connect the nodes in the tree hierarchy.

element.name: TTreeView
element.short: TTreeView is a control that displays a hierarchical list of items.

descr.p: Use a TTreeView to display a hierarchical list of items. Items are shown by their caption and an optional bitmap.

element.name: TTVGetNodeText
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to get the text for a tree node.

element.name: TTVGetNodeText.Result
element.short: Text displayed for the tree node.

element.name: TTVGetNodeText.Node
element.short: Tree node examined in the routine.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState
element.short: Class used to save and restore the expanded state of a TTreeView.

descr.p: TTreeNodeExpandedState is a class used to save and restore the expanded state of a TTreeView. The nodes are identified by their Text property.
Usage example:

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.NodeText
element.short: NodeText - the text in the current node.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.Children
element.short: Children - the children of the current node, as an AvgLvlTree.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.Clear
element.short: Clear the nodes from the tree structure.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.CreateChildNodes
element.short: CreateChildNodes - constructor for the offspring nodes.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.Apply
element.short: Used to restore the expanded state for a node or tree view.

descr.p: Apply is an overloaded procedure used to restore the expanded state for nodes in a tree structure. The overloaded variants allow either a specific tree node or the first node in the tree view to be used to reconstruct the tree structure.
CollapseToo indicates whether child tree nodes are collapsed (when True) or expanded.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.Apply.FirstTreeNode
element.short: Initial tree node examined in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.Apply.TreeView
element.short: Tree view with nodes examined in the method.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.Apply.CollapseToo
element.short: Collapses previously expanded child nodes when True.

element.name: TTreeNodeExpandedState.OnGetNodeText
element.short: Event handler signalled to get the text for the specified tree node.

descr.p: OnGetNodeText is a TTVGetNodeText property with the event handler signalled to get the text for the tree node passed as an argument. It is signalled from the CreateChildNodes method when the tree node has a parent node, or when expanding its child nodes. It is also signalled from the Apply method to get the text for an expanded child node.

element.name: THeaderSectionState
element.short: Enumerated type which represents selection states for THeaderSection.

descr.p: THeaderSectionState is the type used to implement the THeaderSection.State property.

element.name: THeaderSectionState.hsNormal
element.short: The header section is drawn in its normal state.

element.name: THeaderSectionState.hsHot
element.short: The header section is drawn in its "hot-lighted" state.

element.name: THeaderSectionState.hsPressed
element.short: The header section is drawn in its "pressed" state.

element.name: THeaderSection
element.short: Implements a section displayed on a TCustomHeaderControl / THeaderControl instance.

descr.p: THeaderSection is a TCollectionItem descendant which implements a section displayed on a TCustomHeaderControl / THeaderControl instance. THeaderSection is the type added and maintained in the THeaderSections collection, and used in the TCustomHeaderControl.Sections property.

THeaderSection has properties which identify its visual characteristics. This includes the text displayed for the section, its alignment, minimum and maximum widths, and an index for an optional image. Other properties contain run-time information about the section, including its left and right coordinates and its display state.

THeaderSection instances are normally created at design-time and edited using the IDE object inspector. They can be created at run-time using methods in the THeaderSections collection, and edited in code.

element.name: THeaderSection.GetWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the Width property.

element.name: THeaderSection.GetWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.GetLeft
element.short: Gets the value for the Left property.

element.name: THeaderSection.GetLeft.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.GetRight
element.short: Gets the value for the Right property.

element.name: THeaderSection.GetRight.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetAlignment
element.short: Sets the value for the Alignment property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetAlignment.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetMaxWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the MaxWidth property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetMaxWidth.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetMinWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the MinWidth property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetMinWidth.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetState
element.short: Sets the value for the State property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetState.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetText
element.short: Sets the value for the Text property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetText.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetVisible
element.short: Sets the value for the Visible property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetVisible.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the Width property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetWidth.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageIndex property.

element.name: THeaderSection.SetImageIndex.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSection.CheckConstraints
element.short: Ensures that the width for the section is within its minimum and maximum values.

element.name: THeaderSection.Result
element.short: Display name for the collection item.

element.name: THeaderSection.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for THeaderSection, and calls the inherited Create method on entry. The value in ACollection is used as the Owner of the collection item. Create sets the default values for properties in the class instance.

element.name: THeaderSection.Create.ACollection
element.short: Collection which owns the class instance.

element.name: THeaderSection.Assign
element.short: Assign - if Source is of correct type, copies properties directly, otherwise calls inherited Assign which probably raises an exception.

element.name: THeaderSection.Left
element.short: The position of the left boundary of the section.

element.name: THeaderSection.Right
element.short: The position of the right boundary of the section.

element.name: THeaderSection.State
element.short: State - whether normal, hot (i.e. mouse hovers over it ready to be selected) or pressed (selected).

element.name: THeaderSection.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - whether text is to be left or right justified or centered.

element.name: THeaderSection.ImageIndex
element.short: Index of the image in the imagelist.

element.name: THeaderSection.MaxWidth
element.short: Maximum permissible width of a section.

element.name: THeaderSection.MinWidth
element.short: Minimum permissible width of a section (default = 0).

element.name: THeaderSection.Text
element.short: The text string that is to appear in the section.

element.name: THeaderSection.Width
element.short: The Width of the section that appears on the THeaderControl.

element.name: THeaderSection.Visible
element.short: Indicates if the section is visible in the header control.

descr.p: Visible is a Boolean property which indicates if the header section is visible in the header control. When set to False, the section cannot be drawn using the TCustomHeaderControl.PaintSection method.
The default value for the property is True, as set in the constructor for the class instance.

element.name: THeaderSection.OriginalIndex
element.short: OriginalIndex - index which doesn't change when the user reorders the sections.

element.name: THeaderSectionClass
element.short: Class reference used to create new THeaderSection instances.

element.name: THeaderSections
element.short: Implements a collection for section in a TCustomHeaderControl control.

descr.p: THeaderSections is a TCollection descendant used to store sections defined for a TCustomHeaderControl instance. THeaderSections is the type used to implement the Sections property in TCustomHeaderControl.
THeaderSections re-implements methods from the ancestor class that are used to add, insert, delete, and retrieve THeaderSection instances stored in the collection.

element.name: THeaderSections.GetItem
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: THeaderSections.GetItem.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSections.GetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection for the requested item.

element.name: THeaderSections.SetItem
element.short: Sets the value for the indexed Items property.

element.name: THeaderSections.SetItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection for the affected item.

element.name: THeaderSections.SetItem.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: THeaderSections.GetOwner
element.short: Gets the Owner of the class instance.

element.name: THeaderSections.GetOwner.Result
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: THeaderSections.Update
element.short: Performs actions needed when a collection item has been changed.

descr.p: Update is an overridden method used to update the section in the header control. When Item is assigned, the UpdateSection method in the THeaderControl instance is called. If Item is unassigned (contains Nil), the UpdateSections method in the THeaderControl instance is called update all sections in the collection.
descr.remark: Update does not call the inherited method which notifies observers of the change.

element.name: THeaderSections.Update.Item
element.short: Section updated in the collection for the header control.

element.name: THeaderSections.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: THeaderSections.Create.HeaderControl
element.short: Owner of the collection.

element.name: THeaderSections.Add
element.short: Creates a new header section and adds it to the collection.
element.descr: Adds calls the AddItem method to get the return value for the method.

element.name: THeaderSections.Add.Result
element.short: Collection item created and stored in the method.

element.name: THeaderSections.AddItem
element.short: Adds the specified header section at the position specified in Index.

descr.p: The THeaderSection instance in Item is created when the argument value is Nil (unassigned). The return value contains the new header section instance, or the existing value in Item when it is assigned.

element.name: THeaderSections.AddItem.Result
element.short: Header section created (optional) and stored in the method.

element.name: THeaderSections.AddItem.Item
element.short: Header section to add in the method, or Nil to create a new one.

element.name: THeaderSections.AddItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection where the header section is stored.

element.name: THeaderSections.Insert
element.short: Inserts a new collection item at the specified position in the collection.

element.name: THeaderSections.Insert.Result
element.short: Header section created in the method.

element.name: THeaderSections.Insert.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection where the new header section is inserted.

element.name: THeaderSections.Delete
element.short: Deletes the collection item stored at the specified position in the collection.

element.name: THeaderSections.Delete.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the collection item deleted in the method.

element.name: THeaderSections.Items
element.short: Items - the series of individual HeaderSections in the collection.

descr.p: Items is an indexed THeaderSection property which provides access to the header sections in the collection by their ordinal position. It is implemented using TFpList to store the collection items. Items is the default property for the class instance.
When reading a value in the property, the item is cast to the THeaderSection type used in the collection. SetItem is called to store a value for the indexed property.

element.name: THeaderSections.Items.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the collection for the property value.

element.name: TSectionTrackState
element.short: Enumerated type with tracking states for a header section.

element.name: TSectionTrackState.tsTrackBegin
element.short: Mouse tracking for a section is enabled.

element.name: TSectionTrackState.tsTrackMove
element.short: Mouse tracking for a section drag operation is enabled.

element.name: TSectionTrackState.tsTrackEnd
element.short: Mouse tracking for a section is disabled.

element.name: TCustomSectionTrackEvent
element.short: TCustomSectionTrackEvent - generic event handling method for custom tracking a header section.

element.name: TSectionDragEvent
element.short: TSectionDragEvent - generic event handling method for dragging a header section.

element.name: TCustomSectionNotifyEvent
element.short: TCustomSectionNotifyEvent - generic event notification method for header section.

element.name: TCustomHCCreateSectionClassEvent
element.short: TCustomHCCreateSectionClassEvent - generic event handler method for custom creation of header control.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl
element.short: TCustomHeaderControl - base class for THeaderControl, a header strip of user-designed sections which allow selection of pages or actions.

descr.p: TCustomHeaderControl - base class for THeaderControl, a header strip of user-designed sections which allow selection of pages or actions.

THeaderControl offers a widget that could be placed along the edge of a Panel or Form allowing a highly customized mechanism for selection. However, there are no intrinsically associated display areas and it is the developer's responsibility to supply an index associated with the selection from the THeaderControl and determining what action is to occur or what is to be displayed in any attached Panel or Form.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.GetSectionFromOriginalIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed SectionFromOriginalIndex property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.GetSectionFromOriginalIndex.Result
element.short: value for the property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.GetSectionFromOriginalIndex.OriginalIndex
element.short: Original position (ignoring visibility) in the Sections property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SetImages
element.short: Sets the value for the Images property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SetImages.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SetImagesWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the ImagesWidth property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SetImagesWidth.AImagesWidth
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SetSections
element.short: Sets the value for the Sections property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SetSections.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.UpdateSection
element.short: Updates the control by calling Repaint.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.UpdateSections
element.short: Updates all Sections in the control by calling Repaint.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.CreateSection
element.short: Creates a new header section for the control.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.CreateSection.Result
element.short: THeaderSection instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.CreateSections
element.short: Creates the collection used to store header sections defined in the control.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.CreateSections.Result
element.short: THeaderSections instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the mouse is clicked on the specified header section.

descr.p: Signals the OnSectionClick event handler (when assigned). Called from the Click method when the mouse event occurred on the header section in the Section argument.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionClick.Section
element.short: Header section for the mouse event.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionResize
element.short: Performs actions needed to resize the specified header section.

descr.p: Signals the OnSectionResize event handler (when assigned). Called from the MouseUp method when mouse tracking has been ended for the specified Section.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionResize.Section
element.short: Header section for the resize action.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionTrack
element.short: Performs actions needed when the mouse tracking state for a header section has changed.

descr.p: Signals the OnSectionTrack event handler (when assigned). Called from the MouseDown, MouseMove, and MouseUp methods when mouse tracking is active for a section in the header control.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionTrack.Section
element.short: Header section for the mouse tracking state.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionTrack.State
element.short: New mouse tracking state for the action.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionSeparatorDblClick
element.short: Performs actions to handle a mouse double click event for the specified header section.

descr.p: Signals the OnSectionSeparatorDblClick event handler (when assigned). Called from the DblClick method when the mouse event occurs when mouse tracking has been enabled for the header control.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionSeparatorDblClick.Section
element.short: Header section for the double click mouse event.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionEndDrag
element.short: SectionEndDrag - method for emulating the OnSectionEndDrag event.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionDrag
element.short: SectionDrag - method to emulate the OnSectionDrag event.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.UpdateState
element.short: UpdateState - bring the state of the control up-to-date.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size for new instances of the class.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.SectionFromOriginalIndex
element.short: SectionFromOriginalIndex - the section as defined by the original (unchanged) index.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for TCustomHeaderControl, and calls the inherited Create on entry.
Create allocates resources needed for the Sections property by call CreateSections. It also sets the default size for the control using the values returned from GetControlClassDefaultSize.
The control style flags are updated in the method to include mouse capture and click events and to remove caption display for the control.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for TCustomHeaderControl. It ensures that resources allocated to the Sections property are freed, and calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomHeaderControl.GetSectionAt
element.short: Gets the header section at the position specified in P.

descr.p: GetSectionAt is an Integer function used to get the position for the header section found at the coordinates in P.
